story:
Nova Modum introduces GRAY HATTER #1, our first edition of our first digital comic!

In this noir story from 1930s Los Angeles, James Simon goes by the name “the Gray Hatter.” His wife kidnapped, alone and on the run from everyone who is anyone in LA, the Gray Hatter must unlock the secrets of a coded list to save his wife and himself. James finds out that when mixing black and white...you don't always come up Gray.

For certain pages of our digital comics, we will offer additional bonus content you can access online: videos, images, audio, and other interactive elements. The content you see will be based on your user level, higher levels see more content.

You'll also be able to see specialized content when you check in with your phone at various locations around Los Angeles (for now).

You can check out an example of the interactive page HERE.

You'll be able to share info and clues with friends along the way.

This is a new way to appreciate web comics which uses the rich storytelling of comics with the interactivity of the web. Visit our website here for more info. We have 2 additional comics waiting in the wings after we complete the GRAY HATTER you can browse as well. After those, we have at least 10 MORE DIGITAL COMICS AFTER THAT.

With your help, this will be the start of a new universe of characters and stories.

Why digital only? We can produce them faster, with less costs, and also it's pretty difficult to add video / interactive elements to the printed page. We tried, it wasn't pretty.

We're looking forward for your support and feedback on this project. This is very exciting for us, we want to make this project and all our future ones shine!

story:
Short Summary

Hi there! My name is Morgan, and I am the creator of "Synchronous". "What's 'Synchronous'" you might ask? "Synchronous" is a complex, character-driven drama with various sci-fi and philosophical elements thrown in for good measure. The main thrust of the story revolves around multiple worlds with the same basic setting: a Japanese scientist named Hideaki Moto invents mechanical exoskeletons that are capable of increasing a man's strength and speed tenfold, intended to help policemen, firefighters, and other people in dangerous jobs. Unfortunately, the world's militaries corrupt Moto's benevolent vision, and create weaponized versions to wage war with one another. Despite protests from Moto and the public, the United Nations does nothing, forcing Moto to enact a failsafe on his suits that requires people to have a specific gene on their "X"-chromosome to be able to pilot the machines. After enacting his failsafe, Moto disappears from the public eye. In the following years, the UN establishes testing protocols (girls at tested at the age of 8, boys are tested at the age of 13 to give the gene more time to present itself), divides the world into 5 regions (Europe, Asia, Africa, the Americas, and Oceania) and implements teaching infrastructure in all of them, and also establishes a ranking system to better gauge the ability of young pilots. The rarest of all of the rankings is "Ace", and only a handful exist around the world. The standard way to earn the ranking of "Ace" is to excel as a pilot either in combat or in the competitive tournaments that are held each year. When 5 young girls (Claudia Gilliard from Switzerland, Mei Feng from China, Narumi Nakamura from Japan, Alice Cunningham from the United Kingdom, and Claire Desrosiers from France) are found to be Natural Aces, it makes global headlines. Just as the Press is beginning to speculate that these girls could create a political power imbalance, the UN steps in and begins to raise the first discovered (Claudia Gilliard) as a child of the United Nations. Before it can do so with the other girls, their respective governments reach an agreement with the United Nations that allows them to maintain custody of their Aces. Years later, a Male Ace is discovered in America, and the American government goes to great and questionable lengths to keep their most recent national treasure under wraps. The only things that the press are allowed to know are that he is a male Ace, and he will attend the prestigious International Valkryie Institution once it opens. Thus begins a journey that will ultimately change the fate of the two worlds, but while the two worlds may share a setting, their differences cause them to play out very differently. It's a truly unique story, totally unlike anything the world has ever seen before.

What We Need & What You Get

The story is entirely planned out. The only thing holding us back is a lack of funding. I can't in good conscience ask Aaron (the amazing artist on the project) to help me publish this for free, and I certainly can't expect him to dedicate his time and energy to a free project when he also has school to worry about. We need money so that we can actually afford to pursue this venture while we're in school, and we have a lot of cool things to offer for your help.

  • All of the money that you donate goes directly to art and labor costs, helping us create a really incredible story.
  • We have a lot of different perks to offer you for your support; ranging from small things like exclusive concept art to big things like special previews or even the chance to have your own character!
  • Even if you can't give much, every little bit is appreciated, and your money will be used to bring this amazing story to life.

The Impact

"Synchronous" is an expansive and revolutionary story that could change the way we think about storytelling. It explores deep themes about individuality, uniqueness, and the morality of conflict. It also raises questions about trying to find your place in the world, the importance of family, and the distinctions between good & bad.

Risks & Challenges

The main enemy of this project is apathy, and that is something I refuse to get in the way.
  • "Synchronous" has been in the works for two years already, I'm not going to suddenly lose interest now.
  • Both Aaron and myself are fully committed to this project, and there is no chance of us giving up.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't give anything. If you can't help us monetarily, please help us some other way.
  • Please share the campaign with people that you think would be interested! Help us get the word out!
  • And be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
For the last couple years Destiny City Comics has not only been a place for people to purchase comic books and graphic novels, it's also been very active in community events. DCC has supported and participated in everything from the Tacoma Pride Festival to the Jet City Comic Show, along with hosting their own events. Now Destiny City Comics is on the verge of closing it's doors, but a dynamic duo seeks to save this pillar of the city of Tacoma.

Tacoma native and professional wrestler, Ethan HD along his wife Stephanie will be using the funds raised, in addition to their own to purchase Destiny City Comics to keep it functioning as a junction for all things comic book related while continuing it's legacy in serving the community of Tacoma.

The shop is currently set to close its doors by October 31, during the month of their five-year anniversary, so we must move quickly to keep the doors open without too much interruption of day-to-day business

(FYI: Due to a miscalculation. The long boxes can only hold 320-350 comics. If this is a deal breaker for those who've already purchased, we can either refund your donation or find another way to make it up to you.)

.

story:
Short Summary

Hello Everyone, Cesar "El Guapo" Feliciano here to let you know a little something about myself.

I have been making comics in the independent market for nearly 26 years. From horror comics Like the Captain's Jolting Tales and Full Moon Craze to Super Hero comics like The Red Ten I just love making comics!

I love to tell stories and have told other peoples stories for a long time. Now I am focused on creating my own comics, with characters that have lived in my own head and heart. Chango is the first of my creator-owned comic that I want to share with you all. It is a story with heart, humor, and horror, based on actual events from my childhood.

It is a personal story but relatable to all comics fans that have experienced the bond of a mother's love for her child.

In order to make sure that this story gets told in the best way possible, I have enlisted a few friends. First up is the writer and co-creator Ben Goldsmith, writer and creator of The Seance Room,  Ben has been writing for a long time and creates a beautiful tapestry with his characterizations that bring them all to life. On colors, we have the colorist for the Action Labs and Ringo Award-nominated hit Spencer and Lock. Rounding out the team is letterer Justin Birch who has lettered books for IDW and Action Labs.

What We Need & What You Get

I'll keep it very simple here if you missed out on the first campaign I am making available the opportunity for you to get your hands on your own copy of Chango The Broken Veil part 1.

That is a 56-page full-color Graphic novel so you can join us on this special journey.

If we hit a certain goal I may introduce some stretch goals but we'll have to see how that goes.

The Impact

Your contributions will help me to get this story out to a greater and wider audience. I initially attempted to run the campaign here on Indiegogo but things did not go as planned so the decision was made to go over to Kickstarter to see if we could fund there.

Many stepped up to the plate to make the initial campaign successful over on Kickstarter and we met and exceeded our goal. 

While happy for the successful funding I felt as if there was a section of the audience that did not get served. Perhaps I did not do a good enough job promoting my IndieGoGo campaign. This is why I am here to give it another go and with your help, I can get this book into the hands of new fans.

Risks & Challenges

There are not really any risks other than missing out on this second chance to get Chango! The book will be printed. The art is done, The colors are almost complete and the lettering is well on its way. I simply want to get the book into more hands and I know it can be added into the print run when it is time.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that times and circumstances are different for all people. If you can contribute and be a part of the team then great! If however you cannot, sharing on your social media is another great way that you can be a part of team Chango!

I look forward to all the great stories over this campaign. 

Your boi "El Guapo"

story:
Short Summary

 

  •  My name is Robert and I'm a comic book creator based in London. I've worked on several comics so far.
  •  Black Duchess is a really cool story that I came up with when I was trapped in quarantine. I knew that when it was over I wanted to create something meaningful. More than even people need something to be inspired by, something fun that can keep peoples minds off of all the terrible things that are going on in the world.  To excite people and make them laugh that is my main concern. People need to learn how to have fun again. 
  •  Contributors to Black Duchess will have a direct impact in supporting independent comic books. The comic book industry is dominated by monopolies stacked on top of monopolies. It's enough of a statement to be helping more art be created. 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  •  The funding is going towards paying the artist thats drawing and colouring the book.  Whatever is left over will go towards printing the book and helping me get to comic-cons to sell it. 
  • Perks will include sketches, original art and signed printed copies of the book. The coolest perk will be sketches of unfinished panels so you can see how the sausage gets made. 
  • If the goal is not reached then the money will still be put towards the book. The book might take longer to finish however. 

The Impact

  • Comics is an industry with a high bar to entry in terms of costs and time. This is the main reason why independent comics have never really become a consistent pipeline for entry into the industry. Unlike in film there are no comic festivals for small budget products.  This is why anyone who values art or undermining large corporations should consider contributing to Black Duchess.
  • My track record is proven. I've made three graphic novels, I know how to put together a team and see the project through to completion.  This is not a project that will spend years in development. 
  • If people don't make a conscious effort to support art then anything not created by monopolies will cease  to exist. 

Risks & Challenges

 

  • The main challenge is money.  Making comics is expensive and it's a pretty niche industry so selling the book to non-fans is difficult. 
  • My plan for selling the book is to focus on younger readers. for many years the comics industry has neglected young readers to focus on middle-aged readers. I think this is an unsustainable paradigm and one that needs to be shifted away From. Also I want to focus on a more diverse audience than the traditional stereotypical readership. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • if you can't contribute but still want to help then I encourage you to share this campaign with your friends. word of mouth can be just as important for a successful book as monetary assistance.

story:
New cover for Omega Burakku

Logo By Bob Stone of IRIBIS Creative Solutions

 

IRIBIS Creative Solutions 

Is a studio that takes on every part of media production 

including but not limited to:

traditional comic book art (penciling & inking)

;digital (coloring & lettering)

logo designs, graphics & animation.

​

Synopsis

The great kingdom of Planet Omega houses the Omega Stream, a mysterious energy force that grants immeasurable powers. This planet is ruled by the Orion family, led by the eldest Jafar and his younger siblings, all of whom possess a connection to the Omega Stream. We join this story during a pivotal time in Planet Omega’s history; the dawn of the next generation and the twilight of the previous one. Conflict stirs between siblings while a child enters the world, unaware of the burden of responsibility that has been thrust upon him.

 

Meet the Orion Family

 

Art by: Ed Jiménez (Available in the Omega God Gold Pack)

 

OMEGA BURAKKU VOLUME 1 MANGA PAGES: 

 

 

Action Panels

                            

 

Meet the Fellas

 

Christopher Brown Writer and Creator of Omega Burakku: Raised in South Carolina, now residing in San Francisco, Chris L. Brown is the author of the manga series Omega Burakku. Omega Burakku tells the story of the Omega Stream, a mysterious energy that grants immeasurable powers, and the conflicts within the Orion family, a family with a deep connection to this force. Chris is also the owner of the small production company Fool’s Entertainment, publishers of Omega Burakku.

 

 

Ed Jiménez  Comic book and Concept Artist: I make comic covers, mangas, character designs, and more.  Some of my published work:  Unit 44 by AlternaComics  Ricanstruction: La Borinqueña by DC Comics  The scout by 4th Monkey Anthology  Clockwork Watch: Evolution by Clockwork Watch Films  And many more!!  Instagram: @edj_art Facebook: @ArtofEdJ Twitter: @edj_art Email: edjimenez.art@gmail.com

 

 

Eric Weathers Letterer of Omega Black:  a letterer and artist working in independent comics. He’s worked on such books as Cyberfrog: Unfrogettable Tales, Jawbreakers, and Graveyard Shift. He also letters books for Allegiance Arts and Entertainment. Eric is also the creator and artist on his new series Battle Brick Road, currently funding on Indiegogo.

           

  • $4,000 STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED: All Backers will receive a audio version of Omega Burakku. 
  • $10,000 STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED: All Backers will receive the Omega Burakku Trading Card.
  • $25,000 STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED: All Backers will receive the colored version of Omega Burakku. 

             

                  

  • A stretch goal is a new goal you set for your campaign in case you exceed your initial funding goal, and is generally used to finance another specific aspect of your project.

story:
IT'S ALIVE! is proud to finally collect all five issues of COMBAT we have published individually over the last few years.  Originally published in the 1960's by Dell, we have been bringing them back into print, issue by issue, after all these years.  Each issue has been lovingly cleaned up and restored by Allan Harvey, and we have added new content to each issue, including new covers by an all-star line-up of artists (seen below), and new historical essays about WWII and COMBAT.  After many requests for a collection, we decided it was time!  This new collection contains five issues of COMBAT, which includes Pearl Harbor, Dunkirk, Midway, Battle for Britain, and D-Day.  Filled with over 250 pages of World Word II greatness, this hard cover collection is a must-have!

Each issue of COMBAT features true stories from World War II, illustrated by comic book legend, WWII veteran, and Eisner Award-nominee Sam Glanzman!

You can also pick up a copy of this collection signed by Sam Glanzman's widow, Sue Glanzman!

 

THESE ARE THE ISSUES OF COMBAT INCLUDED IN THIS COLLECTION. . .

 

The Pearl Harbor issue features the story "Pearl Harbor," plus the back-up stories "Defeat of the Spanish Armada" and "A Deadly Weapon".

 

The Dunkirk issue features the stories "Dunkirk," "Channel Battle," and "Last to Leave".  Plus the back-up story "One by Sea" and the 1-page stories "A Most Deadly Air Raid" and "The First Aircraft Carrier".

 

The Midway issue features the main story "Battle of Midway" plus the back-up story "Out the Gate", and the 1-page story "High Ground".

 

The Battle for Britain issue features the stories "Wreck the R.A.F.!", "Strike the Fighter Fields!", and "The Decisive Days".  Plus the back-up story "The Puny, Little Yank".

 

The D-Day issue features the main story "The Normandy Invasion," plus the back-up story, "The Train to Nowhere," and the 1-page story "Secret Weapon".

 

THIS IS THE VARIANT COVER GALLERY INCLUDED IN THIS COLLECTION. . .

 

Pearl Harbor variant cover by Dave Dorman

 

Dunkirk variant cover by Walter Simonson

 

Midway variant cover by Russ Heath

 

Battle for Britain variant cover by John McCrea

 

D-Day variant cover by Russ Braun

 

THIS IS THE RETRO COVER GALLERY INCLUDED IN THIS COLLECTION. . .

Pearl Harbor retro cover

 

Dunkirk retro cover

 

Midway retro cover

 

Battle for Britain retro cover

 

D-Day retro cover

 

AND THESE ARE JUST A FEW OF THE RETRO ADS INCLUDED IN THIS COLLECTION. . .

 

Also included in this collection are thought-provoking new essays about WWII, COMBAT and Sam Glanzman by Steven Fears, Dean Webb, Alex Dueben, John Freeman, and Richard J. Arndt.

And incredible vintage essays about General John Pershing, Lord Gort, General George Patton Jr., The Dolittle Raiders, and General Omar N. Bradley.

 

At $40 per book, we will need to sell 125 copies to hit our funding goal of $5000.  We are asking for this amount to cover printing and shipping costs, which won't be cheap for a 250 page, hard cover book like this.  But we are confident that there must be at least 125 people out there who love war comics, Sam Glanzman, or both, and who would happily part with $40 to own a copy of this amazing collection.

You can also pick up a copy of this collection signed by Sam Glanzman's widow, Sue Glanzman!

 

Finally, enjoy this story from the D-DAY issue of COMBAT, entitled "The Train to Nowhere".  Aside from being a great little read, I hope this preview will act as an example of the type of professional clean-up and restoration work that has been done on every issue of this series by Allan Harvey. 

 

 

 

 

Thank you so much for visiting our campaign.  Above all else, we hope to keep the work of Sam Glanzman alive, by delivering this powerful 250+ page collection to as many people as possible!

them back into print, issue by issue, after all these years.  Each issue has been lovingly cleaned up and restored by Allan Harvey, and we have added new content to each issue, including new covers by story:
It's Not Too Late 

COVID-19, the coronavirus, is spreading around the world. Many governments have been slow to take appropriate actions to protect public health. Many private citizens still don't understand the danger to them and their loved ones. Misinformation is everywhere. 

Many people find themselves working from home. For those of you who don't know us, we're Hugh and Nicole, a husband and wife, artist and writer team based in Ottawa, Canada. As working comics artists, we're used to sitting around the house, but we've rarely felt so frustrated, so powerless. We want to do something to help get the word out with a short, full colour, digital comic that can be shared on social media, sent in e-mails and displayed in public areas. We're thinking of something 3-5 pages long, depending on the success of this crowdfunded, that covers what the virus is, its recent history, how to prevent it, what kind of a response we need from policymakers, and what we can do for each other. 

We're hoping that we can spread the word about the dangers of the virus, and the importance of social distancing, as quickly as possible. We know from experience that comics reach audiences that other media can't. We do this for a living and we're confident we can do a great job.  We want to provide a resource to help people answer questions, a handout to influence public discussion and hey, a beautiful piece of art while we're at it. 

We Need Your Help

We're not asking for much. Since this is urgent, we're looking to be paid $400 a page in Canadian dollars, which is much less than our current professional rate. Research, writing and illustration take between 20-25 hours per page, so this works out to about $17 an hour for us. For research, we'll rely on Health Canada and the CDC for information about the virus and best practices. For background on how it's developed in Italy, we'll rely on credible news organizations. The final section, on making a difference, will come from our own activist networks. 

For the comic to make sense, we think it needs to be three pages long:

1) A page about the virus and its effects on people
2) A page about its impact in Italy
3) A page about what people can do to help.

Ideally, we would like to make the comic five pages long. This means we're hoping to raise at least $1,200 CDN, and ideally $2,000 CDN, to cover the cost of our labor. If we can raise $2,000, then we'll add two more pages. Page 3 will become about social distancing, hand-washing etc, and we'll add

4) A page explaining that the government needs to invest in health care, close workplaces, ban evictions and suspend rent and mortgage payments. 

5) A page about the kind of social solidarity work people are already doing to support one another, and what folks can do to get involved in that work. 

As long as we raise at least $400, we'll produce a one page comic with a compressed message. We're confident we can do better than that, but if we don't, we'll refund donations. Over that amount, we'll produce another page for every $400 til we get to $2,000. 

That's already a lot, and we'd be thrilled to hit our goal! But if we're able to pass it, for every additional $400 we raise, we'll do a short one-page comic spotlighting an inspiring example of social solidarity or community care related to this crisis. We know that there are amazing people putting their time and energy into helping their neighbours survive and we'd be honoured to spotlight that work.

There's A Lot At Stake

This comic is only a small part of the enormous global effort it's going to take to contain the virus. But as people take to social media to brag about how they're still going to bars and many workplaces remain open, it's clear that many people still don't understand how dangerous this situation is. Supporting this comic, even a little bit, can help us go a long way towards encouraging people and governments to respond appropriately.  

We know things are urgent - that's why this crowdfunder is ten days long instead of the usual month. But we won't wait for the crowdfunder to end - we'll start work on the project as soon as we've raised enough money to cover the first three pages.  

Everyone Can Help A Little Bit, As A Treat

We know that this is a rough time for a lot of people financially, and it threatens to get a lot worse if the outbreak isn't contained. But even if you're short on funds you can still help a lot! Share the link to this crowdfunded on your social media and encourage people to donate if you think they have the means. And stay tuned because when the comic's done, we're hoping to spread it far and wide. We'll need your help with that, too.

story:
Malevolent Rising Rages on!

Malevolent Rising Book 5 continues the story of an alien who has come to Earth to escape from The Sovereignty, a powerful intergalactic empire bent on universal domination! Our heroes backs are against the wall as a new threat emerges.  

I've also put together a sketchbook that features concept drawings, behind the scenes content, never before seen art and unused content from the comic!

Cover A

Cover B

Sketchbook

 

Pages

story:
THE ADVENTURE CONTINUES!

Your favorite space trucker has some great surprises in store for you in this next installment of the Captain Luv series. Chapter 2 takes Captain Luv on a sketchy delivery to a secret location with some interesting characters. 
 

"CAPTAIN LUV: RISE OF THE PIRATE KING" - Chapter 2 is 24 beautiful full color pages and the second of 6 chapters. Each chapter ranges from 24 to 32 pages in length. This is part of an ongoing series featuring Captain Luv.

YOU'LL FALL IN LOVE WITH LUV!


THIS BOOK IS RATED 'MATURE'. There is sex, violence, profanity, nudity, and other mature themes. This book is not designed for children.
 

DOMESTIC SHIPPING FREE ON ALL PERKS
(SHIPS FREE IN THE USA)
  

CHAPTER 2 COVER ART

 

WHO IS CAPTAIN LUV?

Captain Luv is a space trucker and a former war hero. Accompanied by a rogue artificial intelligence, named SPAID, he reluctantly finds himself on adventures that could affect the course of the solar system. 

"Captain Luv: RISE OF THE PIRATE KING" - CHAPTER 2 is completed and will go to print at the completion of the campaign. Backers can expect delivery starting in November 2020.
  

CHAPTER 2 INTERNAL ART PREVIEW

 

11x17 POSTERS

Captain Luv by Vinnie Tartamella

 

Captain Luv by Andrea Bormida

 

Captain Luv & Jean by Henry Ponciano

 

Jean by Henry Ponciano

 

From Venus With Luv by Peter Gilmore

 

Captain Luv by Pat Maxton

 

T-SHIRTS

Chapter 2 Cover Art




Luv To The Rescue




All You Need Is Luv


 

ABOUT THE TEAM

AUTHOR & CREATOR

Drew Eash: Writer, Musician, Marketing professional 
 

ILLUSTRATOR

Andrea Bormida: 30 years experience and recently worked on the successful B&W Italian comic Nathan Never.
 

COLORIST

Slamet Mujiono: Extremely talented gentleman
 

COVER ARTIST

Henry Ponciano: Experienced illustrator. 

 

STRETCH GOALS

$3000 - Trading Card

$5000 - Pinup 

$10,000 - Button & Sticker Set

$15,000 - ? To Be Announced ?

$20,000 - ? To Be Announced ?

$25,000 - ? To Be Announced ?

$35,000 - ? To Be Announced ?

(Stretch Goals guaranteed ONLY to people who back prior to printing)

story:
An annoying goth princess haunts the rookie train conductor who ran her over. She says her death was murder made to look like suicide, and she can't cross over until he helps solve her case. We have printed issues #1-5 and continue to look for more support for this paranormal mystery series. Tickets please!

Despite some pretty mature, heavy-hitting themes (crime, suicide,  railroad safety) the series is a comedy about two people who wouldn't  like each other under normal circumstances--much less paranormal--but  have to find a way to work together if they ever want to be free of each  other. Script for the entire series  is complete and we'll be rolling straight into Issue #6 after we're  funded. This series is happening, people, but we need YOU to help us get to the other side!

New to the series? Keep scrolling to check out preview of pages below!

M.C., a train engineer, is haunted by the ghost of a young woman, Nina, who dies after throwing herself in front of his commuter train. Nina was alone when she was hit yet she insists she is the victim of a murder made to look like a suicide. It doesn’t help that Nina and M.C.’s personalities clash. Big time.

 

Worried he's going crazy and the girl is merely a figment of his guilty conscience, M.C. finds a support group for train operators suffering post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD.) Nina accompanies him to the group, all the while insisting she is real. But soon, MC and Nina discover they are not alone: all the conductors in the group are also being haunted by people they killed. Some were admitted suicides, some were unfortunate accidents, but all the ghosts are having trouble figuring out what they need to do to “cross over.” Instead of PTSD, the support group is paranormal “couples counseling” as the ghosts and engineers try to figure out how to conduct the ghosts to their final rest. 

M.C. tries to play along but Nina's unfinished business is convincing him there's a murderer on the loose

Who will love CROSSING?

  • Fans of comic series like EXORSISTERS, GOTH GHOST GIRL, HOUSE OF MYSTERY and BALTIMORE, or Television series like BEING HUMAN, PARANORMAL, GHOST BROTHERS.
  • People who like comedic odd-couples with a paranormal twist: Sam and Oda Mae Brown from GHOST, Lydia Deetz and BEETLEJUICE.  Also, people who like misfit ensembles : SCOOBY DOO, DOCTOR WHO, STRANGER THINGS.
  • Comic readers who like a combination of serious themes (suicide, PTSD, railroad safety) with their mystery and ensemble comedy.
  • Fans of our artistic team: you’ve seen Alex Cormack deliver gore like no other in series like ROAD OF BONES (IDW) and SINK (ComixTribe); CROSSING is far lighter fare, but Alex's edges are sharp as ever. Mark Mullaney is the creator of the deadly-yet-adorable NINJA BEAR from Red Stylo, and is making our ghosts literally pop off the page with production for the variant this issue.

What Exactly Do You Get When You Back This Campaign?

CROSSING #5 is the newest issue in the series, a 28-page full color comic, printed in the United States.

Digital backers can choose to receive the regular edition PDF of the comic (story only,) or the DELUXE PDF with guest art gallery, scripts, and/or character designs and behind-the-scenes details.

At highest levels, opportunities to get custom sketches, stories, signed copies, and the chance to appear in CROSSING #6!

 

Enrica Jang (writer) is the writer and creator of AZTECA, Angel With a Bullet, The House of Montresor, and editor of the annual Red Stylo Presents  series of anthologies. Her screenplay "The Freshmen" was made into a short film, Frienemies, winner of a CINE Golden Eagle in 2011. She'll be bringing a new series, HAPPY ENDINGS, to Kickstarter next year. 

 

Alex Cormack (artist) is an illustrator  living in Tyngsboro MA with his wife, Ashley, and three cats Danger,  Destruction, and Disaster. He was an independent animator before diving into comics. He has worked with many publishers such as ComixTribe,  Bliss on Tap, Red Stylo Media as well as numerous freelance writers, and  has been published by Image comics and IDW. For more info please look  at his website www.AlexCormack.com

 

Mark Mullaney (color, letters) is a three-time Emmy-nominated animator and artist from Boston,  Massachusetts. See more of his work at  landofthedisinterested.tumblr.com.

 

ISSUE #1

After a meet-cute with a locomotive, DARC train engineer, M.C. Tejada, is haunted by the ghost of Nina Goldman, a goth girl with a grudge. He says her death was suicide, She knows she was murdered, and not by the poor guy who ran her over. The  relationship is a roller coaster of pain for both parties, but Nina is  convinced she would never have killed herself and she can't cross over  until M.C. helps her solve her case.

 

ISSUE#2

The paranormal odd couple stumble onto a support group of ghosts and  hosts in the same predicament: people stuck together by circumstance and  trying to move on with their (after)lives. The hosts have a working  theory that they can find a way for the ghosts to break on through to  the other side, but nothing has done it yet. "Conscious uncoupling" gets  a whole new look as we learn more about the ghosts run to ground and  the Conductors doing their best to figure out how to help.

 

 

ISSUE #3

While Nina is focused on solving her dead/undead predicament, the  family she left behind is struggling through grief. Nicole believes her sister committed suicide and nothing and no one seems to be able to help  her cope.

 

ISSUE #4 

The ghosts begin to piece together clues that  might help two of them finally cross over. They just have to do a little  more to convince their hosts they’re onto something.

 

ISSUE #5

The plan is set in motion... until Nina's little sister crosses unwittingly into danger and some undead elements from Vince's past may threaten to derail the whole thing. Now it's up to this ad-hoc team of conductors to keep this train from flying off track. The ghosts are already dead; their living counterparts may be next!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that this is a crazy time for folks, and maybe you don't have funds to punch your ticket for CROSSING just yet. No worries, there are ways you can get a hold of CROSSING by helping us out:

  • Follow Red Stylo Media on Facebook, Twitter and Insta!
  • Share the campaign and tag @Red_stylo so we know who to thank and RT!

At highest levels, opportunities to get custom sketches, stories, signed copies, and the chance to appear in CROSSING #6!
 


Enrica Jang (writer) is the writer and creator of AZTECA, Angel With a Bullet, The House of Montresor, and editor of the annual Red Stylo Presents  series of anthologies. Her screenplay "The Freshmen" was made into a short film, Frienemies, winner of a CINE Golden Eagle in 2011. She'll be bringing a new series, HAPPY ENDINGS, to Kickstarter next year.  Alex Cormack (artist) is an illustrator  living in Tyngsboro MA with his wife, Ashley, and three cats Danger,  Destruction, and Disaster. He was an independent animator before diving into comics. He has worked with many publishers such as ComixTribe,  Bliss on Tap, Red Stylo Media as well as numerous freelance writers, and  has been published by Image comics and IDW. For more info please look  at his website www.AlexCormack.com Mark Mullaney (color, letters) is a three-time Emmy-nominated animator and artist from Boston,  Massachusetts. See more of his work at  landofthedisinterested.tumblr.com.
 

ISSUE #1
After a meet-cute with a locomotive, DARC train engineer, M.C. Tejada, is haunted by the ghost of Nina Goldman, a goth girl with a grudge. He says her death was suicide, She knows she was murdered, and not by the poor guy who ran her over. The  relationship is a roller coaster of pain for both parties, but Nina is  convinced she would never have killed herself and she can't cross over  until M.C. helps her solve her case.





 

ISSUE#2
The paranormal odd couple stumble onto a support group of ghosts and  hosts in the same predicament: people stuck together by circumstance and  trying to move on with their (after)lives. The hosts have a working  theory that they can find a way for the ghosts to break on through to  the other side, but nothing has done it yet. "Conscious uncoupling" gets  a whole new look as we learn more about the ghosts run to ground and  the Conductors doing their best to figure out how to help.

 


 


ISSUE #3
While Nina is focused on solving her dead/undead predicament, the  family she left behind is struggling through grief. Nicole believes her sister committed suicide and nothing and no one seems to be able to help  her cope.



 

ISSUE #4 
The ghosts begin to piece together clues that  might help two of them finally cross over. They just have to do a little  more to convince their hosts they’re onto something.

 
ISSUE #5
The plan is set in motion... until Nina's little sister crosses unwittingly into danger and some undead elements from Vince's past may threaten to derail the whole thing. Now it's up to this ad-hoc team of conductors to keep this train from flying off track. The ghosts are already dead; their living counterparts may be next!

 
Other Ways You Can Help
We know that this is a crazy time for folks, and maybe you don't have funds to punch your ticket for CROSSING just yet. No worries, there are ways you can get a hold of CROSSING by helping us out:

Follow Red Stylo Media on Facebook, Twitter and Insta!
Share the campaign and tag @Red_stylo so we know who to thank and RT!

story:
***SPECIAL ALERT -- CHRISTMAS CARDS ARE COMPLETELY SOLD OUT!***

As a Thank You to all of our Backers, we commissioned a custom CYBORG USA Christmas Card!

All tiers of Backers who get their orders in before the end of the campaign (November 30, 2019) will be mailed a Christmas Card! The cards will be going out ASAP, separate from the comics and other perks, so you should have something to put under the Christmas Tree!

Line art by Vic King and Colors by Eugene Betivu!


 

America's top athletes, SUPERTEAM USA, compete at the WORLD TEAM CHAMPIONSHIPS when tragedy strikes!
 


THE RED SKIRTS, an anti-globalist, terrorist death-cult, plot an attack on the spectator-filled stadium, and SUPERTEAM USA spring into action to stop the bomb!

 

Humiliated by their failure, YURI & THE RED SKIRTS have their revenge, engineering a horrific train collision that mutilates our wholesome, All-American heroes.

 

TINA, RUFUS, BIZBY, HUTCH, and CPT. USA wake up in the lab of HANZ ULRICH, the aged and mysterious scientist who has reanimated them into a team of cybernetic super-killers under the auspices of the U.S. ATTORNEY GENERAL. 

 

This is the dawn of CYBORG USA!
 

 

CYBORG USA is a comic series about a kick-ass team of wholesome elite athletes who are turned into cybernetic super-killers and forced to do the bidding of the corrupt elite.

 

CYBORG USA is ALSO a comic series about the ethical and philosophical implications of transhumanism and the transformation of individuals and society as our bodies and our minds become more dependent on technology.
 

 

WHAT IS THIS CAMPAIGN FOR?

  • This campaign will bring these characters to life in published form for the first time ever.
  • Our goal is to fully fund high-quality, first-edition print runs of the first TWO ISSUES of this entirely new series. To make this happen, we need the support of passionate COMIC BOOK FANS LIKE YOU who want to be part of bringing a new franchise to life.

 

WHERE ARE YOU IN THE PROCESS?

  • Issue #1 is complete and ready to go to print. Your contribution helps to complete the second book and to bring both issues into print.
     

 

I ONLY BUY COMICS THAT I ALREADY LIKE.

  • As passionate comic book fans, we want our story read. We are offering a FREE INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN EDITION PDF of the first issue, introducing Cyborg USA to everybody who signs up for our mailing list. Go to www.cyborgusacomic.com now!
  • We are proud of this book and we believe that when you see what we are creating in this series, you will be convinced to support our Indiegogo Campaign. We are confident that you will want a physical copy of this comic and be eager to continue the story in Issue #2.
  • As collectors ourselves, we want this campaign to yield ULTRA-PREMIUM QUALITY products that appeal to others who desire collectible issues that will be appreciated for years to come.

 

CAN I JUST WAIT FOREVER?

  • The first-print run of each of the first two issues is limited to 500 copies. That's it!

 

We want YOU as our partner in bringing the adventures of CYBORG USA to print for the first time ever!

 


WHO ARE THESE PEOPLE?


ROB CACY (writer) - A passionate comic book fan, particularly GI JOE. He has backed over 40 independent comic creators through their crowdfunding pages.
 

ZACH TABACCO (writer) – He has spent his working life helping others develop screenplays in the movie and television industry. Someday, he hopes to perfectly balance the technical perfection of Stanley Kubrick’s BARRY LYNDON with the audacious brilliance of THE TOXIC AVENGER.

 

PABLO ROMERO (artist) – Terrific artist from Argentina! He can be found on social media for commissions (Pablo Romero Art).

 

Also COLORS by LEE MILEWSKI (Issue #1), and MICHAEL BEACON (Issue #2). 

CYBORG USA LOGO designed by BOB STONE.

*****NEW!!! - CYBORG USA Issue #2 COVER for ALL BACKERS by CAANAN WHITE!

 

THINGS:

 

COMIC BOOK:

Issue #1 – 24pp Origin Story of CYBORG USA, introduction of the team, Hanz Ulrich, and The Red Skirts!

Issue #2 – 28pp Story continuing the action from the first issue. Learn more about the characters, meet their families, and witness the emergence of a major villain!

 

 

COLORING BOOK VARIANT:

A special, ultra-limited run of the 24-page origin story, printed without text or colors. Not merely a greyscale print job, this is printed from the original line art.

 

UNLIMITED EDITION:

A variant that will be available on an “unlimited” basis, meaning we’ll only print the number that people buy during the active campaign and no more. Will be HAND NUMBERED in the xxx/xxx style (e.g. 069/420).

 

T-SHIRT:

A luxurious T-shirt, woven from the finest cotton, with the powerful CYBORG USA logo emblazoned upon it in vibrant colorful color!

 


LOGO STICKER:

This one really completes the Cyborg USA experience! Excellent adhesion! Wow!
 


WALL POSTER:

A deluxe four-fold wall poster of the cover image from Issue #1 displaying the CYBORG USA TEAM!
 

CYBORGIZE YOURSELF!:

Our incredible artist, PABLO ROMERO, will take an image of you and design a CYBORG VERSION. Maybe you’ll show up as a member of CYBORG MONACO or CYBORG JAPAN.

 

Please share this campaign and tell your friends, WE NEED YOU to join CYBORG USA!

story:
Dear family and friends,
 I'm in my final year of university. I have my end of degree show in London coming up and really need to raise £150 to make it happen. All funds raised go to the hire of exhibition space, van hire, paint, walls, it really goes down to the last nails and screws. I'm exhibiting a selection of screen printed comics. The show is at the truman brewery in london on the 25th June. We have already raised a proportion of the funds as a group but it's now up to individual fundraising. 
Anything will really help at this point feel free to donate what you like
If you donate over £10 I will be giving away prints!

story:
Funko PoP and a ToP - 20%of Profits raised Goes to Homelessness In Ireland

Find us on Instagram -  popntop.inc

 

It's that simple we promise. Continue reading

 

  • My name is Wesley, And for years I've always wanted to own something that was my own and run my own business. I've been passionate like most people to leave there mark on something even if it's only small. I want my hard work and the work of my contributors to pay off for this awesome project
  • What I want to do is simple and cost effective. There are a lot of subscription services out there at the moment within the Box Industry such as loot crate and birch box. What I am doing is simple it's called PoP and ToP. I want to create a small product were people can skip the whole subscription service and not get tied down to a monthly bill. With my Idea you will be able to purchase A Funko PoP head toy and a Top at low cost in a small  box for a once off price. I am a huge gamer and a film buff and I know the importance of wanting something geeky and fun and not having to spend a lot of money for it. REMEMBER - It's cost effective and fun.
  • I have sourced my Products of Geeky fun and madness and now I need your help. I don't require thousands to be donated, I just need your help so I can spread this awesome product of Nerd and Geekiness to the world. So go on. What are you waiting for. I promise you, It will be worth it
  • 20% of all funds raised will not only be donated to help Homelessness in Ireland, But it will also help set a small and local Business, Helping to reduce unemployment and continue our passion for serving the geeks of the world

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • Your contributions will be put to great use. The funds I receive will help Purchase not only the products but it will purchase packaging and highly reduce the cost of shipping and effectively helping me to invest more money in to areas we would need to invest in. Such as Marketing, Labelling and Intense advertising to assist with putting this word out there.
  • People want Fun, They want reliable and they want to make sure they are not being taken for a fool. This Project is Done by the people for the people. With the first 3 people who donate 15.00 Euro will get there Box. That's right you will get a full box with a Funko PoP and a ToP of your size. Plus (P.S something extra as a reward for the help) Plus if you take a picture with the product when you receive it, you will be advertised as the face of our marketing. Showing the world the box of awesomeness you got. (Who doesn't love an opportunity like that)
  • Reaching a goal is hard which is why when you run a business you need to be open for the failures and road blocks along the way. The funds will be put to the same use. If the goal is not met. The funds raised so far will be invested into the same areas. Most importantly being Shipping and Marketing.
  • The Perks, Oh wow the perks. With limited availability you will receive of your choice A PoP & ToP lanyard or custom Bracelet. Each are priced at 5 Euro incl Shipping.

The Impact

 

  • This is something that I have always wanted to achieve. It's personal and nothing shouts security like a business who always strives to add the personal touch to everything we do which is why this venture will pay off. It speaks for itself and you can wake up knowing that the little venture that was once an idea, a little seed on indiegogo has now grown and flourished into something that has had a lot of work put in to it to succeed.

Risks & Challenges

 

  • Problems. It's a word that is thrown around very loosely. When you are passionate about something a problem is not just that. It's a learning curve. In order for a business to succeed it's important to know your risks. Your cons. and how ultimately you will over come this. At the time of writing. Shipping and Packaging was a big problem. It was difficult to overcome this and work around it but we did. with open contracts now available for us Using Registered Courier Services we are now able to approach this with ease and not worry about the hidden costs that would be placed on large parcels. Hey we are only a small box it actually worked out cheaper for us (By Bribing everyone with a Funko PoP), But in all seriousness we adapted and will continue to face every thing head on, Positivity is key and we will succeed.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Not everyone can donate and we here @ PoP&ToP totally understand that, So how about helping us in other ways. Sharing the love of our Geeky goodness would be great on helping us achieve exposure. Put it on Facebook, Instagram, Blogs ,you name it, you place it. We love for you guys, our hopefully soon to be valued customers to share to the world and show everyone that we mean business and we are here to make you all happy.

Thanks for reading. We hope to hear any feedback you guys may have and we hope to have your continued support along the way.

Thank you in advance from PoP&ToP

 

**

1 EURO/GBP/DOLLAR GOES A LONG WAY - Even small amounts help us grow.

Put it on Facebook, Instagram, Blogs ,you name it, you place it. We love for you guys, our hopefully soon to be valued customers to share to the world and show everyone that we mean business and we are here to make you all happy.

story:
Swords of the Swashbucklers is the brainchild of Bill Mantlo – one of Marvel Comics’ most prolific writers and the co-creator of beloved Guardians of the Galaxy sensation, Rocket Raccoon! A pirate adventure on interstellar seas, the beloved Swords of the Swashbucklers series was illustrated by the phenomenal Jackson "Butch" Guice and has not seen print in over 25 years. It’s a story that’s long overdue for preservation as a high-quality, completely remastered trade paperback. More importantly, this Indiegogo continuation of the successful Kickstarter project celebrates the far-reaching imagination of Bill Mantlo, a shining star of the comic industry whose career was tragically cut short in his prime by a hit-and-run accident. With pledges of support for Kickstarter rewards we will generate much-needed royalty income from this essential tale that will contribute to Mantlo’s continued medical care.

What is Swords of the Swashbucklers?

Writer Bill Mantlo and artist Jackson “Butch” Guice first set sail with Swords of the Swashbucklers in October 1984, courtesy of a prestige-format tale published in Marvel Graphic Novel #14. The success of their daring debut led to a bi-monthly Swashbucklers series – twelve two-fisted installments of blazing ray guns, clashing cutlasses, and creatures beyond imagination!

In Swords of the Swashbucklers, spirited teenager Domino Blackthorne Drake was just a normal girl… until she stumbled upon an alien artifact, acquired uncanny power, and became a beacon for intergalactic trouble! With her tabby cat Cap’n Kidd in tow, Domino joins the motley crew of the Starshadow – a spacefaring pirate ship captained by the charismatic and fearless Raader. Domino embarks on a cosmic odyssey to save her kidnapped parents and overthrow the evil Colonizer Empire.

Imagine a young, bright-eyed girl on a galaxy-wide escapade, full of high-energy antics straight out of Guardians of the Galaxy and Pirates of the Caribbean, and you’ve got Swords of the Swashbucklers!

Who is Bill Mantlo?

Bill Mantlo rose through the Marvel Comics ranks in the 1970s to become one of their Bullpen’s most boisterous, visionary, and dependable writers. A young man inspired by long talks with his neighbor, the legendary Jack “King” Kirby, this one-time Marvel intern had his big break in 1974 when a series writer missed a deadline for his Deadly Hands of Kung Fu script. Delivering a fill-in script almost immediately, Mantlo proved his writing chops and work ethic, and soon became an indispensable staff member known for taking on any writing challenge with enthusiasm – no matter what the concept was or how impending the deadline.

Over the next 18 years, Mantlo would write over 500 comic books for Marvel Comics, sometimes as many as eight titles a month! Among his many writing accomplishments, he wrote celebrated runs on Marvel mainstays like Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man and The Incredible Hulk, and built a well-deserved reputation as a pioneer of licensed comics. Two such titles – Micronauts and Rom: SpaceKnight – were based on toy properties with little backstory for their characters; Mantlo built entire universes around the concepts, far-flung worlds and rich personalities that remained popular with fans (and profitable for Marvel) long after the original toys disappeared from store shelves. His penchant for cosmic storytelling led to the creation of Rocket Raccoon and, of course, Swords of the Swashbucklers.

Furthermore, Mantlo stood up for the “little guy.” He championed creator rights, attempting to build a union for writers and artists. While employed at Marvel, he earned a law degree and served as a public defender. He joined social causes and participated in peaceful protests. Considering his ambition, likeable personality, and political activism, many of his peers predicted a career in government on the horizon.

What ended Bill Mantlo’s career?

On July 17, 1992, Bill Mantlo was rollerblading on the streets of New York City when he was the victim of a terrible hit-and-run accident. He suffered a closed-head brain injury that severely impaired his mobility and fine motor skills. For the past twenty years, he has resided in a Queens rehabilitation center, where he communicates in simple, labored sentences, and staff must assist with nearly all his physical activities. With unwavering support from his brother and legal guardian Mike Mantlo, as well as health care professionals, he survives a daily struggle with severe cognitive and memory impairment.

Dynamite Entertainment will publish Swords of the Swashbucklers as a full-color, fully remastered volume over 400 pages in length, containing the complete story from all thirteen issues (Marvel Graphic Novel #14, plus Swashbucklers #1-12). Restored to print for the first time in over 25 years, the Swords of the Swashbucklers collection will preserve one of Bill Mantlo’s greatest creative achievements – for the first time in its entirety – in a high-quality, durable format for readers to enjoy throughout the years.

A Few Words from Swashbucklers Co-Creator Jackson "Butch" Guice:

"I had the enormous pleasure of working with Bill Mantlo at the beginning of my own career -- and I know from personal experience the vibrant infectious enthusiasm and joy Bill had for The Swords of the Swashbucklers, and the stories we told together. This project is a wonderful way to honor Bill Mantlo's creative legacy. I hope fans -- both old and new -- support this effort, and I for one very much look forward to seeing the swashbuckling crew of the Starshadow fly once more. "

Reward Tiers:

 

Pledge $5 or more    

Digital Swords of the Swashbucklers OGN For your support at this level you will receive the Digital PDF of the 64-page Swords of the Swashbucklers Original Graphic Novel (also known as Marvel Graphic Novel #14), a subscription to the Dynamite Newsletter, and our gratitude in helping to bring this long lost piece of comic book history back to life for a new generation of fans.   

Pledge $20 or more   

Digital Swashbucklers Graphic Novel Fans supporting this level will receive a Digital Copy of the 400-page Remastered Swords of The Swashbucklers Graphic Novel! As a special thank you, fans at this level will also be listed on the "Supporters of the Swashbucklers" thank-you page in the printed edition of the collection. And you will receive the prizes from the previous level - Subscription to the Dynamite Newsletter and a special Thank-You email for supporting the project.

 

Pledge $40 or more  

Swords of the Swashbucklers Softcover GN This level introduces the incredible print edition of the Swords of the Swashbucklers Softcover Graphic Novel Edition! This oversized original sketch will be the center piece of any original art collection. Pledges at this level will also receive all the prizes from the previous levels (excluding the 8 x 10 original art) - Butch Guice Remarked Sketch & Autograph in the Hardcover Graphic Novel, Swords of the Swashbucklers Limited Foil Dust Jacket Edition Hardcover Graphic Novel, 12 Swashbucklers Mini Prints, Swashbucklers Screen-Printed T-Shirt, Digital Swords of the Swashbucklers GN PDF, inclusion on the "Supporters of the Swashbucklers" thank you page, subscription to the Dynamite Newsletter, and a special thank you email from Dynamite for supporting this important project!  See Rewards info for shipping costs.

Pledge $750 or more  

Bill Mantlo Hand-print Signature! While Bill’s condition currently does not allow him to reliably sign multiple autographs, he will make a special hand print on this limited edition. It is a wonderful and fitting way for a man whose fingerprints are across so many of our favorite Marvel Comics to give supporters a unique and touching piece of this project.  

Pledges at this level will also receive all the prizes from the previous levels (excluding the 8.5 x 11 original art and Comic Shop Bundle) - Swords of the Swashbucklers Limited Foil Dust Jacket Edition Hardcover Graphic Novel, 12 Swashbucklers Mini Prints, Swashbucklers Screen-Printed T-Shirt, Digital Swords of the Swashbucklers GN PDF, inclusion on the "Supporters of the Swashbucklers" thank you page, subscription to the Dynamite Newsletter, and a special thank you email from Dynamite for supporting this important project!  

 

Extra Goodies For All:

Because we achieved our stretch goals on Kickstarter - everyone ordering at the print level and above ($40) on this Indiegogo program will receive these extras!

A set of three Swords of the Swashbucklers collectible throwback stickers!  These cool nods to the collectibles of the 1980's recreate some of the awesome cover images from the series and can be used to decorate anything you fancy!  

 

A set of four Swords of the Swashbucklers collectible temporary tattoos!  You can join the crew with these fun throwback images from the classic series.  Or hide them away in your treasure chest of Swords of the Swashbucklers booty!     

And the biggest news of all - thanks to all of you who have supported the remastering of Swords of the Swashbucklers, there will be NEW Swashbucklers comic content produced!  Watch for details on the new comic book adventures coming soon!
story_txt: Swords of the Swashbucklers is the brainchild of Bill Mantlo – one of Marvel Comics’ most prolific writers and the co-creator of beloved Guardians of the Galaxy sensation, Rocket Raccoon! A pirate adventure on interstellar seas, the beloved Swords of the Swashbucklers series was illustrated by the phenomenal Jackson "Butch" Guice and has not seen print in over 25 years. It’s a story that’s long overdue for preservation as a high-quality, completely remastered trade paperback. More importantly, this Indiegogo continuation of the successful Kickstarter project celebrates the far-reaching imagination of Bill Mantlo, a shining star of the comic industry whose career was tragically cut short in his prime by a hit-and-run accident. With pledges of support for Kickstarter rewards we will generate much-needed royalty income from this essential tale that will contribute to Mantlo’s continued medical care.What is Swords of the Swashbucklers?Writer Bill Mantlo and artist Jackson “Butch” Guice first set sail with Swords of the Swashbucklers in October 1984, courtesy of a prestige-format tale published in Marvel Graphic Novel #14. The success of their daring debut led to a bi-monthly Swashbucklers series – twelve two-fisted installments of blazing ray guns, clashing cutlasses, and creatures beyond imagination!In Swords of the Swashbucklers, spirited teenager Domino Blackthorne Drake was just a normal girl… until she stumbled upon an alien artifact, acquired uncanny power, and became a beacon for intergalactic trouble! With her tabby cat Cap’n Kidd in tow, Domino joins the motley crew of the Starshadow – a spacefaring pirate ship captained by the charismatic and fearless Raader. Domino embarks on a cosmic odyssey to save her kidnapped parents and overthrow the evil Colonizer Empire.Imagine a young, bright-eyed girl on a galaxy-wide escapade, full of high-energy antics straight out of Guardians of the Galaxy and Pirates of the Caribbean, and you’ve got Swords of the Swashbucklers!Who is Bill Mantlo?Bill Mantlo rose through the Marvel Comics ranks in the 1970s to become one of their Bullpen’s most boisterous, visionary, and dependable writers. A young man inspired by long talks with his neighbor, the legendary Jack “King” Kirby, this one-time Marvel intern had his big break in 1974 when a series writer missed a deadline for his Deadly Hands of Kung Fu script. Delivering a fill-in script almost immediately, Mantlo proved his writing chops and work ethic, and soon became an indispensable staff member known for taking on any writing challenge with enthusiasm – no matter what the concept was or how impending the deadline.Over the next 18 years, Mantlo would write over 500 comic books for Marvel Comics, sometimes as many as eight titles a month! Among his many writing accomplishments, he wrote celebrated runs on Marvel mainstays like Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man and The Incredible Hulk, and built a well-deserved reputation as a pioneer of licensed comics. Two such titles – Micronauts and Rom: SpaceKnight – were based on toy properties with little backstory for their characters; Mantlo built entire universes around the concepts, far-flung worlds and rich personalities that remained popular with fans (and profitable for Marvel) long after the original toys disappeared from store shelves. His penchant for cosmic storytelling led to the creation of Rocket Raccoon and, of course, Swords of the Swashbucklers.Furthermore, Mantlo stood up for the “little guy.” He championed creator rights, attempting to build a union for writers and artists. While employed at Marvel, he earned a law degree and served as a public defender. He joined social causes and participated in peaceful protests. Considering his ambition, likeable personality, and political activism, many of his peers predicted a career in government on the horizon.What ended Bill Mantlo’s career?On July 17, 1992, Bill Mantlo was rollerblading on the streets of New York City when he was the victim of a terrible hit-and-run accident. He suffered a closed-head brain injury that severely impaired his mobility and fine motor skills. For the past twenty years, he has resided in a Queens rehabilitation center, where he communicates in simple, labored sentences, and staff must assist with nearly all his physical activities. With unwavering support from his brother and legal guardian Mike Mantlo, as well as health care professionals, he survives a daily struggle with severe cognitive and memory impairment.Dynamite Entertainment will publish Swords of the Swashbucklers as a full-color, fully remastered volume over 400 pages in length, containing the complete story from all thirteen issues (Marvel Graphic Novel #14, plus Swashbucklers #1-12). Restored to print for the first time in over 25 years, the Swords of the Swashbucklers collection will preserve one of Bill Mantlo’s greatest creative achievements – for the first time in its entirety – in a high-quality, durable format for readers to enjoy throughout the years.A Few Words from Swashbucklers Co-Creator Jackson "Butch" Guice:"I had the enormous pleasure of working with Bill Mantlo at the beginning of my own career -- and I know from personal experience the vibrant infectious enthusiasm and joy Bill had for The Swords of the Swashbucklers, and the stories we told together. This project is a wonderful way to honor Bill Mantlo's creative legacy. I hope fans -- both old and new -- support this effort, and I for one very much look forward to seeing the swashbuckling crew of the Starshadow fly once more. "Reward Tiers: Pledge $5 or more    Digital Swords of the Swashbucklers OGN For your support at this level you will receive the Digital PDF of the 64-page Swords of the Swashbucklers Original Graphic Novel (also known as Marvel Graphic Novel #14), a subscription to the Dynamite Newsletter, and our gratitude in helping to bring this long lost piece of comic book history back to life for a new generation of fans.   Pledge $20 or more   Digital Swashbucklers Graphic Novel Fans supporting this level will receive a Digital Copy of the 400-page Remastered Swords of The Swashbucklers Graphic Novel! As a special thank you, fans at this level will also be listed on the "Supporters of the Swashbucklers" thank-you page in the printed edition of the collection. And you will receive the prizes from the previous level - Subscription to the Dynamite Newsletter and a special Thank-You email for supporting the project. Pledge $40 or more  Swords of the Swashbucklers Softcover GN This level introduces the incredible print edition of the Swords of the Swashbucklers Softcover Graphic Novel Edition! Pledges will also receive all the prizes from the previous levels - Digital Swords of the Swashbucklers GN PDF, inclusion on the "Supporters of the Swashbucklers" thank you page, subscription to the Dynamite Newsletter, and a special thank you email from Dynamite for supporting this important project!  See Rewards info for shipping costs.Pledge $50 or more  Limited Edition Swashbucklers Lithograph The beautiful Butch Guice art of Swords of the Swashbucklers is captured in this stunning 8.5 x 11 full-color Lithograph! Pledges at this level will also receive all the prizes from the previous levels - Swords of the Swashbucklers Softcover Graphic Novel, Digital Swords of the Swashbucklers GN PDF, inclusion on the "Supporters of the Swashbucklers" thank you page, subscription to the Dynamite Newsletter, and a special thank you email from Dynamite for supporting this important project!  See Rewards info for shipping costs.   Pledge $70 or more  Swashbucklers T-Shirts You can wear your Swords of the Swashbucklers swag with these vibrant logo screen-printed T-Shirts! story:
The Lalas Burlesque

Not just any burlesque show, we're The Lalas and we're creating a comic book to dive deeper into what we do, what we're about, and where the imagination can take you on a ride with us.  We love being on stage the most and we're having the time of our lives entertaining audiences, making them laugh, and bringing the rock and roll. We embrace our sexiness through the passion and talent that goes into burlesque. We're professional dancers and strong, empowered women.  Each of us brings unique personality and character on to the stage, driven by Mama Lala, Erin Lamont, the show's creator and choreographer.  Her vision drives our brand and we are thrilled to create a comic book to take her work into the realm of adventure, fantasy and entertainment in a way that goes beyond what we can present on stage. 

*

We have an amazing team involved with the creation of this comic.  Their credits include work on some of these projects:

  • The hit Nickelodeon cartoon series “Codename: Kids Next Door” 
  • Shadowman, X-O Manowar, Harbinger, Solar, Magnus, Turok, Ninjak, Bloodshot, Armorines, Eternal Warrior, etc.
  • Foxwood Falcons, Celestial Alliance, Impossible Tales, 7 Days to Fame, Bonita & Clyde, or Model Operandi.
  • Wizard Magazine, Wizard Special Edition comics and hardcovers, Toyfare Magazine, Black Bull's: Pilgrim, Black Bull's: Gatecrasher, Black Bull's: Shadowhunters, Twisted Toyfare Theater, etc.
  • Men in Black: Alien Attack, Masters of Constantinople, Chronicles of Sound: Dayside.


The Lalas burlesque show tours the globe performing custom, comedic, audience interactive shows.  The Lalas are full time work professionals in television & film in Los Angeles.  By day, you can see The Lalas on your favorite TV show, print ad, working with pop artists, you name it! By night, they are part of THE busiest working burlesque show around.

Boasting credits such as; CSI:NY, Tosh.0, Little Women LA, T.I, Dancing With The Stars, The Fosters, Glee, The Voice, East Los High, The Grammys, The People's Choice Awards, America's Got Talent, John Legend, Keeping Up With The Kardashians....the list goes on! 

created by celebrity choreographer Erin Lamont, The Lalas are THE brand in burlesque.  Creating a comic book based EXACTLY off of each woman in The Lalas? A no brainer! 


Our website is: www.thelalas.com.

Our promotional reel is: https://youtu.be/t3RCglMnfZs

See more at: www.youtube.com/thelalas



What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to recoup some of the associated costs, including our Writer, Editor, Penciller, Inker, Colorist, and Layout Designer.  Not to mention the cost of manufacturing and hopefully some marketing to spread the word!

SO, we're using this forum for advance sales - all comics distributed here will be signed, and extra goodies available range from Lalas calendars, signed 8x10 of the women,  to in-person dance/burlesque instruction. 


The Impact

There's no comic quite like this.  We're not just adding this as an element of our brand for entertainment value, we're looking at this as a true form of empowerment and representing the Lalas' strengths as intelligent, powerful, talented and unique women.  Imagine the fun in a comic that captures our on-stage show, along with wild off-stage adventures, battling evil forces with our powers!


Risks & Challenges

We have created a budget to produce this comic.  We will produce it no matter what.  However, it's a huge amount of money and we want to be able to continue to free up funds to make new stage attire, rehearse new numbers and travel around the world performing.  Rather than waiting until the comic is finished to start promoting it, we like the idea of using this forum and also hopefully getting enough sales upfront to ease our budget.  The $5,000 goal is a small portion of the total, but it'll go a long way towards helping us get this done right.  If we go over, that might give us a bigger marketing budget to share this comic with the world, which would be amazing!


Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you can contribute, we'd love you sharing this campaign!  There are share tools on the site, and spreading the word on social media will make a huge impact for us.  If you've read this far, you're already a part of the team and on this adventure with us.  Our job is to entertain you, but also to impact others with the sense of empowerment through performance.  We take pride in our bodies and our interests and our skills, and we take just as much pride in our fans.  So thank you, thank you in advance for helping us to spread the word.  This comic book will surely delight others and if it's successful, we'll look for more ways to share our story with you and keep you entertained!

    Other Ways You Can Help Whether or not you can contribute, we'd love you sharing this campaign!  There are share tools on the site, and spreading the word on social media will make a huge impact for us.  If you've read this far, you're already a part of the team and on this adventure with us.  Our job is to entertain you, but also to impact others with the sense of empowerment through performance.  We take pride in our bodies and our interests and our skills, and we take just as much pride in our fans.  So thank you, thank you in advance for helping us to spread the word.  This comic book will surely delight others and if it's successful, we'll look for more ways to share our story with you and keep you entertained!

story:
The Afrofuturefest community is an emerging and influential network of people of all backgrounds, joined by a love of comics, movies, TV, games, ”nerd” culture and the extra special something brought to it by creators and fans of color. In Oct. Of 2015, an estimated 160,000 people experienced Afrofuturefest at the Javits Center at New York Comic Con in New York City. Thousands bought books and merchandise, signed our mailing list and had a funky good time. We’re returning this year with bigger names, a larger, more diverse group of cutting-edge creators and more colorful programming, and we need your help to make that happen!

YOU, these innovators were once outsiders, but you now directly influence pop culture worldwide!

 

More to be announced!

 

 

Funds from Indiegogo will be used for:

​

• New York Comic Con booth rental, lights, power, internet.

• Javits Center labor costs.

• A brighter, more colorful booth with hanging banners so fans can find us.

• Our PR and social media team, to get the word out.

• Shipping/warehousing for our creators’ books and swag.

 

We have a wealth of amazing Perks for our supporters that we’ve never offered before. Check the sidebar on the right (or our cheat sheet below) for details!

 

The Behind The Scenes supporters get full access to all production updates, as well as behind the scenes info on the show. Get a tweet from @afrofuturefest personally thanking you for your support!

 

You want your support to be loud and proud! Get all the Behind The Scenes perks AND this funky sticker!

 

 

 

 

STANDALONES

These are perks that are not combined with previous perks.

MORE PERKS WILL BE ADDED SOON!

 

Risks & Challenges

We are starting this campaign a little late, but we are comitted. We already have the space at the Javits Center, which means we are paying for most of what we're asking for out-of-pocket. you contribution will make sure we can pay all of our NYCC bills when this is over!

Some of the comics that are listed above are not out yet, but when they are, they will ship as listed in each perks section. We will do our best to make sure everyone receives their perks on time, and we will be completely open and honest with you if things anything is going to be late. :) But ALL PERKS WILL BE FULFILLED.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute to this campaign, you can help! Here are some things you can do:

Read and share what we're doing! Follow us on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr and Instagram and tell everyone you know about Afrofuturefest and ask them to contribute!

Thank you so much for reading all of this and supporting us!

story:
Me

Hi guys! My name is Raitis! This thing right here took me couple years of my life so I hope you'll like it!:D It's already finished and printed in small batch. 

Supporting this campaign would help me so much, I'm aiming on making this a trilogy which would lead to a short animated movie in the same setting as well.

 

Mr. Lazerfish

As all tales of creation, this one is a bit abstract at the start, but hold on!:]

Our hero was born into world where everything you eat changes your DNA. Also should I mention that there is no ground, just giant faces, which both give and take back lives of it's inhabitants when they feel like it.

That's no place to live, so our hero decides to use rules of the world to escape it. He finds himself in a beautiful water world where giant sky rocks are daily occurrence.  

I'm not gonna ruin much more, you should have some sense now.

Thanks!
