story:
Prozac causes Systemic Lupus Erythemetosus, a horrible disease, in some cases. It has taken over twenty years for psychiatrists to acknowledge this FACT. This is a book written from my inner child to your inner child. IT IS NOT A CHILDREN’S BOOK.

The Plot

Little Porcupine Goes to the Psyche Ward is the dark tale of a porcupine at the mercy of a fatally flawed psychiatric system.

Little Porcupine is painfully fearful due to being alone in the world, responsible for three young porcupines. She is so afraid she thinks she is going crazy. So she sees a psychiatrist. He gives her prozac. This drug gives Little Porcupine a horrible side effect, systemic lupus erythemetosus. Worse disease you can have next to cancer. More drugs like steroids and tranquilizers are added which complicate the situation. The doctors do nothing but make things worse. Little Porcupine seeks help at the hospital but that only turns into a two year long misadventure with total insomnia. There are many interesting if not shocking animal patients that Little Porcupine meets. Doctors keep her on the steroid which is causing her mania and then declare her incompetent in a mock trial!! The “experts” do not expect her to ever function again.

 Escaping the mental health system, Little Porcupine finds photography her best therapy. She builds a darkroom. Then she meets Jack Rabbit who buys her Photoshop and moves her into his life. Little Porcupine has PTSD from being in the Psyche Ward.  By the end of the story Little Porcupine is finally sleeping and feels safe. She gets a photography job, which is the vocational therapy she needed in the first place!! To be fair, she is also on the right medication. But getting to that point was two years of plain torture.

                     Motivation for the Story

My name is Frances Dale and I am the author of Little Porcupine Goes to the Psyche Ward. My motivation for writing this was to explain to myself what the heck had just happened to me!! This was my self therapy. In a child like way I was able to tell the story indirectly using animals. I suppose it is like when children are traumatized and they use dolls or drawings to tell their story. A dear friend who is a library specialist insisted I find illustrators and get the book published. Now I want people to know that prozac can cause lupus and the good psychiatrists all know this. This is a well kept secret.

There is a big difference between the high class mental health facilities and the rest of the system. The reliance on drugs exceeds common sense. Once you’re on the psychiatric merry go round it is difficult for your brain to get off. This book tells what it is really like in a mental hospital. People tend to act like it’s the patients fault for having a mental disorder. If you have a rotten experience in the hospital, well, that’s what you get for being crazy. But brains have problems just like hearts or kidneys have problems. Few people visit anyone in a mental hospital. No one sends flowers.

Mental hospitals use to have art classes, play therapy, swimming pools. Cut backs have virtually eliminated most activities in most hospitals. The only exercise the depressed patients receive is walking in the halls. Photography and art and music are important in recovering from an episode of mental illness. But insurance companies don’t care.

Ultimately, places like John Hopkins genetics research department are looking to prevent these mental illnesses. There has to be a better way to deal with brain malfunctions.

People think that psychiatry is state of the art, very scientifically advanced. It is actually rather primitive. There’s a lot of guesswork. Luck is a big factor. Not every shrink is a good diagnostician. You wouldn’t put up with this if we were talking a heart surgeon.

                      Objective for the Future

I am seeking funding to publish this little book with Outskirts Press which is print on demand. It will be available on Amazon.com and Barnes and Noble.com  It will be formatted for Kindle and Nook.  I am also going to send a copy of the book to the Dr. Phil Show. In the more distant future I'd like to see an animation made of this little book, to reach even more people. I hope to be working again with my excellent illustrators, Joseph Hecker and Gifford Scanlon, on sequels and prequels. 

                         Themes of the Book

As for the themes of the book, the first theme is that Little Porcupine was raised in a fashion that caused her to be terrified socially. She needed psychotherapy and vocational therapy. But instead, she went to a psychiatrist who did not TALK to her, but rather gave her PILLS. When you go to a psychiatrist you get pills, whether you need them or not. 

The second theme of the book is that prozac can cause lupus and no doctor will warn you of this possibility. The third theme of the book is that many psychiatrists don't know what they are doing. In twenty five years only three have been both empathetic and exceptional diagnosticians. Most were unremarkable and cold.  A few were actually sadistic. And not all of these were Medicaid doctors.

The fourth theme of the book is that the Arts help people experiencing a mental problem. This is the mantra of drop-in Art Centers for the mentally ill. That the arts are taken out of mental hospitals speaks volumes of the insurance industry. The art of photography was Little Porcupines best therapy.

And the fifth theme of the book is that a true love, an ardent love which is a love worth having, can help a person with mental/emotional problems.  Without the lithium I dare say Little Porcupine might have driven Jack Rabbit away. But had Little Porcupine been raised with any affection, encouragement and positive socialization, she might not have needed the lithium.  Jack Rabbit was willing to go through codependency books and meetings, Inner Child work with John Bradshaw, Transactional Analysis to undo the patterns of Critical Parental roles, SLAA and general couples therapy; so the love of a mate helped Little Porcupine. You don't figure things out in a vacuum. You only challenge your patterns in a relationship. 

Thank you for your time and attention.

story:
My story 

We are seeking co-producers to help us  adapt my humor book, Enter Crying,        Exit Laughing into a comedy movie that will make people laugh-out- loud and inspire people dealing cancer and other health issues.

We are seeking $15,000 to retain a talented screen writer / director and need your support and contribution to move forward. 

Hi, I'm Ken Miller author of Enter Crying, Exit Laughing.                                                          I wrote the book to  illustrate the humorous experiences I had dealing with cancer and other health challeges.  Writing the book cracked me up and made my journey with cancer and it's side effects easier. 

Enter Crying, Exit Laughing is about my time in hospital emergency and operating rooms, laboratories, waiting rooms, hospital beds, ambulances and taxi-cabs.

Readers commented the book was hilarious and inspirational. That  convinced me and my supporters my humor message is a must to reach many more people by having a comedy movie adapted from the book.

We need you to be a Co-Producer to accomplish our goal to retain a top comedy    screen writer to write an A quality screen play that will attract other A team professionals. 

                                                    


The following is small sample of comments from our many readers.

" The book should be required reading for everyone and be placed in hospitals , hotels, resorts and on cruise ships, trains, and especially subways."                            DR Sam Rhame, Chiropractor, Holistic Professional

"Sir Ken Miller's book makes for wonderful reading.It makes you laugh, cry,            cry with laughter, and most important reaffirms living.                                              MOSES would be proud."                                                                                                               MD Robert Rosenthal, Harvard Medical School

"This book is not only hilarious , if you follow its advice you will most likely not be seeing many doctors , especially those in my specialty."                                                        MD Arthur Mensch, Pathologist

"I love this book! My physician husband. friends and I agree it is a treasure trove     of wellness tips that lasts a lifetime."                                                                                      Reba Evenchick, Supporter of Cultural activities and one great lady.Pittsfield, MA.

"The book is simply hilarious, educational and should be part of everyone's library." MD Jennifer Nordby, Pediatrician

"Ken is on the right track trying to help folks get past the sick, shock and sad stuff and get on with the living, laughing and loving."                                                                    MD Paul Stelzer, Cardiac Surgeon

"The world is in need of laughter-medicine today and Ken's sense of humor is 'exactly what the doctor orders'! Ken Miller has taken healing and made it fun,        the world is looking for great advice now and humor is the way to go!"                        MD Stephanie Kabongo, Natural Health  & Holistic Medicine, New Zealand

MY STORY CONTINUES.

I'm a New York advertising and marketing executive that grew up in an entertainment family. My father was an talented entertainer and my mother was a brilliant, funny, passionate gal with big attitude whose parents owned and operated a New York Catskill Mountain resort.

My schooling was marketing and engineering and upon graduation I went to work for a real estate /resort developer as advertising and marketing manager.             Four years later  I opened my own advertising and marketing agency with my Swedish wife, Asa Kristina.

We have been in business 40 plus years marketing products and services including resorts, real estate, health products, events and charitable causes. Our firm helped clients attain sales success and we won several creative awards. Our clients included Fortune 500 companies, governments  and entrepreneurs.

We were among the founders of timeshare, conversion  of rental apartments to condominiums and sponsoring international property expos in Europe and the Far East. We established an office in London and I was deemed the 'Mel Brooks' of American real estate. 

Working with a team of property professionals, environmentalists, planners and architects we created plans for 'A New Century Habitat', an eco-friendly resort city of the future in south Texas. It included innovative ideas based on building green       and healthy.

We worked with the United Nations to create an affordable housing program bringing together the public and private sectors to develop sustainable communities. That effort led me to meet worldwide leaders.                                          One brilliant and kind person was King Sheikh Anwar Mahmoud Mekkeen,            King of the Nubia and its Provinces in The Sudan. In July, 2001 he honored me     with a Knighthood given my help to him and United Nations work. 

My wife and I were among the first to enter China after President Nixon in 1978.    We presented an international marketing plan for the Chinese government.            The invitation from China was initiated by me writing a humorous letter to Chairman Mao in 1973. 

My AHAH moment to utilize my experience and skills to help others                        came in March 2010.

 A routine cat scan gave evidence to an oncologist I was in deep caca. She told me: "Ken you have cancer. You have a tumor the size of a soccer ball in your abdomen and it's Non Hodgkins Follicular Lymphoma." 

 I was feeling fine and asked : "Should I sell my Brooklyn Dodger baseball card collection and could you cut out the soccer ball and donate it to a soccer organization."  I was told: "Ken, you are too cavalier and should pay more attention to your serious circumstances and stop laughing"

I felt her approach lacked a critical element I needed - humor and a positive attitude. But alas what she told me was the truth.  

The wake up call turned out to be a blessing.                                                                                     

It motivated me to write my book and provide the opportunity to use my marketing skills and experience to help myself and others understand the value of humor and laughter as a healing therapy.                     




After the book was published a passionate group of people appeared with the shared belief that humor can be a powerful tool in the healing process.                          It  became evident the book should be made into a comedy movie to reach millions.

 OUR GOAL.  Create a quality laugh out loud comedy  film that is also inspirational to all dealing with serious health issues.

ONLY YOU, OUR SUPPORTERS CAN HELP US ACHIEVE THOSE GOALS. 

We have a hand shake agreement with a  multi-talented screenwriter/director.

We are seeking $15,000 and will use the funds to retain our chosen screen writer / director.   Our timing is perfect given he is between two movies and can focus on our book to movie.

Your contribution will allow us to have a finished screen play by the end of 2015.

Also in not a pain in touches we would like you to get the word out about the campaign  to your contacts in the real world and via social media.

Thank you- Sir Ken Miller

MY STORY CONTINUES.
I'm a New York advertising and marketing executive that grew up in an entertainment family. My father was an talented entertainer and my mother was a brilliant, funny, passionate gal with big attitude whose parents owned and operated a New York Catskill Mountain resort.
My schooling was marketing and engineering and upon graduation I went to work for a real estate /resort developer as advertising and marketing manager.             Four years later  I opened my own advertising and marketing agency with my Swedish wife, Asa Kristina.
We have been in business 40 plus years marketing products and services including resorts, real estate, health products, events and charitable causes. Our firm helped clients attain sales success and we won several creative awards. Our clients included Fortune 500 companies, governments  and entrepreneurs.
We were among the founders of timeshare, conversion  of rental apartments to condominiums and sponsoring international property expos in Europe and the Far East. We established an office in London and I was deemed the 'Mel Brooks' of American real estate. 
Working with a team of property professionals, environmentalists, planners and architects we created plans for 'A New Century Habitat', an eco-friendly resort city of the future in south Texas. It included innovative ideas based on building green       and healthy.
We worked with the United Nations to create an affordable housing program bringing together the public and private sectors to develop sustainable communities. That effort led me to meet worldwide leaders.                                          One brilliant and kind person was King Sheikh Anwar Mahmoud Mekkeen,            King of the Nubia and its Provinces in The Sudan. In July, 2001 he honored me     with a Knighthood given my help to him and United Nations work. 
My wife and I were among the first to enter China after President Nixon in 1978.    We presented an international marketing plan for the Chinese government.            The invitation from China was initiated by me writing a humorous letter to Chairman Mao in 1973. 
My AHAH moment to utilize my experience and skills to help others                        came in March 2010.
 A routine cat scan gave evidence to an oncologist I was in deep caca. She told me: "Ken you have cancer. You have a tumor the size of a soccer ball in your abdomen and it's Non Hodgkins Follicular Lymphoma." 
 I was feeling fine and asked : "Should I sell my Brooklyn Dodger baseball card collection and could you cut out the soccer ball and donate it to a soccer organization."  I was told: "Ken, you are too cavalier and should pay more attention to your serious circumstances and stop laughing"
I felt her approach lacked a critical element I needed - humor and a positive attitude. But alas what she told me was the truth.  
The wake up call turned out to be a blessing.                                                                                     
It motivated me to write my book and provide the opportunity to use my marketing skills and experience to help myself and others understand the value of humor and laughter as a healing therapy.                     



After the book was published a passionate group of people appeared with the shared belief that humor can be a powerful tool in the healing process.                          It  became evident the book should be made into a comedy movie to reach millions.
 OUR GOAL.  Create a quality laugh out loud comedy  film that is also inspirational to all dealing with serious health issues.
ONLY YOU, OUR SUPPORTERS CAN HELP US ACHIEVE THOSE GOALS. 
We have a hand shake agreement with a  multi-talented screenwriter/director.
We are seeking $15,000 and will use the funds to retain our chosen screen writer / director.   Our timing is perfect given he is between two movies and can focus on our book to movie.
Your contribution will allow us to have a finished screen play by the end of 2015.
Also in not a pain in touches we would like you to get the word out about the campaign  to your contacts in the real world and via social media.
Thank you- Sir Ken Miller

story:
Prepare for a new type of hero in Piece of Me. Britney is a socialite with great powers but doesnt give a F#$K about the responsibility. Until, her family fortune is nearly gone. Now, she has to suit up to keep her lavish lifestyle.

The concept behind PoM is now with social media and the 24 hour news cycle, heroes have to change an adapt. Those that dont become entertainment for us civilians or platforms for politicians

POM also has a back up story called The Unit

story:
E-Mortal - What Is It About?

E-Mortal is a dark noir that follows a private detective living in an overcrowded, overpopulated world where people can no longer die, who is thrown into a deep rabbit hole of corruption, lies and cover-ups when he stumbles across the fresh corpse of a young woman during one of his cases.

 

Our Team!

This thrilling series was created by award-winning screenwriter and internationally published graphic novel author Mitch Smith (True Terror, Hell-Bound) and accomplished illustrator Cristian David Narravo (Markosia Enterprises, Hellbound Media, Aphotic Realm Magazine) with the help of Letterer Nikki Powers (Red Winter, Cover of Darkness, The Fist, Nightlight, Phantom Squad #2-3) 

 

The Whole Story

The first volume in the E-Mortal series will encompass a complete story arc through 8 issues of 21 pages each, which we hope to eventually fund through campaigns like this. For now, however, the first issue is completed and will be released for free along with our campaign to raise funds for Issue #2!

 

E-Mortal is a high-concept sci-fi noir that examines and explores life, death, the afterlife (or lack thereof) and compels readers to consider mortality and humanity through a thrilling, unpredictable mystery full of dark twists and turns on every page.

 

Thank you for all of your support!

 

What We Need

Here is where the funds we are asking for will go - all of the proceeds will go directly to the creatives involved to help make this project happen!

  • Illustrator - $840 ($40 per page x 21 Pages)
  • Letterer - $105 ($5 per page x 21 Pages)
  • Cosplayer - $140 ($70 per image)
  • Writer - $100 for the full written issue

 

= $1,185.00 For Production of Issue #2 PLUS

 

  • IndieGoGo Campaign - $118.50 (5% of Total Campaign + 5% Reserved Funds)

 

Total - $1,303.50 For Issue #2

 

What You Get

For their support, donors will receive:

 

$2 Donation - Your Name in Special Thank You Page At End of Issue #2!

 

$5 Donation - Your Name in Special Thank You Page At End of Issue #2 & Full Issue #1 in a special PDF!

 

$10 Donation - Your Name in Special Thank You Page At End of Issue #2 & full Issue #1 in a PDF and Full Issue #2 in a PDF!

 

$15 Donation - Your Name in Special Thank You Page At End of Issue #2, full Issue #1 in a PDF and Full Issue #2 in an exclusive PDF & One Exclusive Cosplay Image from MSM's Contract Cosplayer, Dietshampoo (Lauren Solski)!

 

$20 + Donation - Your Name in Special Thank You Page At End of Issue #2, full Issue #1 in an exclusive PDF and Full Issue #2 in an exclusive PDF & Two Exclusive Cosplay Images from MSM's Contract Cosplayer, Dietshampoo (Lauren Solski)!

 

The Impact

Our team has been working diligently on this project for several years, and recently we have been pitching it around the comic book industry to try to find a home for the project. Though there was lots of interest and we received several offers, our team just felt that going the traditional publishing route was not right for this project.

See, we wanted to bring this timely, exciting story to the largest possible audience, which is why we are releasing the entire first issue for free here and on our social media. We would love to continue to do this with the series, so that people all around the world can read and share the story, but we cannot do this alone!

We have had such generous donations from the crowdfunding community in the past, which allowed our team to fund and produce True Terror Volume #1 and release it internationally through Zone Komics! That series did well enough that the series has been renewed for a second volume which is scheduled to hit shelves next year!

We cannot do this alone, but our team believes in this story, and with your help, we will be able to share it with the world!

 

Risks & Challenges

As with every crowdfunding campaign, there is a risk that we will not reach our goal in time. However, due to our previous success crowdfunding a comic series, the comparably low ask (we are only looking to fund one issue instead of a whole series at the moment) and our reach (thousands of social media followers & connections with lots of comic book industry professionals) we are very confident in our ability to succeed and to get this project fully funded!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like the series, but just don't have the money available to donate, not to worry! There are lots of things you can do to help keep this project going and support us!

  • You can share our campaign on your social media!
  • You can also mention it to friends!
  • You can show your friends and family the free pages and ask them if they would be able to donate!
  • And you can like, share, and subscribe to Mitch Smith Media on Twitter (@MitchSmithMedia), Facebook (@MitchSmithMedia), and Instagram (@MitchSmithMediaLLC) for updates on all of our cool projects in the film, television, and comic book spaces!

story:
COMICS FANS, & PARENTS...

Read this and you are going to LOVE IT.

Say hello to the world's best App that will give you the best-personalized story and comic books you would ever get with your own name and avatar.

We are a team of Comic and graphic novels fans, we also parents, who believe that with Heroes App we will change the way stories and comics are read and written.

Heroes App fosters creativity for kids and older audiences and enables them to enjoy their passion for reading and creating stories and comic books.  With Heroes App, the next time you read a story, you will be the hero in it, your look, your appearance, and your name if you want to. You will be the hero of every story you read

 

HOW DOES IT WORK?

How You Can Be The Hero of Every Story You Read!

With the Heroes app, you will be able to build an avatar that resembles your look and appearance, and then our App will reflect these avatars in the story as its main character. Just take a photo of yourself and the system will create your avatars in different styles (Comics, Manga, or Cartoon). You can give it a name, dress it in the outfit of your liking and even add some accessories to it.

When you choose a story from the app library, your avatar will be reflected in it as its central character with the focus around your journey in this story.

And because we believe that everyone is a hero, you will also be able to build additional avatars that represent your friends and family members so they can be part of the same story as well. Additionally, you can invite more than just close friends and family to participate in your story by using their own avatar. Your best friend can be your side-kick, your partner can be your co-star, and parents can be on the same adventure with their kids.

 

CREATIVE WORLD

Tell your story, your way

For Kids, Teens, & Adults

In Heroes Creative World, you can create your own stories. Just choose the style of the story you want to create. It could be comics, manga, or graphic novels. Choose the background of every scene, add props, characters, and avatars with different impressions and poses, then add your own text. That’s it. It is a simple drag, and drop to develop a story of your choice. Your story will be ready to be saved, printed, and shared with others.

Heroes Creative World will foster creativity, inspire confidence and encourage the talent of every young writer and expert author.

 

AUDIO-VISUAL STORIES

Tell Your Kids a Story, Even if You Are Busy or Not Around

 

The audio-visual story is another amazing feature of the Heroes App that lets you narrate, and record audiovisual stories with your own voice and avatar. Focused on kids' stories, this is a great way to grow the bond with your kids by enabling them to listen to stories with your voice. Our Audiovisual stories can include more than one narrator which means that your friends or kids can have their voices recorded in the same story.

You can also enjoy audiovisual stories personalized with your avatars and performed by our actresses and professional voice-over artists.

These stories will forever be yours to listen to anytime you want and share with many generations to come. Now, this is what you can call a great way to create a shared memory with your loved ones.

 

HEROES TIMELINE

A Library of Your Memories That You Will Never Lose

 Timeline Library is the best way to record your personal biography in a very unique way that allows you to save and share them with others.               

When you select an event-related story, you will be asked to provide some specific information related to the event such as the date of the event, the first word said, name of the school, name of the dentist… etc.

This information will be reflected in the content of the story along with the avatars you selected. You will be also able to upload real photos (of the real event) which will be incorporated into the pages of the story.

We believe this is the best way to save and share your life memories forever.

 

SAFE FOR ALL KIDS

Parents Have Full Control.

Heroes App gives parents full control of what their kids read and how much time they spend on the App. Kids and young readers will be only able to browse stories that are rated suitable for their age.

 

SHARE THE LOVE

The Best Gift We Can Think-Off

Heroes App lets you gift your friends a story with their avatar in it as one of its main characters. Your avatar can be part of it as well. This is an amazing gift to put a smile on someone's face on their birthday, or to left someone’s spirit when they are facing a challenge in their life. And it is a great way to teach your kids metaphors and morals from inspiriting stories.

 

CREATE YOUR OWN LIBRARY WITH HIGH-END PHYSICAL COPY

Your Personalized Story Delivered To Your Door Step

Any personalized story you create or choose from our library can either be viewed within the app or you can order an exclusive high-end physical copy and have it delivered to your doorstep.

 

AND MORE...

Our Heroes App has so many other incredible features that you will love and enjoy with your friends and family. Help up bring Heroes App to life by backing our crowdfunding campaign, because it is the time for you to create your own hero.

 

Stay Connected

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by sharing it on your social media. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! You can follow us on:

For more info and inquiry, feel free to contact up us via or social media channels or email: support@capitalofheroes.com

Help up bring Heroes App to life by backing our crowdfunding campaign, because it is the time for you to create your own hero. Stay ConnectedWe understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by sharing it on your social media. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! You can follow us on:For more info and inquiry, feel free to contact up us via or social media channels or email: support@capitalofheroes.com

story:
Your opportunity to experience the interactive future of the comic book medium NOW!

Limited Edition Variant Cover Art by Andrew Dorland
 

WHAT IS BALLYSKILLEN?

Ballyskillen #1, is the first of a four issue storyline in an Augmented Reality Comic Book series. A contemporary fantasy based on Irish mythology, it is the first to integrate traditional 2D animation to enhance the storytelling. 

The full color comic book can be read and enjoyed on its own in print or digital format, but you can increase the scope of your narrative experience using the Augmented Reality App on your phone or tablet. 

Ballyskillen is a rural Irish village with a secret. It is a  haven for Faeries and creatures from the traditional folklore of Ireland. A Killer hides among them. Who will rise up to stop this supernatural terror? 

Sample Video of the app in action:

 

WHAT IS THE STORY?

After being blackmailed by an ancient druid, a washed up pub owner becomes the human agent for a hidden community of Faeries. Along with a shape shifting being known as a Pooka and a Punk Rock Leprechaun, they must hunt down a dark mythical creature before it kills again.

 

WHO WOULD ENJOY THIS COMIC BOOK?

Fans of modern dark fantasy geared towards today's audience, such as Stranger Things or Harry Potter. If you like reading comics like Sandman, Saga, Locke & Key, Wicked + Divine, God Country, Once and Future, or East of West, we think you will get a kick out of the story we've crafted.

 

A DIFFERENT KIND OF AUGMENTED REALITY NARRATIVE

Other Augmented Reality Comic Books have added the novelty of special effects, motion, audio/music, but none have used the technology as a way to enrich the story for the audience. Artist Andrew Dorland is creating hand-drawn animated sequences that expand the scale of the storytelling within the magical world of Ballyskillen.

TRY OUT THE BALLYSKILLEN AUGMENTED REALITY APP FOR FREE

 

Funded! What You Get.

We're already FULLY FUNDED. This is an opportunity for those who missed out to claim some of a few rewards previously offered.

  • The Comic Book itself in Digital and Physical Format.
  • Augmented Reality enhanced prints.
  • Original Art

 

 

 

The Creators

Andrew Dorland has recently returned to Canada after working as a  storyboard artist in Ireland and joined the RAID Studio in Toronto.  His travels around the Island have inspired a large bulk of this story and he hopes you enjoy it.  His comic credits include South of Yonder for Markosia, and his creator owned comic Scarabs.

Sam Noir's credits include Captain Canuck covers for Chapterhouse Comics, Cerebus Low Society, Monstrosity for Alterna, and the popular web comic Fan Fiction. He's co-created kids comics such as Sunny and Owl Girl, Clanky, and Kung Fu Santa. Sam is also a writer/editor/publisher for the Joe Shuster Award nominated Caulrdon Magazine, a large format comics anthology of Supernatural Tales.

Risks & Challenges

Andrew Dorland and Sam Noir, have both run and delivered a half dozen successful kickstarter campaigns. We are ready to deliver.

Ways You Can Help

We understand what challenging times we live in. Not everyone can't contribute at this time, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • get the word out about our innovative Augmented Reality Comic Book on social media.
  • use the Indiegogo share tools!

Sample Pages.

We understand what challenging times we live in. Not everyone can't contribute at this time, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

get the word out about our innovative Augmented Reality Comic Book on social media.
use the Indiegogo share tools!

Sample Pages.

story:
THE WRASKLES ARE BACK!

Teen pop-punk sensations THE WRASKLES are going international! Tony, Alana, Max & Rosie, arrive in Ireland with high hopes of becoming world class superstars, but are soon confronted with the stark reality that the supernatural curse placed on them by a vindictive demon goat have followed them over the pond. Will they get their chance to make it big or will they succumb to the paralyzing scream of the malevolent Banshee? 

PERKS

We are keeping it simple for this campaign and offering only 2 perks;

1 - THE WRASKLES BOOK 2 SONG OF THE BANSHEE (STANDARD EDITION)

This perk comes with the book and 5 stickers including one HUGE bumper sticker of THE WRASKLES logo. The inside cover of every book will have a sweet sketch from Curt too! 

2 - THE WRASKLES BOOK 1: CROSSROADS AT PORKSBURG

We are re-offering BOOK 1 so that folks who missed out the first time around can jump right in at the beginning. This perk comes with the 36 page book, a sketch done by Curt on the interior cover, 5 stickers including one HUGE bumper sticker of THE WRASKLES logo.

FULFILMENT

We are dedicated to getting our books in our readers hands, quickly. Most books will be shipped 3 weeks after the campaign closes. THE WRASKLES books are finished before we start the campaigns and this enables us to simply send an order to the printer and then ship the books. 

DEDICATED TO QUALITY

THE WRASKLES books are printed on the highest quality paper and we aim to give our readers the best experience possible. The colours pop and you can leave them on a coffee table and know that they will be an excellent center piece. 

BOOK 2 INTERIOR PAGES

story:
Funny poster for football fans


   Base drawing "Basic Instinct"

About me

My name is Vyacheslav Muromtsev. I am a freelance writer, animator, computer designer, cartoonist. I live in Tashkent, Uzbekistan


My cartoons and animation has won numerous prizes at international competitions in various countries.


About the project

  • 2016 - the year of the European Football Championship.

  • Я приглашаю всех, кто любит футбол и юмор, смешные персонализированные подарки, приготовленные на основе моих карикатур. Если вы футболист, или вы и ваши друзья футбольные болельщики, или каким-либо образом связаны с футболом, то мой проект для вас.

  • I invite everyone who loves football and humor, and funny personalized gifts to checkout  my cartoons. If you are a football player, or you and your friends are football fans, or in any way connected with football, then, my project is for you.
  • You can order the poster without changes or customized.


   What changes in the comic books, you can order:

    1 - the certificate on the wall and the text of my gratitude for your help.

    2 - The text to your wishes (for example, a greeting for your friend like a happy birthday with a victory in the match, or other options).

    3 - Change the image on a wall (poster, your rewards, and others)

    4 - Changing the face image on the basis of the proposed football pictures you will send me



Choice of replacement

You can customize your poster to make it unique.

You can choose any combination of changes based on the structure below.





The history of this work

In June 2000, the 39th international contest of cartoons on any topic was held in the Belgian town of Knokke-Heist. At the same time, the European Championship in football etween Belgium and the Netherlands also took place. The organizers of the caricature contest announced an additional competition for the football theme. It turned out that the international jury awarded prizes for my work in both competitions. 

Out of more than 500 cartoonists, I was awarded the "Culture Prize" in the main competition and also won third place in the competition with the football theme. As far as I know, never in the history of awards in international competitions, either before or after the event, did it happen that the same person garnered more than one prize. So it's a caricature acquired its own unique history.



What risks are possible.


  • For those who want to have a replacement face image, I recommend ordering the poster.

  • I can not be responsible for the timely and proper shipping address.

    The delivery will depend on how quickly you can give your photos.

    Please send us some photos to work for the best results.

    Perhaps, there could be delay in delivery  if I have a large number of orders.

    If you want a customized poster, please let me know ahead of time, so we can send it in digital form by e-mail. Without my handwritten signature.

    This does not apply to the base model. In a basic drawing, you can only get a hard copy handsigned by me.



Other ways you can help

  • If you liked my project, I ask you to make some noise in your social networks.
  • You can use the share tools beside my campaign image here at Indiegogo.

story:
--------------------------------------------

"Once Our Land" is a post-apocalyptic tale set in 1830s Germany where monsters have surfaced the earth and wiped out most of humanity.

ONCEOURLAND.COM

The story focuses on two characters, Fritz...


... and Ingrid.

                                                  --------------------------------------------

This is a project that I couldn't have done on my own. I had some great friends who've helped me complete this book. I couldn't have seen this thing to it's end without them. Thanks guys.

                                                --------------------------------------------

We have great reward packages that include original sketches, original artwork, limited edition posters and more.

5000$ basically covers the cost for 250 copies (minimum order), the more we raise, the easier it'll be to cover the costs for everything else in the production of this graphic novel.

                                                --------------------------------------------

REWARD $10 USD or more. 

PDF of the Novel (Available in May, same as hardcover).

                                                --------------------------------------------

 REWARD $20 USD or more.

Hardcover Book / Signed

REWARD $30 USD or more.  

Hardcover Book / Signed with Doodle.


Thanks to Nathan Thomas for the animation in the video and for nice camera work. natemakesfilms.com

Thanks to DASHUMANS.com for the music.

Risks and challenges

There aren't any risks or challenges involved in this project. I'm aiming to sell advanced copies of the book to help with the finance of getting the book self published.

The book is completed and ready for print.

story:
" AN EXTRAORDINARY TALE " Baron F. Buckman, Almack London Club
" ITS DANGEROUS" William Denton - Cartographer, sailor and watchman
" WONDERFUL" Mary Black, Burlesque dancer and gold-digger
" A DAZZLINGLY INVENTIVE COMICS" Joshua Clark- London Clark & Sons
" ITS ALL ABOUT GUNS, MONEY AND REVENGE" P. Lafitte- Captain and rafter 
" OUT-OF-THIS-WORLD" Ion Asimbel, Cartomancer from Al-Azdraz
***
KONNOR COMICS PRESENTS :
THE LIGHT AT THE TOP OF THE WORLD ! 
{ THE LOST ADVENTURES OF BARON BUCKMAN - VOLUME  1 }

The Light at the Top of the World Graphic Novel is the account of the extraordinary and supernatural adventures of Baron Frank Buckman and his crew in a remote lighthouse in the Arctic, searching for a lost shipwreck and gold in the glaciers and wastelands of Greenland. Sailing from Victorian London to the frozen waters of Baffin Bay, this original riveting story will take you to the vaults and secrets of a mysterious and gigantic watchtower at the top of the world. A plot that crosses space and time, driven by Quest, Adventure, Discovery, Riddle, Rivalry, and ultimately Transformation. The Graphic Novel is my homage to the greatest adventurers and explorers of all time.



ABOUT ME

I'm Alexandre Piacsek, an artist based in southeast England with over 20 years of experience, having previously worked as a teacher of comics and sequential art in private schools. Mainly influenced by the highly imaginative French Bandes Dessinées and by the American Golden Age of Comics, I have been showcasing my work in London galleries and collective art exhibitions since 2012, such as Illustrated 2015 in Brick Lane and Spark, The Best of Emergent Art coming this year. The Light at the Top of the world will be my debut graphic novel, a project I've been planning for a long time. 

THE STORYBOARD

It took me 6 months to write the story. The storyboard was entirely drawn on the train in 3 sketchbooks, during my travels from Eastbourne to London, from june to november 2015 ( I found train journeys across England the best way to unleash creative inspiration!)  I will use different layouts for the graphic novel, alternating from the classic to innovative panel designs.

THE STORY

The story begins with the narrative of Joshua Clark, an eminent New York shipbuilder from 1850's Manhattan who ventures into the west to take part in the California Gold Rush. On the wild frontier, he builds a mining town and strikes it rich, marries Mary Black a local saloon dancer - but then gets his mining business ravaged by bandits, forcing him to escape with a fortune in gold bars and coins along the Pacific Coast aboard his schooner Surprise. Joshua will never return to New York... his whereabouts remain unknown, until 20 years later rumours about a strange Arctic lighthouse and a mysterious shipwreck carrying the flag of the Surprise, are news all over the world.

The potential discovery of Joshua's "Ship of Gold" attracts a wave of treasure hunters, but many of them are not willing to venture into the frozen and perilous Baffin Bay waters; except two men: the Londoner Baron Frank Buckman and his rival the captain Pierre Lafitte, who will meet in the Arctic at some point at the Light at the Top of the World - where new mysteries and secrets surrounding the lighthouse and the disappearance of "The Ship of Gold" will emerge.

The Light at the Top of the World takes place across several locations around the world, introducing a new set of characters that will bring complexity and depth into the story. Additionally, the inclusion in the novel of events will enthral the readers, expanding the plot into a mythical world. 

I recently gave an INTERVIEW to Alex Reale, staff editor at A PLACE TO HANG YOUR CAPE , where I talked about all my creative process behind the story and the planned sequel. Excerpts from the interview :

A Place to hang Your Cape: What inspired you to create this story?

Piacsek: Real and fictitious stories and legends of adventurers, explorers, globe-trotting fortune-hunters, and my moving to England in 2013 where I can feel the Arctic winds howling in my studio’s window.  A powerful influence and the genesis of the graphic novel’s name is the movie The Light at the Edge of the World. Its a 1971 action & adventure film adapted from Jules Verne‘s classic adventure novel Le Phare du bout du monde, when pirates take over a lighthouse on a rocky island in the South Atlantic during the mid-19th century, but the iron-willed light-keeper played by Kirk Douglas fights their plot

A Place to hang Your Cape: What is the biggest challenge you’ve had to face while creating this project?

Piacsek: To write an intriguing plot that would feel real and simultaneously fantastic to the reader. I’ve strived to create a cohesive narrative intertwined with historical events such as the California Gold Rush and the discovery of the Northwest Passage sea route, also linked with the settings of Victorian London and the Arctic world. To inject detail into my work, I did a lot of web research and used several books, looking for countless images and information. I love highly detailed comics.

A Place to hang Your Cape: I’ve noticed that you’re already finished writing the sequel. Is that going to be the end of the project, or would you like to expand it further? Any chance of spin-offs, prequels, or additional sequels?

Piacsek: No, this is not the end! The Lost Adventures of Baron Buckman series crosses space and time, and I will keep expanding and exploring the Baron Buckman’s universe, introducing at every new episode new characters, themes and exploits. The sequel of The Light at the Top of the World will take part mainly in India, but also in Okinawa/Japan, Indochina, and London, and will bring the new line-up of Jon Strider and the Trackers. This second volume is filled with martial arts combat, desert races, endless journeys across vanished temples, and encounters with supernatural beings and ancient Gods.

THE TEAM

Its just me! The story, penciling, inking, colouring, lettering , graphic design, and the cover art... Its my way of working, to be in control throughout the entire process. It took me many years to fully develop my drawing technique and I want the graphic novel to be in accordance with my artistic style. My work is very original in the sense that all artwork is made with brush & Indian Ink, including the balloons - I only use the computer for colouring and lettering. This is why it will take me around 6 months to finish the 56 pages of the book. But if I surpass my funding goal I will be able to hire a colourist I can trust.

PAGES PREVIEW

You will find below the first finished pages and 2 additional pencil pages of the prologue. More pages will follow as updates through the life of this project, for the benefit of my project's supporters.

(pencil pages) The prologue of the graphic novel takes place in the mythical India, introducing a special character: Captain Burton, a globe-trotting fortune hunter with a keen interest in the hidden secrets of lost cities and ancient Gods. Like the opening sequence of an adventure movie, here Captain Burton explores the legendary Temple of Naga in India, in search of the Book of Tattva:




REWARDS DETAILS 

1) THE LOST ADVENTURES OF BARON BUCKMAN GIANT SIZE FINE ART PRINTS- a truly collectable limited edition, printed on Minuet 300 gsm cotton rag paper- AVAILABLE ONLY THROUGH THIS INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN AT A REDUCED PRICE ( 50 % discount over the price I usually sell at art galleries). These large size artworks are really spectacular, and illustrate the spirit of the story. The works were developed from original brush-ink drawings and have been showcased in London art events such as Illustrated 2015 in Brick Lane. The prints are: The Light at the Top of the World (showcased above, below and in the video), and Tattva Temple - The Lost Adventures of Baron Buckman (that can be seen below). Each print comes signed and numbered by the artist.

2) BARON BUCKMAN EDITION: printed in A4 paperback comic book format, with a thick cover - 21 cm x 29.7 cm, 56 pages. Your name will appear on the special "Thank You" page and each book will be signed and numbered. 

3) ALEXANDRE'S ZINE SKETCHBOOK : printed in A4 format, with a thick cover- 21 cm x 29.7cm, 24 pages, containing character drawings, sketches, storyboard images, writings, and extra material available for those interested in the creative work behind the story. A truly collectable item. Signed and numbered.

4) YOUR IMAGE DRAWN INTO THE STORY: You will have your portrait drawn into one of the graphic novel pages as a member of Baron Buckman's crew, along with a special mention to your name on the 'Thank you' page.

5) THE 'VIGILANT COAT OF ARMS' ART. The original brush & ink drawing on Cotman paper, that was used to create the original large size print The Light at the Top of the World. It measures 42 cm x 29.7 cm. Image depicted below.

6) PERSONAL PORTRAIT COMMISSION. with the same graphic style of "Captain Burton" work as pictured below. Printed on fine art paper 30 cm x 40 cm. You will have your picture in the centre, an original hand drawn lettering featuring your name on top, the background image of your preference and additional drawing elements of your choice around the frame. 

Images below:

1) "The Light of the Top of the World"( detail) , 80 x 125 cm Fine Art Print                   2)"Tattva"- The lost Adventures of Baron Buckman, 75 x 125 cm Fine art print          3) The "Vigilant Coat of Arms", Brush and Ink on Cotman paper 42 x 21.7 cm            4) Drawing style of the personal drawing commission


The Graphic Novel and the Zine Sketchbook will be printed by ExWhyZed , high quality creative printers based in the UK ( follow the link to see the top job the guys from ExWhyZed are making for Indie Comics and Graphic Novels here in the UK). I had a zine printed recently by them, so I know the printing quality will be excellent and really cool.

The fine art prints will be produced by Harwood King Printmakers Studios, expert printmakers based in East Sussex. They will be properly packed and shipped into very firm cardboard tubes.

THE BUDGET

Below is an idea of the budget if I have for example 200 backers pledging each one for 1 copy of the Graphic Novel- the Baron Buckman Edition (This is not the budget of the project in total). As you can see shipping costs are really expensive and  practically equivalent as the book printing.


STRETCHING GOALS

If I hit all my initial funding goal ALL backers that ordered the printed edition of the book, will receive 1 original A4 Brush & Ink drawing, depicting a character or scene of The Light at The Top of The World. More Stretching goals will be unlocked along the way if I surpass my initial funding goal.

Risks and challenges

The risk associated with this project is whether I am able to complete it in a timely manner. But the story has been written and the storyboard finished. I'm an experienced artist and have already calculated the amount of time necessary to finish this project and deliver the rewards. I will be in communication with you during the entire process and update you with all necessary information.

Important to say is that even if I don't hit my funding goal the graphic novel will be finished and printed anyway. Any amount of money will help me reach my campaign objective and I’ll still be able to fulfill the perks to you.

Last but not least, I'd like to say that I have big ambitions with this work and I truly believe in its potential to become a great piece of comic art that will engage and inspire you. The Light at the Top of the World is destined to be an stylish story with some of the most beautiful illustration work you'll ever see in a graphic novel.

One way you can contribute with my project is by pledging for a reward. Another way you can help this campaign is by sharing the project with your friends, and by posting a link to this Indiegogo project on Facebook.

If you have any questions just drop me a line!

Thank you very much, and see you at the Top of The World!

Alexandre Piacsek

I love highly detailed comics.

Piacsek: No, this is not the end! The Lost Adventures of Baron Buckman series crosses space and time, and I will keep expanding and exploring the Baron Buckman’s universe, introducing at every new episode new characters, themes and exploits. The sequel of The Light at the Top of the World will take part mainly in India, but also in Okinawa/Japan, Indochina, and London, and will bring the new line-up of Jon Strider and the Trackers. This second volume is filled with martial arts combat, desert races, endless journeys across vanished temples, and encounters with supernatural beings and ancient Gods.
THE TEAM
Its just me! The story, penciling, inking, colouring, lettering , graphic design, and the cover art... Its my way of working, to be in control throughout the entire process. It took me many years to fully develop my drawing technique and I want the graphic novel to be in accordance with my artistic style. My work is very original in the sense that all artwork is made with brush & Indian Ink, including the balloons - I only use the computer for colouring and lettering. This is why it will take me around 6 months to finish the 56 pages of the book. But if I surpass my funding goal I will be able to hire a colourist I can trust.
PAGES PREVIEW
You will find below the first finished pages and 2 additional pencil pages of the prologue. More pages will follow as updates through the life of this project, for the benefit of my project's supporters.




(pencil pages) The prologue of the graphic novel takes place in the mythical India, introducing a special character: Captain Burton, a globe-trotting fortune hunter with a keen interest in the hidden secrets of lost cities and ancient Gods. Like the opening sequence of an adventure movie, here Captain Burton explores the legendary Temple of Naga in India, in search of the Book of Tattva:






REWARDS DETAILS 
1) THE LOST ADVENTURES OF BARON BUCKMAN GIANT SIZE FINE ART PRINTS- a truly collectable limited edition, printed on Minuet 300 gsm cotton rag paper- AVAILABLE ONLY THROUGH THIS INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN AT A REDUCED PRICE ( 50 % discount over the price I usually sell at art galleries). These large size artworks are really spectacular, and illustrate the spirit of the story. The works were developed from original brush-ink drawings and have been showcased in London art events such as Illustrated 2015 in Brick Lane. The prints are: The Light at the Top of the World (showcased above, below and in the video), and Tattva Temple - The Lost Adventures of Baron Buckman (that can be seen below). Each print comes signed and numbered by the artist.
2) BARON BUCKMAN EDITION: printed in A4 paperback comic book format, with a thick cover - 21 cm x 29.7 cm, 56 pages. Your name will appear on the special "Thank You" page and each book will be signed and numbered. 
3) ALEXANDRE'S ZINE SKETCHBOOK : printed in A4 format, with a thick cover- 21 cm x 29.7cm, 24 pages, containing character drawings, sketches, storyboard images, writings, and extra material available for those interested in the creative work behind the story. A truly collectable item. Signed and numbered.
4) YOUR IMAGE DRAWN INTO THE STORY: You will have your portrait drawn into one of the graphic novel pages as a member of Baron Buckman's crew, along with a special mention to your name on the 'Thank you' page.
5) THE 'VIGILANT COAT OF ARMS' ART. The original brush & ink drawing on Cotman paper, that was used to create the original large size print The Light at the Top of the World. It measures 42 cm x 29.7 cm. Image depicted below.
6) PERSONAL PORTRAIT COMMISSION. with the same graphic style of "Captain Burton" work as pictured below. Printed on fine art paper 30 cm x 40 cm. You will have your picture in the centre, an original hand drawn lettering featuring your name on top, the background image of your preference and additional drawing elements of your choice around the frame. 
Images below:
1) "The Light of the Top of the World"( detail) , 80 x 125 cm Fine Art Print                   2)"Tattva"- The lost Adventures of Baron Buckman, 75 x 125 cm Fine art print          3) The "Vigilant Coat of Arms", Brush and Ink on Cotman paper 42 x 21.7 cm            4) Drawing style of the personal drawing commission








The Graphic Novel and the Zine Sketchbook will be printed by ExWhyZed , high quality creative printers based in the UK ( follow the link to see the top job the guys from ExWhyZed are making for Indie Comics and Graphic Novels here in the UK). I had a zine printed recently by them, so I know the printing quality will be excellent and really cool.



The fine art prints will be produced by Harwood King Printmakers Studios, expert printmakers based in East Sussex. They will be properly packed and shipped into very firm cardboard tubes.
THE BUDGET

Below is an idea of the budget if I have for example 200 backers pledging each one for 1 copy of the Graphic Novel- the Baron Buckman Edition (This is not the budget of the project in total). As you can see shipping costs are really expensive and  practically equivalent as the book printing.






STRETCHING GOALS
If I hit all my initial funding goal ALL backers that ordered the printed edition of the book, will receive 1 original A4 Brush & Ink drawing, depicting a character or scene of The Light at The Top of The World. More Stretching goals will be unlocked along the way if I surpass my initial funding goal.


Risks and challenges
The risk associated with this project is whether I am able to complete it in a timely manner. But the story has been written and the storyboard finished. I'm an experienced artist and have already calculated the amount of time necessary to finish this project and deliver the rewards. I will be in communication with you during the entire process and update you with all necessary information.
Important to say is that even if I don't hit my funding goal the graphic novel will be finished and printed anyway. Any amount of money will help me reach my campaign objective and I’ll still be able to fulfill the perks to you.
Last but not least, I'd like to say that I have big ambitions with this work and I truly believe in its potential to become a great piece of comic art that will engage and inspire you. The Light at the Top of the World is destined to be an stylish story with some of the most beautiful illustration work you'll ever see in a graphic novel.
One way you can contribute with my project is by pledging for a reward. Another way you can help this campaign is by sharing the project with your friends, and by posting a link to this Indiegogo project on Facebook.
If you have any questions just drop me a line!
Thank you very much, and see you at the Top of The World!
Alexandre Piacsek

story:
Click here to read the entire first issue for FREE!!!

Follow us on Facebook.

Howdy pardners! The Wild West just got a whole lot wilder! Hang onto your britches, 'cause you're in for one bumpy ride, with more gun-fights, saloon brawls, thrilling chases and bloody vendettas than you can shake a banana at!

Six-Gun Gorilla: Long Days of Vengeance is the rip-snortin’, bone-crushing, brain-blasting story of a pistol-packing Gorilla and his bloody quest to hunt down and destroy the gang of cut-throats who murdered the man who raised him like a father.

East Congo, 1849:  While on Safari in Africa, an English big-game hunter slaughters an entire troop of gorillas. While butchering the animals for trophies, his bush guides discover a survivor among the carnage: an infant gorilla, still clinging to his mother's breast. The orphan is placed aboard a boat to Europe where he captures the attention of two passengers: an Irish circus owner named Professor Malloy and his young daughter, Abigail.

Malloy wins the baby gorilla in a card game and brings him to America, where grows up as a member of the circus family. They name him "Kumba", an African word for "roar".

America, 1865: Taught to use giant, hand-crafted pistols as part of a sharpshooting act, Kumba has become a frontier sensation.


Although he loves his adopted father, Kumba's closest relationship is with his “big sister”, Abigail, who has become an accomplished trick horse rider. The unlikely siblings communicate through sign language, making Abigail the only one who can truly understand him. As the Civil War rages in the East, the circus tours the American Southwest staying as far away from the conflict as possible. But the war is about to come to them.

Enter mysterious stranger Giuliano Schmidt, a European immigrant on the run from a gang of ruthless outlaws led by Gravesend, the most sadistic killer West of the Pecos. Wounded while escaping from the gang, Giuliano stows away in the circus caravan, where he is discovered by Abigail, who nurses the stranger back to health.

Understanding that he's put his saviors in tremendous peril, Giuliano slips away at the first opportunity. But it’s too late: Gravesend and his gang have followed his trail to the circus and exact a terrible price on the family for meddling in their affairs. Driven half-mad with grief and rage, Kumba takes up his guns and sets out  on the vengeance trail, a trail that will lead him to an even greater evil. The strangest, most startling Western hero of them all has been born!

Sound like fun? Well it just so happens that a bunch of those egghead critics sure seem to like it!

"It don't get much better than this, Pal. A rootin--tootin' six-gun shootin', Western adventure that makes me run off at the adjectives. Wonderful stuff." - JOE R. LANSDALE (author of Bubba Ho-Tep and Cold In July)

"Cartoonish by only a pinch, the story does a great job of walking that line of being too fantastical, yet has just enough realism to make you understand that this is a story with heft and emotion… (an) indie powerhouse of a book.” - AIN'T IT COOL NEWS

“...it has real weight and emotion… a well-crafted western that just happens to have a gun-toting gorilla as the main character. If you like westerns, gorillas, crazy concepts, or just plain ol’ good comics, then this is one worth checking out.” - COMIC BOOK THERAPY

“Hats off to creators Brian Christgau and Adrian Sibar (whose art on this book is just magnificent!) because they have created a very compelling world.” - CRUSTULA.COM

"Who can say no to a well-executed western starring a ferocious six-gun wielding simian? ...a really good comic-book." - THE COMIC AGE

“Christgau’s story is setting itself up to be a fantastic reimagining of a lost classic, and one worth keeping an eye on.” - SUPER ATOMICA

“Together with artist Adrian Sibar, writer Brian Christgau has revised and changed-up the classic Six-Gun Gorilla pulp tale, blending it with beloved old school western cinematic tropes that make it an ingenious cross between Clint Eastwood’s Pale Rider and a wild Twilight Zone episode.” - NERDVANA

“Read this comic book. I’m dead serious. Find it, buy it, and enjoy how Six-Gun Gorilla: Long Days of Vengeance succeeds as any good comic book should.” - COMIC BASTARDS

“…a well-crafted western that just happens to have a gun-toting gorilla as the main character. If you like westerns, gorillas, crazy concepts, or just plain ol’ good comics, then this is one worth checking out.” - COMIC BOOK THERAPY

"...a work of art that pushes the classic notions of a true western with modern ideals and updated storytelling providing a cohesive product that is a ride to read and pleasure to look at." - PULP CULTURED

“…an indie book that deserves to play with the big boys.” - GEEKASM

Wee-doggies! Looks like we got ourselves a daisy!

To call Six-Gun Gorilla obscure is an understatement. The only reason anyone even knows of the character is thanks to a 1948 book about British Pulp literature called Boys Will Be Boys. Scholars and other interested parties couldn’t help but be captivated by the author’s description of that story and so it took on a mythic, Holy Grail status the way lost films like London After Midnight often do. Jess Nevins, an authority on this subject, recently got a chance to scan the story and has posted it on-line as a free download, bless his heart. Check it out - it's a fun read!

The character first came to my attention sometime in 2011, when I was perusing a website on Golden Age and Pulp superheroes (i.e. Doc Savage, The Shadow, The Spider). As a kid I was absolutely obsessed with great apes and was a huge fan of the original King Kong and Mighty Joe Young. I’m also a huge Western fan so the concept clicked with me instantly. I looked for the story and discovered, much to my chagrin, that not only was it out of print, it had never been reprinted and that the only two know copies in existence were under lock and key in a British museum!

But I just couldn’t get that title out of my head. That afternoon I drove to my local shopping mall (listening to the Hawk the Slayer soundtrack of all things) and the story basically wrote itself. By the time I pulled into the parking lot I had the entire yarn, beginning to end. As a writer it's rare that stories emerge fully formed like that, but this was one of those times. If there was no Six-Gun Gorilla for me to read, dag nabbit, I was gonna have to write the dang thing myself!

I approach the story as Tarzan flipped on its head: instead of a human raised by apes in the jungle you’ve got an ape raised by humans in the Old West. Tone-wise, think of the original Robocop. Six-Gun Gorilla: Long Days of Vengeance has outrageous moments aplenty – you’d hope so, given the outrageous premise – but I've always felt this sort of thing is way more fun when it's played straight.

Despite the uber/ultra/mega-obscure nature of the story, I wasn't the only to get bitten by the gunslinging gorilla bug. Just as the finishing touches were being put on the first issue I got an e-mail linking to article about an upcoming comic from BOOM! Studios, a Science Fiction saga titled... Six-Gun Gorilla.

Now, mind you, I embarked on this journey knowing full well that the story was going into the public domain in 2013, but what were the odds of someone else doing a comic based on that long lost Pulp story? Slim and none.

Slim won the day.

And when did I get this news? On April Fool's Day. You can't make this stuff up!

It’s a case of Hollywood refers to as “parallel development”. Both the other author and I  knew that the character was falling into the public domain in 2013 and so we set to work on our books completely oblivious of each other. Both of us were fired up by that title and concept largely, I’m guessing, because the actual story wasn’t available to read, so our imaginations filled in one very big blank.

Luckily, our stories couldn’t be more different. For starters they’re in two totally different genres. The BOOM! Six-Gun Gorilla is a Sci-Fi "re-imagining" (set on another planet in the 22nd Century about a televised blood sport ala The Running Man) while mine is a straight-forward, proper Western - all tumbleweeds and gunsmoke - with a very peculiar twist.

1. Raise the money to complete the next installment in the series.

That's it. Couldn't be simpler. The script for issue #7 is finished, all I need is the money to pay Adrian (my artist) and Bram (my letterer) and I'm good to go. I've even got the cover art, which is by the incredible Canaan White:

Kinda sweet if I say so m'self!

Six-Gun Gorilla: Long Days of Vengeance is 100% creator owned. I'm not an established industry professional that's using crowd-sourcing as a promotional platform. I'm just a guy who is making the comic book he always wanted to read. I'm off to a great start, if the critics and readers can be believed, but the the only way I can wrap this tall-tale up is with your generous assistance.

Brian Christgau - That would be me, your humble author. I live in suburban New York with my exceedingly handsome cat Figaro (aka. Mr. Figs, Mr. Handsome, Mr. Sexy, Sexecutioner). When I'm not exhuming obscure Pulp characters I volunteer at the local animal shelter, collect monster toys, practice German longsword fencing, and am co-president of the Rockland County Depression and Bi-Polar Support Alliance.

Adrián Sibar - Adrián is one of those artists who has a distinctive style but also a great deal of versatility, painting snazzy pop art canvases as well as crafting beautiful sequential art for comics like Batgirl for DC and Star Wars and Planet of the Apes for Dark Horse. Not only is he great illustrator, but he has a visual storytelling ability that is great at conveying drama and a sense of the epic. Most of all, he invests his work with the one thing I value most: heart. He never lets me down in that department. He’s also just a genuinely good person and incredibly easy and fun to work with. He lives in beautiful Buenos Aires, Argentina. His sexy Latin accent makes him the Antonio Banderas of the team, but sorry ladies - he's taken!


Caanan White - Our cover artist. Caanan is probably best known for his stand-out work on Avatar's Uber, an alternate reality saga about  a Nazi super-soldier program that turns the tide of the war. He's a major talent and one to look out for.

Bram Meehan - Our letterer. Bram designs, writes, account manages, creative directs, and produce the materials companies and individuals need to sell their products and services. He's all you could hope for in a letterer: fast and great!

Why am I asking for $3,300 to make a silly funny book? That's because I like to pay the freelancers who work for me and, guess what? They like to get paid for their work! Ain't that somethin'? Here's a quick breakdown:

$3,000 for the art + $300 for the lettering = $3,300 smackeroos.

And then IndieGoGo takes their (perfectly reasonable) 5% cut, amounting to $150.

Add in printing costs: 50 issues = $132.00.

I always sucked at math, but I believe that adds up to $3,432.

Website: www.sixgungorilla.com

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SixGunGorilla

So that's the pitch, folks! What d'ya say? Coming along for the ride?

story:
Short Summary

Hi im tristian and this is my first book, you might remember me from my school essays that my brother kept putting on his blog, then they got writren about by Andrew bolt and then they put them on the Lifted brow site and finaly the guys at Daily review said "omg pls tristian we love your commentry and editorial voice come write for us" and I had a column at Daily Review!

This is realy important to me because its my first book and i want to have a career as a blowhard political comentator. You have to have a book to do that, or at least a show on sky news that nobody watches.

 

What We Need & What You Get

My bro says we need $1100 for the print run and postage, I told him "no prob I have lots of fans and they will preorder it", he just looked at me and went uhhhhhhh ok I'll put a crowdfund up for you but after that please leave me alone cos he's got a wife and a child now and then he mutered something about pagination and I went to play destiny.

Indiegogo says I should tell you about our amazing perks but i don't have any, except if you want gold emboss on the book that's $3000. The book will have a spine and fit well on your shelf with other books.

If we dont reach the goal of $1100 thats cool, my bro will not print as many books and also I lose the bet and he said I have to babysit rachel EVERY sunday until after valentines day

 

The Impact

This book will be the most impacting one there is.

Aparently its not ok to promise things like that, instead let me say that my story of america is a bit different than other ones I read, its about what its like to be in the middle of a presidential campaign,, eating popcorn with ted cruz people, drinking cantelope juice with hilary clinton supporters, seeing donald trump in a horse dancing stadium, meeting intresting people and letting them drive me home and give me christian pamphlets.

 

Risks & Challenges

Because you value my transparency let me reasure you that my publisher is very good at making books and also sending them to people. The printer knows how to put my words and drawings on paper and do the thing that makes them stuck together but not so stuck together that you can't open the book.

Theres many risks and challenges in the creation of this book but hitchhiking in las vegas without getting killed was the main one and that went ok.*

* please nobody tell my gran I did this

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people are quite cheap and maybe dont want to buy this book even after I explained how good it is, thats ok! its totally ok, maybe you don't have anyone you want to buy a christmas present for.

If you dont want a book but still think im good you should tell everyone you know about the book so maybe they'll buy one.

also you can help by please getting the new single by my friends the veronicas!! it's called On Your Side and it's so good the video is actually really serious and hardcore. Theveronicas.com or it's on itunes and spotify

Short Summary
Hi im tristian and this is my first book, you might remember me from my school essays that my brother kept putting on his blog, then they got writren about by Andrew bolt and then they put them on the Lifted brow site and finaly the guys at Daily review said "omg pls tristian we love your commentry and editorial voice come write for us" and I had a column at Daily Review!
This is realy important to me because its my first book and i want to have a career as a blowhard political comentator. You have to have a book to do that, or at least a show on sky news that nobody watches.
 

What We Need & What You Get
My bro says we need $1100 for the print run and postage, I told him "no prob I have lots of fans and they will preorder it", he just looked at me and went uhhhhhhh ok I'll put a crowdfund up for you but after that please leave me alone cos he's got a wife and a child now and then he mutered something about pagination and I went to play destiny.
Indiegogo says I should tell you about our amazing perks but i don't have any, except if you want gold emboss on the book that's $3000. The book will have a spine and fit well on your shelf with other books.
If we dont reach the goal of $1100 thats cool, my bro will not print as many books and also I lose the bet and he said I have to babysit rachel EVERY sunday until after valentines day

story:
Short Summary

Code Limbo started has a short story on December 23rd 2013. But over the course of a year it became a book. It will be published on May 10th. However we would love to make it a graphic novel also. Do you want to read a spine numbing thriller book that has action, horror, and fantasy? Will then Code Limbo or Code Limbo The Graphic Novel is for you. Before donating you can read the first few pages here. 

The Story Summary

Code was a normal eight year old boy until his mother was brutally murdered right in front of him. In order to still alive Code is forced to go into hiding. However after eight years in hiding he decides to leave to find his mother's murderer and finally get revenge for her death.

story:
Lady Yoga!
Superhero Yoga - Above and Beyond The Mat.
In this book and App Laurie Searle used her years of experience working with NFL players, mommy-taskers, beauty magazine editors, Oscar winners, injured athletes, law students, royalty, at-risk youth, special needs kids, socialites, the dude that just needs to lose a few pounds, the girl who wants to run her first 10K, people who talk on their iPhone while stretching, or text during reps and finally, herself – as an ever changing guinea pig of testing what works where.

Superhero Yoga takes the basics of yoga postures by taking you off the mat and into every day by providing the reader with real life scenarios that yoga and fitness sequences can be performed with ease and fun. From waiting in the carpool lane to being broken up with via text – Superhero Yoga is the immediate resource for yoga right now.

Superhero Yoga takes readers through 12 accessible chapters on how to find yoga, fitness and calm during the typical day to day, from the job to the commute to the holidays with family.
The book is geared toward women, with budding career and/or family life in their late 20's to early 40’s.

Laurie Searle’s comic strips have been published monthly since 2010 in LA Yoga Magazine, Miami Yoga Magazine and My Yoga Scene. Laurie Searle is a Yoga instructor (Yoga Alliance experienced registered 500-Hour Level), comic strip writer, personal fitness trainer, massage therapist, nutrition specialist (National Academy of Sports Medicine), mat Pilates instructor, and comedic actress. Laurie has been featured  on It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, Nickelodeon’s Sam and Cat, and several daytime soap operas. She leads teacher trainings nationally and internationally with the Sphota Yoga School.
