story:
WHAT

Dendrolagus is a Swedish micro publisher of comics with focus on experimentation with storytelling. Comics that really takes advantage of the medium itself. Dendrolagus is also an anthology of said comics, now presenting it's second issue, filled with powerful, inspiring and contemplative storytelling by 8 different artists sharing 64 pages between them.

WHY

I love going to comics festivals and especially zine heavy ones. That's where you can discover the amazing and fringy weird stuff that artists put out themselves, their passion projects. The stuff we make when we aren't creating to make a living. Art for art's sake. And that's one reason I decided to publish Dendrolagus in English, to share these great comics with the world. These are comics that deserve to not be limited to only the tiny crowd of Swedish speaking comics fans.

WHO

I'm Steve Nyberg. A Comic artist turned publisher/editor of Dendrolagus. I've been self publishing zines and mini comics in different forms for years (apart from being published by other publishers as well) and last year I turned Dendrolagus into a micro publisher. The idea is to promote alternative comics that experiment with the storytelling itself. To create an outlet for these comics to be read by as many people as possible. And I've got some amazing comics from these artists:

Sofie Louise Dam

 

Johanna Larsson Pinedo


 

Hanna Lundin Tistelö

 

Louise Löfberg

 

Yuka Masuko

Gonzalo de las Heras


 

Ellinor Richey


 

Andrea Udd

 

Dendrolagus' main focus is on Swedish/Nordic artists, however in this issue I've also included a comic by Japanese artist Yuka Masuko who's living and working in Germany and says her comic is partially inspired by a trip through Sweden. The other featured artists are either Swedish, Sweden based or from our friendly neighbour Denmark.

WHEN

Dendrolagus #2 will be released and shipped to all backers in the first week of May. The aim is to have it released during Stockholm's International Comics Festival (SIS) the 5th of May and of course I'll send it out to all backers before that.

HOW

This campaign is to cover the printing of the anthology. Quality offset printing is good looking but it's not cheap. The artists' pay is in a separate budget and if we reach our goal to cover the printing cost we can sweeten the artists' pay with whatever funds exceeds the goal.

All the comics are finished. They just need to be sent to the printer. The funding is already secured too so there's really no risk for you when backing the project. Dendrolagus #2 will be made, and will be made on time. It's already booked to appear at the international comics festivals of both Stockholm and Toronto in early May. And since I've done this before - both the anthology and the crowdfunding - I'm confident in my promise of delivering Dendrolagus #2 to you all. And I can guarantee that it's going to be at least as amazing as the last one.
 
However, I'm funding it out of my own pockets so the crowdfunding is to help out with these expenses, making it less of a risk for my private finances and making sure I can keep this anthology going with even more issues to come.

So please pre order your copy of Dendrolagus #2 by donating to the campaign or help out just by sharing the campaign with others. Tell your friends!

Thank you!

/Steve Nyberg

story:
Heyo! I'm Zach, a husband and father working as an illustrator for games and comics for the past 7 years. I started World of Golma in 2013 with a handful of talented writers to create an overview of the world. http://igg.me/at/worldofgolma/x/3577072#/

   Now, I'm creating the first 100* page graphic novel in the series. Based on the story originally written by Cheyenne Martin. We dive deep in to the origins of Aerah, and all the events that led to him becoming immortal. The story (and humor) are inspired from comics like Thrud the Barbarian, and Saga. 

   I am asking for your help to bring the first book in the World of Golma series to life! If you can help me by backing this campaign or sharing it I would be extremely grateful! 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Check out the story so far on WebToons!

*Page number is varied to be more but not less than 100 pages.

Vexops

These Incredible Characters have been in my mind for years. What lurks in the Imagination of Ray Johnson you Ask? Incredible characters with amazing stories and Adventures. 

What Ask & What You will Get

When I stepped up to create. I wanted to create Characters and stories with Impact. I love 90's Comic book heroes and the Great effect it had on me as a fan. I want to deliver that to you and that is where you Awesome folks step in. Every single dime will go into this Project to ensure a rock solid quality Product. So I Hired Rob Liefeld, Shelby Robertson, Karl Altstaetter, Marat Mychaels, and then of course Yours truly. To give you some Amazing covers. Check out the Incredible reward Tiers I have in store for you. You will not be disappointed!!

 

Risks & Challenges

Lucky for me I have found a Printer that Produces some over the Top Quality Books. With this company working as my go to Printer for Publication. I am no longer restricted to the Astronomical Pricing that other Printers have offered me. This was a challenge I overcame and I am truly Excited if this book gets funded to cover the Cost. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Check out and make use the Indiegogo share tools. They will help get the word out. Share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram... Tell your friends, your Coworkers, your Family. Lets make this Book a Reality. THANK YOU!!

story:
What is A Girl’s Guide to Finding her Happy Pace?

This fun, easy to read graphic novel is a new kind of self-help coaching tool for girls.  Graphic novels make digesting heavy content easier and relatable. Girls can apply these lessons to their lives over and over as they navigate the challenges of the girl world. 

Follow Eva on the journey to finding her happy pace as she navigates teenage life.  She is anxious about friends, judging herself, trying to be perfect, and fit in.  One day, she is the victim of some mean girls and she realizes she is not ok, and crisis ensues. Anxiety and self-doubt set in that prompt her to rethink her whole identity.  Step by step Eva learns how to navigate teenhood and high school, illustrating the 5 core lessons to finding her happy pace.

Life Coach and Sole Girls founder, Ashley Wiles’s mantra is “Find your Happy Pace.” Over the past 6 years Ashley has dedicated her life to empowering, mentoring and coaching girls ages 5 to 12, teens and also the women who role model and raise confident girls.

This guide extends beyond the book, creating an online space called Sole School for girls to receive mentorship from Ashley as well as a guide for mentors to discuss the topics and create a supportive community.

A Girl’s Guide to Finding her Happy Pace outlines life lessons and tools girls will learn to navigate through their teen years in an easy to digest, less than an hour-read, fun graphic novel.

The Guide consists of:

  • 60+ pages of  graphics
  • Easy to read, relatable comics
  • Mentorship and role model advice
  • Personal development prompts
  • An opportunity to access mentorship, and community – join the Sole Girls!

Learn how to make better choices,  become a better friend, be a happier person and navigate the girl world.

Join the thousands of women and girls whose lives have been transformed by Sole Girls and Ashley’s story, and let their success stories inspire you. As Ashley says, “We are on this journey to find our happy pace, and it looks different for each one of us, but you’re never alone!”

It’s time to invest in girls and help them find their happy pace.   10% of the profits from the sale of this book will be donated to scholarship programs for more girls to attend Sole Girls programs.

Sneak peek of the 60+ page graphic novel ...
 

If you're ready to change lives, impact girls and help girls find their Happy Pace, check out the list of perk opportunities included in this campaign. If you want to learn more about the who, what, why and how, or have time to spare, there's a ton more information included below. If you can share this with anyone, that would be SOLE awesome. Thank you in advance!

What makes me so certain about all this?

Let me share a personal story of a girl I worked with.

Kate and I met at our very first SOLE Girls summer camp in 2013. At the end of camp, we give each girl a certificate that recognizes something the leaders thought she was really great at, in her case, it was "Being a Leader". We present the certificate during a ceremony, and it is a really special opportunity for each girl to shine. When Kate received her certificate, she accepted it and slowly ripped it up while the other girls received theirs. At this point, Kate was not able to accept a compliment. So while we thought she was an incredible leader and helpful to others, she had a million reasons why she wasn’t and was not able to see herself from our perspective. My heart sunk, I hadn’t changed her life in two days (I clearly needed a reality check). However, we managed to convince her to accept a new certificate that we would take to her house especially for her.

After that first summer camp, Kate joined our nine-week program. This time she had all the answers, lots to say, and seemed very confident. But, as soon as it came time to do something that she didn’t feel she was the best at, like running, she was the first one to count herself out. She had a long list of negative things that she believed about herself. One day, while on a run, I decided to ask her (after a few weeks of recognizing her pattern),“Do you think that is true Kate? Do you think it’s true that you are not as great as the other girls because of the reasons you mentioned?”

Kate: “Yes.”

Ashley: “Ok – let’s try something. Repeat after me, “I’m strong, I’m powerful, I’m Kate.”

Kate: “Why would I say that, what’s the point? I’m not very strong, or powerful, I'm just a girl. There are people changing the world, they are powerful.”

Ashley: “Just try.”

Kate (in a whisper and so fast that it was almost indistinguishable): “I’m strong. I’m powerful. I’m Kate. There I did it, that didn’t do anything.”

Ashley: “Cool, yes you are. Try again.”

Kate: “I’m strong, I’m powerful, I’m Kate.”

Then all of a sudden she stopped running and broke into tears.

Ashley: Oh shoot! What did I do now?

Others started to pass us and when we finally got going again, we continued to the end of the run in silence. At the end of the session, she stayed behind after everyone else had left.  She gave me a hug and whispered in my ear, “I’m strong, I’m powerful, I’m Kate.” Each week after that she repeated it, slowly and very quietly at first, but each week she became a little bit more confident. When it came to the last week, we used our training to complete a five-kilometre run, and her anxiety was running high. In the end, Kate burst through that Finish Line with her hands up in the air and yelling, “I’m strong, I’m powerful, I’m KATE!”

Now, Kate is a role model for other girls, she mentors younger girls! She is a leader, and while she still has anxiety, the more she connects inside to the possibility of awesomeness, the easier it is for her to manage.

Why Crowdfunding? And how can you help?

Crowdfunding will help determine the demand and assist with sharing Ashley’s message.

All contributions will be put toward the printing of more books and help with the creation of the online community. Any surplus will be put towards PR and video documenting the Happy Pace Movement to inspire more girls around the globe to find their unique voices, love themselves, make better friendships and have more fun being active.

There's a number of different perk offerings, many which include a copy of the A Girl’s Guide to Finding her Happy Pace and memberships to sole school - a mentorship space for tween and teen girls taught via online videos on teachable.  Ashley has even included a few coaching packages and a keynote speaker offering.

Check out the options and feel free to message Ashley directly with any questions or specific requests. Whether you're able to purchase a book in advance or not, it would be extra cool if you shared this with those you care about!

Who is Ashley Wiles?

Ashley is a 3 x Ironman finisher, a 70.3 Ironman World Championship finisher, a mental health advocate, a Tedx speaker, a Life Coach and a Mental Health advocate.  She is also the founder of award-winning social enterprise Sole Girls which is licensed across Canada and in Australia.

Ashley will never forget the first time she saw Amanda Todd’s video,  a girl who at the age of 15 committed suicide due to mental health, cyber bullying and some mean people.   As Ashley had personally been experiencing anxiety and depression, abuse, and had self-isolated,  for the first time in a long time, she realized that she wasn’t alone.  She was surprised and terrified to find so many women and girls were suffering the same as she was.  She realized that she didn’t want to suffer anymore, and more importantly that she didn’t want other girls to suffer as she had or Amanda had.

She moved back to Canada and dove into the research, asking some big questions: Who are girls, Why were girls suffering so much, What were the factors that helped girls be happy and healthy and how had we fallen so far away from that.  Growing up in the age of the Spice Girls “girl power”, Ashley knew that Girl Power needed an upgrade, and she was the girl to do it.

She committed to positive mental health and saw the changes happen to her mind quickly. She wanted to help as many girls as possible navigate their paths, to include positive mental health, living healthy active lives, staying in sports and finding mentors and role models.   Before she knew it Sole Girls had a waitlist and Ashley knew she wasn’t alone.  Other people, parents, teachers, principals, girls knew something was missing in our communities too.

 Ashley believes that lifelong happiness and well-being must be built on a foundation of self-love, support, and health and that this is possible for everyone. Through her award-winning programs for girls at SoleGirls.org and her leadHERship programs for women, Ashley has helped over 5000 girls, teens and hundreds of women navigate their lives and find their inner awesome.

BONUS (at the bottom of this page): Ashley invites you to read WHY she's so inspired to lead a life of total awesomeness - and why she wants you to do the same.


What people are saying about Ashley and A Girl’s Guide to Finding Her Happy Pace?

"As a Recreation Therapist, it makes me so happy to see more education tools coming out around empowering young women to self manage their physical and mental health. The five key lessons described in "A Girl's Guide to Finding Her Happy Pace" provide valuable takeaways that can be implemented into daily life. I can see this book being used in various youth movement and mental health programs around the world." -Meghan Burrows, Recreation Therapist and Performance Coach.

“ The whole idea of a Happy Pace blew my mind. Getting to learn from Sole Girls has been the greatest honour of my life.  Sole Girls taught me how to listen to myself and others in a way that I never had before. Ashley taught me how to live my life from a place that is authentically me, using my values. She taught me how to change the negative voices in my head to voices that empower me. She taught me what real love, support, and community look and feel like. By being a role model for me, she taught me how to be a role model for girls.  Every girl needs Sole Girls, and this book!”  - Annika Macfarlane, Teen soleteer and now Sole Girls Coach

“After my first session of soleteering (mentoring) for Sole Girls, I was hooked. Sole Girls and mentorship helped me pull my life together as a teen, and create goals. I started going for runs if I felt stressed out. Ashley came into my life when I needed her most, she brought Sole Girls to me and it saved me. Now, I don’t believe in saying, “I can’t” because I know there is always some way.” Maddie - teen soleteer and now 4th year university student UBCO

“I met Ashley when she began her journey with Sole Girls. {My daughter, Amanda Todd, had left us only months before}. Her experiences, she realized, were the same as many others and knew she was not alone in this world.  Girls will benefit from Ashley’s passion and experience. This book will be a wonderful tool to allow girls to gain insight into their own self-worth and be the best person they can endeavour to be.” -Carol Todd mother of Amanda Todd and  advocate against cyberbullying

" As a Mom of a tween in her second year of middle school this book really resonates with me! We all know how important communication is with any relationship and A Girl's Guide To Finding Her Happy Place demonstrates a healthy, open dialogue between mentor and young lady! It also presents a great opportunity and catalyst for parent/child conversation on topics that otherwise might remain silent. I am looking forward to introducing it to my daughter!"
-Vanessa Jensen, Ironman athlete, and mom 

"As a teacher of tween and teen girls I have seen the same patterns over and over that existed when I was their age and have only increased with the use of social media. This book helps girls to understand that they are not alone in navigating the girl world and that there are so, so many strategies to help you find your inner awesome! I would make this mandatory reading for all girls in my classes."
-Veronica May, Teacher Langley BC

"A Girl’s Guide to Finding Her Happy Pace tackles the messy highs and lows of today’s Girl World, including bullying, social media, rejection, friendship, mentorship, and understanding values. This book brings to life the power that simple practices, like relationship-building and conversation, can have on helping girls discover and live within their confident, true selves. The Guide also makes mental health an approachable topic, modeling healthy ways to engage girls in navigating real teenage challenges. As a teacher, I recommend this book for tweens and teens and the people who love and support them: parents, teachers, mentors, school counselors, youth group leaders, and beyond!" 
Sara Russell, Teacher and Master Coach

BONUS: A personal message from Coach Ashley, "Do you want to find your happy pace?"

Did you know that Girls drop out of sport 6x the rate of boys, and they don't drop out for lack of skill. Girls drop out because of these 4 reasons.

1. Financial Reasons 2. Social Belonging  3. Health Issues 4. Lack of ROLE MODELS!!!!

I’ll never forget entering high school.  Everyone standing in their little groups and I knew no one.  It was terrifying. Trying out for a team… terrifying. Not making the team… mortifying.  Where did I go to talk about this embarrassment? I was lucky that I was part of another team outside of school and also that I had at least 1 role model/mentor in my life, otherwise I surely would have dropped out of sport. 

Why are sport and role models and mentorship so important for girls?

Why Sports?

Youth who get extra physical activity in school do better in reading and math and have an increased ability to absorb knowledge and to learn things,

It helps with behavioral issues in the classroom.

Solves a lot of interpersonal issues because they have an opportunity to get that energy out.

Exercise increases the concentration of both dopamine and norepinephrine, as well as other brain chemicals. a dose of exercise is like taking a bit of Ritalin or Adderall, it’s similar to taking a stimulant.

Even a little bit more movement makes us happier (yay mental health)

Why Role models and mentors?

Mentors give advice and help brainstorm - they act as a confidant that you can unload your problems with. They’ll listen, help you dissect exactly what’s bothering you, and provide support as you think of solutions together.

Mentorship is all about forming a great relationship centered around a mutual passion. While there are plenty of similarities to friendship, it is much more than that.

They may be the person who relentlessly boosts your self-esteem and confidence until you feel brave enough to stop over your own boundaries, or the person providing the knowledge you need to grow.

Some more staggering stats: 

45% of teens say they are online almost constantly, but over 25% of girls in grades 7-12 say they have been the victims of cyber bullying. 

Navigating the Girl World

Like all girls, I have lived through the girl world, the friendships, the body image struggles, the anxiety, being cut from the team, the trends, the drama, the expectations and all the feels. I had always thought that when I was an adult, I’d finally get to make the rules, run the show… but it turns out there were just more rules: different game, same story.  

Maybe you can relate. Your girl world might be slightly different but however you grew up, you did grow up and had to learn to navigate the lessons somehow.  Sometimes the hard way.

Why create the Girl’s Guide to Finding her Happy Pace?

My goal in writing this guide is to create an easily digestible and relatable tool for girls to help navigate tween and teenhood and maybe even beyond. I want it to be so easy to read that girls keep coming back to it as they learn the lessons in their own lives and relate it back to the story. We all learn life lessons, but wouldn’t it be nice to know some of the core lessons in advance? This book will create a space and a community for girls to understand themselves, which really benefits those around her. We all know a girl in our life who matters, whether it was a mother or a daughter or a sister or a friend.  It’s time to give that girl a very simple tool that she can use for the rest of her life and share with others.

So, welcome to a new kind of self-help book. It’s not a long-winded novel about what not to do and how to be better.  It’s a comic book, for girls, one that all girls deserve to read and have access to. Half the population.

Getting a grip on the Girl World is particularly important now because of the rising numbers of girls’ suicide, declining participation rates in sport, and staggering self-worth statistics.  

But there is a reason for hope. On the other end of the spectrum, there are women who want to be role models, who have overcome the challenges, the haters, the reasons to drop out and they want to share. Put simply, linking tools and mentorship to girls, and keeping girls in sport is a powerful combination that can change—and possibly save— lives.

Being a girl doesn’t have to include all the drama and stress. There are ways, as you’ll see throughout this book, to be the most awesome person you know.  Finding your happy pace is really about learning, and realizing who you are and who you want to be.

So what about today?

Today, I am honored to have built a strong community at Sole Girls of Women who can be vulnerable with each other, who have become lifelong friends because of Sole Girls and who strive to live their best lives being the role models that girls need. I am still learning too. In my professional life, I’ve evolved from a life coach to the founder of the an award winning social enterprise that has affected thousands of girls, to an international speaker, author and Happy Pace Seeker. I’m honored to have the ability to help people every single day, now that’s SOLE awesome!

Beyond my Sole family and career, one of the most important aspects of my well-being is my mental health. I continually strive to understand my ego, challenge my beliefs and learn as well as apply the hard lessons that help me grow.  And at the end of each day, I ask myself: “What did you love today and what did you learn today?”

I know we are all capable of finding our Happy Pace. That is, while I believe that we can all find it at our own pace, we don’t have to do it by ourselves. Now that you’ve found this book, you have found your community—your sole sisters. No matter what, you are not alone. We are here to encourage and support each other to be the happiest, healthiest versions of ourselves.

So, hands up if you’re ready to find your Happy Pace? Click on over to the best perk for you!

PS - a huge thank you to all those that have supported me and Sole Girls on this journey. It's been quite the ride and it's only just beginning!
story_txt:
What is A Girl’s Guide to Finding her Happy Pace?This fun, easy to read graphic novel is a new kind of self-help coaching tool for girls.  Graphic novels make digesting heavy content easier and relatable. Girls can apply these lessons to their lives over and over as they navigate the challenges of the girl world. Follow Eva on the journey to finding her happy pace as she navigates teenage life.  She is anxious about friends, judging herself, trying to be perfect, and fit in.  One day, she is the victim of some mean girls and she realizes she is not ok, and crisis ensues. Anxiety and self-doubt set in that prompt her to rethink her whole identity.  Step by step Eva learns how to navigate teenhood and high school, illustrating the 5 core lessons to finding her happy pace.Life Coach and Sole Girls founder, Ashley Wiles’s mantra is “Find your Happy Pace.” Over the past 6 years Ashley has dedicated her life to empowering, mentoring and coaching girls ages 5 to 12, teens and also the women who role model and raise confident girls.This guide extends beyond the book, creating an online space called Sole School for girls to receive mentorship from Ashley as well as a guide for mentors to discuss the topics and create a supportive community.A Girl’s Guide to Finding her Happy Pace outlines life lessons and tools girls will learn to navigate through their teen years in an easy to digest, less than an hour-read, fun graphic novel.The Guide consists of:
60+ pages of  graphics
Easy to read, relatable comics
Mentorship and role model advice
Personal development prompts
An opportunity to access mentorship, and community – join the Sole Girls!
Learn how to make better choices,  become a better friend, be a happier person and navigate the girl world.Join the thousands of women and girls whose lives have been transformed by Sole Girls and Ashley’s story, and let their success stories inspire you. As Ashley says, “We are on this journey to find our happy pace, and it looks different for each one of us, but you’re never alone!”It’s time to invest in girls and help them find their happy pace.   10% of the profits from the sale of this book will be donated to scholarship programs for more girls to attend Sole Girls programs.Sneak peek of the 60+ page graphic novel ... If you're ready to change lives, impact girls and help girls find their Happy Pace, check out the list of perk opportunities included in this campaign. If you want to learn more about the who, what, why and how, or have time to spare, there's a ton more information included below. If you can share this with anyone, that would be SOLE awesome. Thank you in advance!What makes me so certain about all this?Let me share a personal story of a girl I worked with.Kate and I met at our very first SOLE Girls summer camp in 2013. At the end of camp, we give each girl a certificate that recognizes something the leaders thought she was really great at, in her case, it was "Being a Leader". We present the certificate during a ceremony, and it is a really special opportunity for each girl to shine. When Kate received her certificate, she accepted it and slowly ripped it up while the other girls received theirs. At this point, Kate was not able to accept a compliment. So while we thought she was an incredible leader and helpful to others, she had a million reasons why she wasn’t and was not able to see herself from our perspective. My heart sunk, I hadn’t changed her life in two days (I clearly needed a reality check). However, we managed to convince her to accept a new certificate that we would take to her house especially for her.After that first summer camp, Kate joined our nine-week program. This time she had all the answers, lots to say, and seemed very confident. But, as soon as it came time to do something that she didn’t feel she was the best at, like running, she was the first one to count herself out. She had a long list of negative things that she believed about herself. One day, while on a run, I decided to ask her (after a few weeks of recognizing her pattern),“Do you think that is true Kate? Do you think it’s true that you are not as great as the other girls because of the reasons you mentioned?”Kate: “Yes.”Ashley: “Ok – let’s try something. Repeat after me, “I’m strong, I’m powerful, I’m Kate.”Kate: “Why would I say that, what’s the point? I’m not very strong, or powerful, I'm just a girl. There are people changing the world, they are powerful.”Ashley: “Just try.”Kate (in a whisper and so fast that it was almost indistinguishable): “I’m strong. I’m powerful. I’m Kate. There I did it, that didn’t do anything.”Ashley: “Cool, yes you are. Try again.”Kate: “I’m strong, I’m powerful, I’m Kate.”Then all of a sudden she stopped running and broke into tears.Ashley: Oh shoot! What did I do now?Others started to pass us and when we finally got going again, we continued to the end of the run in silence. At the end of the session, she stayed behind after everyone else had left.  She gave me a hug and whispered in my ear, “I’m strong, I’m powerful, I’m Kate.” Each week after that she repeated it, slowly and very quietly at first, but each week she became a little bit more confident. When it came to the last week, we used our training to complete a five-kilometre run, and her anxiety was running high. In the end, Kate burst through that Finish Line with her hands up in the air and yelling, “I’m strong, I’m powerful, I’m KATE!”Now, Kate is a role model for other girls, she mentors younger girls! She is a leader, and while she still has anxiety, the more she connects inside to the possibility of awesomeness, the easier it is for her to manage.Why Crowdfunding? And how can you help?Crowdfunding will help determine the demand and assist with sharing Ashley’s message.All contributions will be put toward the printing of more books and help with the creation of the online community. Any surplus will be put towards PR and video documenting the Happy Pace Movement to inspire more girls around the globe to find their unique voices, love themselves, make better friendships and have more fun being active.There's a number of different perk offerings, many which include a copy of the A Girl’s Guide to Finding her Happy Pace and memberships to sole school - a mentorship space for tween and teen girls taught via online videos on teachable.  Ashley has even included a few coaching packages and a keynote speaker offering.Check out the options and feel free to message Ashley directly with any questions or specific requests. Whether you're able to purchase a book in advance or not, it would be extra cool if you shared this with those you care about!Who is Ashley Wiles?
Ashley is a 3 x Ironman finisher, a 70.3 Ironman World Championship finisher, a mental health advocate, a Tedx speaker, a Life Coach and a Mental Health advocate.  She is also the founder of award-winning social enterprise Sole Girls which is licensed across Canada and in Australia.Ashley will never forget the first time she saw Amanda Todd’s video,  a girl who at the age of 15 committed suicide due to mental health, cyber bullying and some mean people.   As Ashley had personally been experiencing anxiety and depression, abuse, and had self-isolated,  for the first time in a long time, she realized that she wasn’t alone.  She was surprised and terrified to find so many women and girls were suffering the same as she was.  She realized that she didn’t want to suffer anymore, and more importantly that she didn’t want other girls to suffer as she had or Amanda had.She moved back to Canada and dove into the research, asking some big questions: Who are girls, Why were girls suffering so much, What were the factors that helped girls be happy and healthy and how had we fallen so far away from that.  Growing up in the age of the Spice Girls “girl power”, Ashley knew that Girl Power needed an upgrade, and she was the girl to do it.She committed to positive mental health and saw the changes happen to her mind quickly. She wanted to help as many girls as possible navigate their paths, to include positive mental health, living healthy active lives, staying in sports and finding mentors and role models.   Before she knew it Sole Girls had a waitlist and Ashley knew she wasn’t alone.  Other people, parents, teachers, principals, girls knew something was missing in our communities too. Ashley believes that lifelong happiness and well-being must be built on a foundation of self-love, support, and health and that this is possible for everyone. Through her award-winning programs for girls at SoleGirls.org and her leadHERship programs for women, Ashley has helped over 5000 girls, teens and hundreds of women navigate their lives and find their inner awesome.BONUS (at the bottom of this page): Ashley invites you to read WHY she's so inspired to lead a life of total awesomeness - and why she wants you to do the same.
What people are saying about Ashley and A Girl’s Guide to Finding Her Happy Pace?"As a Recreation Therapist, it makes me so happy to see more education tools coming out around empowering young women to self manage their physical and mental health. The five key lessons described in "A Girl's Guide to Finding Her Happy Pace" provide valuable takeaways that can be implemented into daily life. I can see this book being used in various youth movement and mental health programs around the world." -Meghan Burrows, Recreation Therapist and Performance Coach.“ The whole idea of a Happy Pace blew my mind. Getting to learn from Sole Girls has been the greatest honour of my life.  Sole Girls taught me how to listen to myself and others in a way that I never had before. Ashley taught me how to live my life from a place that is authentically me, using my values. She taught me how to change the negative voices in my head to voices that empower me. She taught me what real love, support, and community look and feel like. By being a role model for me, she taught me how to be a role model for girls.  Every girl needs Sole Girls, and this book!”  - Annika Macfarlane, Teen soleteer and now Sole Girls Coach“After my first session of soleteering (mentoring) for Sole Girls, I was hooked. Sole Girls and mentorship helped me pull my life together as a teen, and create goals. I started going for runs if I felt stressed out. Ashley came into my life when I needed her most, she brought Sole Girls to me and it saved me. Now, I don’t believe in saying, “I can’t” because I know there is always some way.” Maddie - teen soleteer and now 4th year university student UBCO“I met Ashley when she began her journey with Sole Girls. {My daughter, Amanda Todd, had left us only months before}. Her experiences, she realized, were the same as many others and knew she was not alone in this world.  Girls will benefit from Ashley’s passion and experience. This book will be a wonderful tool to allow girls to gain insight into their own self-worth and be the best person they can endeavour to be.” -Carol Todd mother of Amanda Todd and  advocate against cyberbullying" As a Mom of a tween in her second year of middle school this book really resonates with me! We all know how important communication is with any relationship and A Girl's Guide To Finding Her Happy Place demonstrates a healthy, open dialogue between mentor and young lady! It also presents a great opportunity and catalyst for parent/child conversation on topics that otherwise might remain silent. I am looking forward to introducing it to my daughter!"-Vanessa Jensen, Ironman athlete, and mom "As a teacher of tween and teen girls I have seen the same patterns over and over that existed when I was their age and have only increased with the use of social media. This book helps girls to understand that they are not alone in navigating the girl world and that there are so, so many strategies to help you find your inner awesome! I would make this mandatory reading for all girls in my classes."-Veronica May, Teacher Langley BC"A Girl’s Guide to Finding Her Happy Pace tackles the messy highs and lows of today’s Girl World, including bullying, social media, rejection, friendship, mentorship, and understanding values. This book brings to life the power that simple practices, like relationship-building and conversation, can have on helping girls discover and live within their confident, true selves. The Guide also makes mental health an approachable topic, modeling healthy ways to engage girls in navigating real teenage challenges. As a teacher, I recommend this book for tweens and teens and the people who love and support them: parents, teachers, mentors, school counselors, youth group leaders, and beyond!" Sara Russell, Teacher and Master CoachBONUS: A personal message from Coach Ashley, "Do you want to find your happy pace?"Did you know that Girls drop out of sport 6x the rate of boys, and they don't drop out for lack of skill. story:
What is it about?

Hello, we are Transmedia Tale!

Transmedia Tale is a production company based in London, which produces web-series, games and comics involving transmedia storytelling (see the Links section below!). Transmedia storytelling is the technique of telling a story experience across multiple platforms and formats using current digital technologies and allowing audience participation. We are filmmakers, writers, game developers and artists: our mission is to adapt our original stories to the most innovative platforms out there for the audience to explore and enjoy!

Through this campaign we would like to fund the issues #2 and #3 of the comic series 'Sue, the Urban Sorceress' which is part of our horror world called 'A Monster Lass'. Sue is a young psychic who has to cope with her powerful gift. She inhabits a darker version of London and does what teenagers do: she goes to school and deals with nasty bullies who torment her. However, a terrible secret will be revealed to her... something that will change her life forever.

This project is self-funded. Without your help we cannot tell the fascinating journey of Sue. The first issue of the manga can be found on Comixoloy.

Your contribution will bring to life a memorable story that resonates with a generation of "invisible" teenagers. In such uncertain times, we want to give them a voice through a tale of love and mystery that will amaze the reader. Our final aim is to attract Hollywood companies and bring Sue to the screen as a TV series too. That would be the next Game of Thrones!

Some References...

What We Need & What You Get!

We would need £1500 to produce two manga comics.

Helping us in this will make your name appear in a special page of the comic and receive all the comic issues for free via email!

The Impact

Our first issue of 'Sue, the Urban Sorceress' has been largerly appreciated by fans and it has been noted by producers in Hollywood. We would need more to convince them that Sue needs to come to life on the screen!

Risks & Challenges

We are producing comics at a very low budget and this makes the production difficult at times. However, we already have in place a pipeline that worked fine for the first episode. We are sure that thanks to your kind contribution we can make it!

Preview of the first episode

Other Ways You Can Help

Some might want to contribute but they can't put money in. In this case, please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. It would help a great deal. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools too!

Links

#1 issue of Sue
Facebook
Instagram
Twitter
YouTube
Patreon
Website
Abby's Blog
Abby's Instagram

For any question: transmediatale@gmail.com

Thanks in advance :) #proudtobeamonster

story:
UPDATED ART FROM THE COMPLETED BOOK! 

 

 

 

 

 

Tuskers is a passion project about the devastating affects poaching has on the African elephant population and the true-life superheroes who choose to protect them. 

Through this thrilling adventure story you will learn that elephants are so much more than the sum of their parts.

 

 

ELEPHANTS 

(Our main elephants are orphans that find one another after their families are poached for ivory.)

 

Detroit -- Orphaned by the brutal killing of her family, Detroit is our main narrator and protagonist. (Her name has specific meaning and will be revealed in the book.) Not easily accepted into the new herd at the orphanage, she soon befriends another broken soul,  Sgt. Elias Delgado, and together they'll learn to overcome their personal trauma.  

Esampu --  Future matriarch in training, Esampu loves being around people and other members of the herd. 

Roi -- Playful jokester with a reputation for always finding a way to steal food.  

Daphne -- Matriarch of the orphanage herd. She grew up in Zuri's camp after a brutal leg snare left her for dead.  

 

HUMANS

 

Dr. Zuri Erivo -- The caretaker of the elephant orphanage who has spent her life protecting wildlife in her homeland of South Sudan.

Sgt. Elias Delgado -- A disgraced Army Ranger who is seeking redemption after the brutal ambush of his troops in Afghanistan.

EcoGuards -- Led by locals Joseph and Rafi, they are members of a conservationist group who risk their lives by protecting and leading the elephants to safety.

Abdalla Katumba -- A vicious war-lord who wants to sell the elephant’s ivory tusks to pay for weapons and power. He leads his own private army that views the elephants as commodities to be bought and killed for profit.  

 

Below is a preview of the first ten pages of Tuskers. 

ARTWORK is traditionally hand painted with watercolor and ink.  

LETTERING is temporary and will be replaced in the final printing.  

Please be aware that the artwork depicts scenes of graphic violence to elephants -- Tuskers is a work of fiction, however the catalyst of the story is unfortunately all too real. We've spent several years researching the African poaching crisis and felt it was best to show the realistic carnage that is inflicted on elephants to harvest their ivory. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

BELOW IS A PREVIEW OF SOME STILL IN-PRODUCTION ART -

 

 

 

We have assembled a fantastic creative team to bring Tuskers to life. 

WRITER MARC GAFFEN: From The Bernie Mac Show to Grimm and now New Amsterdam, Marc has been a camera assistant, writer, associate producer, and script coordinator on numerous television shows. He was also the co-writer on the successful Grimm comic book series (based on the NBC television show).    

WRITER JAVIER BARRIOS: Besides being an amazing father to twin girls, Javier is the manager of the television and film script library at the prestigious Writer's Guild of America. He is also a screenwriter that specializes in stories with a social and environmental message. 

ARTIST DANIEL GOVAR: Daniel is a comic, children’s book, and gaming illustrator who has worked on dozens of titles for various publishers over 10 years; Marvel, DC, Valiant, Dynamite, and has self-published a number of projects here on Kickstarter such as Lovecraft and Mr. Trunk Builds a Wall. Over his career he has tackled horror, fantasy, sci-fi, true-crime/noir, and real-world dramas. Daniel is a regular at 10-15 conventions throughout the country and lives in St. Petersburg with his fiancée, son, and 2 Great Danes that keep him on his toes.

EDITOR GREG TUMBARELLO: Greg is a senior editor with over fifteen years professional experience working with numerous companies, including Legendary Entertainment where he helped cofound and structure their successful comic book division with acclaimed editor Bob Schreck. He has previously worked as an editor, writer, and producer for MTV Networks, Lion Forge Comics, Image Comics, The Comic Book Legal Defense Fund, and Tokyopop.

 

Self-publishing a graphic novel is an expensive proposition. 

Production: With around 130 pages to be illustrated and then lettered, there’s a lot of dedicated work that needs to be done.

Printing: We have quotes from different printers and while we want to make this as affordable as possible, we also want to make sure it's a quality bookshelf book.  70pt pages, a beautiful heavy-weight embossed cover so the logo resembles elephant tusks, and end pages that will hold up to water-media for personalized remarques (sketches).

 

 

 

Our current schedule is as follows --

April - August 2019 -- continue illustrating pages based on the finished script.

September - October 2019 -- send completed book to printers for publishing.

Early November 2019 -- send out digital edition to backers.

End of November - December 2019 -- send out print edition to backers.

 

We can't express just how much your support means to us. It's a true honor to have your backing. We won’t let you down. 

Thanks for your support in making Tuskers the best graphic novel it can be!
story_txt:
UPDATED ART FROM THE COMPLETED BOOK! 
 


 


 
 

 
Tuskers is a passion project about the devastating affects poaching has on the African elephant population and the true-life superheroes who choose to protect them. 
Through this thrilling adventure story you will learn that elephants are so much more than the sum of their parts.
 

 

ELEPHANTS 
(Our main elephants are orphans that find one another after their families are poached for ivory.)

 
Detroit -- Orphaned by the brutal killing of her family, Detroit is our main narrator and protagonist. (Her name has specific meaning and will be revealed in the book.) Not easily accepted into the new herd at the orphanage, she soon befriends another broken soul,  Sgt. Elias Delgado, and together they'll learn to overcome their personal trauma.  
Esampu --  Future matriarch in training, Esampu loves being around people and other members of the herd. 
Roi -- Playful jokester with a reputation for always finding a way to steal food.  
Daphne -- Matriarch of the orphanage herd. She grew up in Zuri's camp after a brutal leg snare left her for dead.  
 
HUMANS

 
Dr. Zuri Erivo -- The caretaker of the elephant orphanage who has spent her life protecting wildlife in her homeland of South Sudan.
Sgt. Elias Delgado -- A disgraced Army Ranger who is seeking redemption after the brutal ambush of his troops in Afghanistan.
EcoGuards -- Led by locals Joseph and Rafi, they are members of a conservationist group who risk their lives by protecting and leading the elephants to safety.
Abdalla Katumba -- A vicious war-lord who wants to sell the elephant’s ivory tusks to pay for weapons and power. He leads his own private army that views the elephants as commodities to be bought and killed for profit.  
 

Below is a preview of the first ten pages of Tuskers. 
ARTWORK is traditionally hand painted with watercolor and ink.  
LETTERING is temporary and will be replaced in the final printing.  
Please be aware that the artwork depicts scenes of graphic violence to elephants -- Tuskers is a work of fiction, however the catalyst of the story is unfortunately all too real. We've spent several years researching the African poaching crisis and felt it was best to show the realistic carnage that is inflicted on elephants to harvest their ivory. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 
BELOW IS A PREVIEW OF SOME STILL IN-PRODUCTION ART -
 

 

 

We have assembled a fantastic creative team to bring Tuskers to life. 
WRITER MARC GAFFEN: From The Bernie Mac Show to Grimm and now New Amsterdam, Marc has been a camera assistant, writer, associate producer, and script coordinator on numerous television shows. He was also the co-writer on the successful Grimm comic book series (based on the NBC television show).    
WRITER JAVIER BARRIOS: Besides being an amazing father to twin girls, Javier is the manager of the television and film script library at the prestigious Writer's Guild of America. He is also a screenwriter that specializes in stories with a social and environmental message. 
ARTIST DANIEL GOVAR: Daniel is a comic, children’s book, and gaming illustrator who has worked on dozens of titles for various publishers over 10 years; Marvel, DC, Valiant, Dynamite, and has self-published a number of projects here on Kickstarter such as Lovecraft and Mr. Trunk Builds a Wall. Over his career he has tackled horror, fantasy, sci-fi, true-crime/noir, and real-world dramas. Daniel is a regular at 10-15 conventions throughout the country and lives in St. Petersburg with his fiancée, son, and 2 Great Danes that keep him on his toes.
EDITOR GREG TUMBARELLO: Greg is a senior editor with over fifteen years professional experience working with numerous companies, including Legendary Entertainment where he helped cofound and structure their successful comic book division with acclaimed editor Bob Schreck. He has previously worked as an editor, writer, and producer for MTV Networks, Lion Forge Comics, Image Comics, The Comic Book Legal Defense Fund, and Tokyopop.

story:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W0yxLXhGrU0

KROS: HALLOWED GROUND

Ever since Kros: Hallowed Ground was successfully funded, those who missed the campaign have been asking us, "Can I still get a copy of the Kros: Hallowed Ground graphic novel and sketchbook?" Now, thanks to Indiegogo InDemand the answer is YES! 

Kros: Hallowed Ground is scheduled to ship in July/August 2016--and, since we ordered some extra copies, now would be a great time to snag a copy of this 148 page graphic novel and the sketchbook. 

All wars are horror stories.

Gettysburg, July 1-3, 1863. The blood soaked battlefields of the Civil War draw Vampires who descend to feed on the wounded and dying as Blood calls to Blood. One man, a Vampire Hunter named Kros, stands against them, waging a battle at night as fearful and horrific as the battles fought during the day.

The idea for Kros: Hallowed Ground  began over 10 years ago as a macabre tale set during the Battle of Gettysburg. For a long time, the project waited silently, like a vampire in the shadows... The plot was written, some pages were drawn--atmospheric, dark murky landscapes, the dimly lit surgeon's tent, a figure swirling from the smoke of battle...

Fast forward through many other projects for both of us--until finally-- 

It's time to hear the wolf's howl; to watch the undead descend like buzzards to the feast.  It's time to unleash the vampires...

KROS: HALLOWED GROUND is a horror graphic novel by John Ostrander and Tom Mandrake. Kros is a dream project and Kros' story is one we have been wanting to tell for a long time. 

We're making that dream come true and it's exciting!  When we work together, the characters begin to tell their own stories and strange, grotesque creatures emerge unbidden...  We hope you will join us for this tale of horror!






The Kros: Hallowed Ground Sketchbook contains concept art by Tom Mandrake and a bonus short story by John Ostrander.

Suttler's Token


Vampire Corps Patches


Winged Vampire Skull T-shirt


The Creators

So, who are these guys and why should you back Kros: Hallowed Ground? 


What We Need & What You Get

We've been told over and over again by folks who missed the campaign that they would love to be able to get their hands on a copy of the Kros: Hallowed Ground graphic novel and sketchbook. 

Our mission here on Indiegogo InDemand is to bring Kros: Hallowed Ground to as many comic book readers and fans of our work as we can and to continue funding this gorgeously detailed book!  So, here's your chance to grab a graphic novel, a sketchbook or a PDF of Kros: Hallowed Ground--or grab a combo of all three--PLUS extra rewards! All physical copies of the sketchbook and graphic novel will be shipped with a set of 3 postcards and 3 mini-prints by Kros artist Tom Mandrake and include a PDF. Every backer will be thanked on the Kros: Hallowed Ground website.

Please look us over--and if you enjoy a spine chilling vampire tale, take a moment to back this awesome project and help us bring Kos: Hallowed Ground to the world!

Risks and challenges

Finishing Kros with the kind of attention to detail we want to give it has taken longer than we imagined, but from our years of experience we know that telling a good story takes time. Seeing what we've accomplished so far, we  know that Kros: Hallowed Ground will be a story that we can be proud of.

With every update we've sent out, our backers have stressed that they don't want us to hurry...but that they can't wait to see the finished book! It's great to know that they want Kros to look as amazing as we do. After all, we only get to do this once! 

On the plus side, this delay has provided the opportunity for us to find homes for the extra copies of the Kros graphic novel and sketchbook!

As we start this ongoing campaign, all of the art for the sketchbook is in place, over half the art for the graphic novel is done and the printing paid for. New pages are being penciled, inked and colored daily. The rewards have been delivered to us-- the postage is bought--everything is in place as we head toward the completion of the graphic novel. 

We're incredibly excited about Kros: Hallowed Ground and hope you will join us for this visually stunning tale of horror!

Other ways you can help 

If you love what you see here, but can't back the project right now, you can still support Kros: Hallowed Ground by getting the word out to friends and through social media. We appreciate any and all support you can give to Kros--he can't take all those vampires on by himself!

And please, don't forget to use the handy Indiegogo Share Tools to share Kros: Hallowed Ground with the world!

And please, don't forget to use the handy Indiegogo Share Tools to share Kros: Hallowed Ground with the world!

story:
My name is Craig Johnson, I currently live in the North East of England. I grew up with comics and have followed them to this day. I currently work full time but my real ambition is to be an illustrator and work on my own project.

This campaign means a lot to me because I have spent a long time working on the idea and developing it to the point that it is now. It is my dream to create my own comic book series. If I can get the funding I need I will be able to achieve my goal and release my comic series.


To achieve this goal I will need £2,000. With this I will be able to hire a colourist for the first 3 issues and then ongoing. I can invest in a A3 scanner so that I can scan and send my work at home with ease. The money will also go towards getting equipment and merchandise to attend comic cons and give to those who have backed the campaign. Speaking of backers I have tried to make sure the rewards are great to really show how thankfully I am for the support. I will be make new rewards as the campaign continues to be successful. The first issue is done and just needs colouring and lettering. Scripts for the upcoming issues are underway


The story.... A young man who just wants to help his home town from being torn apart. If your not rich and influential no one is coming to help you. The police force and government are all but corrupt, the only thing they want is money and more power. When he finds he has abilities he is forced into becoming a hero. However for every success he has he also fails. These failures result in him doubting himself and whether or not being a "hero" means losing who you are or becoming something you are not.

The first issue opens with our hero a month into his journey to becoming a so called "hero". Here we find a he has been involved in a building that has exploded. He fails to save a woman trapped in the debris and is distraught with his failure. The police arrive and mistake him for being behind the explosion and deaths of innocent civilians. With his judgement now clouded and emotions running high, we follow him on a chase for his life mentally and phyically  from a corrupt police force who have no problem with killing him rather than arresting him.


Like any project there are a couple of challenges I may face. The first is being able to get a new issue out every month. This being due to being in a full time job. The way around this is when the comic starts to pick up and I can sustain myself off it. Which will enable me to reducing my hours to totally focus on hitting the once a month deadline. Another way around this is to bring in other people to share the work load, such as a writer or inker.
If i don't meet the full funding i will be scaling back how many issues are coloured straight away. This wont affect any perks.


If you want to help with my dream please sponsor and spread the word on facebook/twitter or instagram. Thank you everyone let's bring my dream to life.

www.facebook.com/ProjectSaviourComic
Twitter: @ProjectSaviour

story:
Hello Indie!

We are the monks of the monastery of the mountain of the sun and moon, living in the Asian mountains -- Alex Water, an artist and Wu, a screenwriter. For over a year of having access to the scriptures, we are creating one of the most interesting projects: a series of 12 motion comics called "I'll Burn Your Bones!" 

A motion comic, which is a relatively new format of comics is a traditional graphic story complete with sound effects, voice actors and actresses as well as animation. 


The style of animation which you can see in the video is attached above. 

The story unfolds in a series of small single city planets named BABILDON built around the gigantic tower corporation of "Cyber Milk." The "Cyber Milk" Tower is considered perfection in the human mind. It is from there life comes into the world, and to there each soul goes after its own individual journey. Every resident of the city sees the "Cyber Milk" tower as holy and is subject to its laws, other than the rebels "Blue Sun." They believe the tower is the main evil in the land and would destroy it if they had the power and strength, but there is not enough in this world for the time being. The preacher Seth, who is convinced of his divine power, is ready to destroy the established balance of power and transform it from ruins into a paradise. Who will win this confrontation between good and evil? It is known to only one course, and the story rides the line of suspense to the very end. 


How does it work? Download the app to your tablet or smartphone and you can see the graphic novel. For each frame, you can click "revive" and see what is happening in its event by clicking on "the play" button. 

The motion comic, "I'll Burn Your Bones!" is the story of a future world written and inspired by the mythology of the ancient Babylon Kingdom. Almost all of the characters are based on real people we have met in Thailand. 


For example, we met Jack in a bar on the island of Koh Chang. 

 

You can be a character in the motion comic series too! Please look to the right hand side of the screen to see how to participate. 

Girls is a secret friends... ;)


We will also like another artist who will take over half of the work, so they will be doing 40 draw frames. (FR) 

FR 40 * $300 = $12,000

If we raise $12,000 we will be able to produce a static comic, but our goal is to create an animated comic, so with animation the cost will be:


FR 80 * $200 = $16000

Listening to the birds singing during sunrise and sunset, we realized real life is filled with high quality sound which we will like to bring into our comics as well. Upon listening to several sound engineers' work, we stopped on a man whose taste we like most of all. 

From the title frame, to the final credits we need $ 3,000 for the favored sound engineer's work.

$3,000 for a a computer programmer who can package the motion comic series in a mobile application that can be enjoyed on a smartphone or tablet.



Now you may be thinking: "So you want me to contribute to the "I'll Burn Your Bones!" series so the goal of $34,000 can be reached. But what will I get for it?" This is an intelligent question. We encourage you to refer to the right side of the screen where you can choose the most appropriate package that meets your desires. 


For us alone, $34,000 is a lot of money: However, if everyone who sees this answers our call for help, together we can help create a dynamic motion comic series that was once only an idea!


             Peace on you! The Sun-Moon cyber monks.

story:
We Are Back!

Hey guys, this is Scott Lindsey of Mind Wack Productions. Chris Wacker and I are going to be presenting at several of the 2015 Comic Conventions! We are seeking funding to print our next 100 comics, as well as a small batch of posters, small prints, and other sweet Tekka and Chris Wacker swag! We have two big shows coming up in August: Kansas City ComiCon (Aug 7,8, 9) AND Gateway Geek Fest in St Louis,  Missouri (Aug 28, 29, 30). We also going to be at Air Capital ComiCon in Wichita, Ks (November 14, 15), so we need to restock and renew our inventory!

What We've Got:

We have the beautifully drawn, amazingly written, 20 page epic: Tekka Chapter 2, 'ONE HELL OF A STORY' ready for the printers:


 and Chris has a few new art prints that will be available at the shows! 


This time around, we decided to roll all of our upcoming shows into one big campaign. Do to the success of our last few fundraisers, we are excited to announce that with only $700, we can cover all of our printing costs, and still be able to give out some amazing perks!

We will be attending some great cons this year, our first being Kansas City ComiCon at Bartle Hall in Kansas City, Missouri this August 7-9, followed by Gateway Geekfest in St Louis, MO August 29-30. The next large con will be Air Capital in Wichita, KS this October, but we will also have a few smaller one day conventions to announce as the campaign rumbles along!

Why We Need Funds:

So, for what do we need all this Dough. you ask? 

Well, let us break it down for you:

$250 will go to the Chapter 2 book prints

$150 will cover posters, 8x10 prints, postcard prints, and a few small giveaway items(bookmarks, buttons, etc.)

$200 will go to cover the remaining table fees for all of our shows,

and finally, $100 will be used for our new display banners, including the "Presented by:" banner naming all of our amazing and loyal contributors!

Spread the Word!

We have had a blast bringing Tekka to our fans, and an even bigger blast seeing how much our fans love our story! We know not everyone can show their love through contributions; we've all been there! The good news is: You can help us out just as much by referring Tekka and our campaign to your friends and colleagues! It just takes a couple of click to spread the Tekka joy, so please consider helping us spread our passion for Tekka to the world!

Thank You! 

If you made it this far through our little pitch, we would like to say "Thanks!"

Your contribution/audienceship means a lot to us at Mind Wack Productions, and we wanted to share the love, so ALL perks for this campaign will be shipped to our contributors ON US! Yes, shipping is INCLUDED in each Perk Tier!

Please drop us a comment or question if you have the inkling! We ALWAYS look forward to hearing from our audience, and welcome all praises, critiques, criticisms, and shout outs!

Finally, check back here for updates! We will be unveiling sneak peaks of the remastered Chapter 2 pages, some of Chris' newest artwork, and much more!

Thank you for your time and support!

Scott Lindsey and Chris Wacker

Mind Wack Productions
story_txt:
We Are Back!Hey guys, this is Scott Lindsey of Mind Wack Productions. Chris Wacker and I are going to be presenting at several of the 2015 Comic Conventions! We are seeking funding to print our next 100 comics, as well as a small batch of posters, small prints, and other sweet Tekka and Chris Wacker swag! We have two big shows coming up in August: Kansas City ComiCon (Aug 7,8, 9) AND Gateway Geek Fest in St Louis,  Missouri (Aug 28, 29, 30). We also going to be at Air Capital ComiCon in Wichita, Ks (November 14, 15), so we need to restock and renew our inventory!What We've Got:We have the beautifully drawn, amazingly written, 20 page epic: Tekka Chapter 2, 'ONE HELL OF A STORY' ready for the printers: and Chris has a few new art prints that will be available at the shows! This time around, we decided to roll all of our upcoming shows into one big campaign. Do to the success of our last few fundraisers, we are excited to announce that with only $700, we can cover all of our printing costs, and still be able to give out some amazing perks!We will be attending some great cons this year, our first being Kansas City ComiCon at Bartle Hall in Kansas City, Missouri this August 7-9, followed by Gateway Geekfest in St Louis, MO August 29-30. The next large con will be Air Capital in Wichita, KS this October, but we will also have a few smaller one day conventions to announce as the campaign rumbles along!Why We Need Funds:So, for what do we need all this Dough. you ask? Well, let us break it down for you:$250 will go to the Chapter 2 book prints$150 will cover posters, 8x10 prints, postcard prints, and a few small giveaway items(bookmarks, buttons, etc.)$200 will go to cover the remaining table fees for all of our shows,and finally, $100 will be used for our new display banners, including the "Presented by:" banner naming all of our amazing and loyal contributors!Spread the Word!We have had a blast bringing Tekka to our fans, and an even bigger blast seeing how much our fans love our story! We know not everyone can show their love through contributions; we've all been there! The good news is: You can help us out just as much by referring Tekka and our campaign to your friends and colleagues! It just takes a couple of click to spread the Tekka joy, so please consider helping us spread our passion for Tekka to the world!
Thank You! If you made it this far through our little pitch, we would like to say "Thanks!"Your contribution/audienceship means a lot to us at Mind Wack Productions, and we wanted to share the love, so ALL perks for this campaign will be shipped to our contributors ON US! Yes, shipping is INCLUDED in each Perk Tier!Please drop us a comment or question if you have the inkling! story:
Who is this Asra you speak of?

Asra is a 15-year old girl destined to save womankind from the evil clutches of a fortune teller. So dramatic!

Before she had the weight of the world thrust upon her, Asra was a feisty footballer who could beat any boy on the pitch. But when Umm Al-Lail arrived in her Khaleeji village and started turning women to stone to gain immortality, Asra chose to fight back. 

Asra and the Orphan Moon is a graphic novel epic, spanning 100 years, and featuring jinn, black magic, and incredible female Khaleeji characters inspired by history.

This 500-page story will be published in two volumes.

What makes Asra so special?

There aren't enough women in comics and heroic tales, but that is slowly changing. The last ten years has seen a wave of aspirational female characters from Hermione Granger to Katniss Everdeen to the Black Widow.

Unfortunately, the most popular heroines are still Western, especially in comics. Asra and her team will be among the first female comic book characters hailing from the Arabian Gulf, and we want to bring them to as wide an audience as possible.

We are certain that a fearless and vibrant character like Asra will become an inspiration for girls and young women who crave more identifiable icons. Moreover, our team believes that the characters in Asra & the Orphan Moon have the capacity to affect people’s perspective on Arab women.

That’s pretty cool, but why are you asking for my money?

We want to ensure that our illustrator, Hatem, can focus on the project full-time. If he's required to take on other work, and that means Asra may not be finished for several years. This is a 500-page graphic novel we're talking about, after all!

Fine, you've convinced me. If I give you the money, how will you spend it?

Every donation to our campaign will go directly to fund Hatem so he can spend significantly more time drawing Asra. 

Without additional funds, Asra Volume 1 may not be finished until 2019. Can you bear to wait the long? We can't!

A successful crowdfunding campaign will help Hatem finish Volume 1 by 2017 and Volume 2 by 2018! That's a huge difference, and it means you get to meet Asra sooner!

If we exceed our goal, Hatem is going to devote even more time to the project and Asra will be on shelves before you can say Yalla!

Have I mentioned I love perks?

We are so excited to bring you perks that we think are pretty darn cool. However, we are also keeping our perks really manageable so we don't over-promise and under-deliver. We hate that. Our goal is to get every single perk to you by the time Volume 1 is published.

story:
Sleeping Lions

SEE THE PREVIEW HERE :  SLEEPING LIONS Issue One Preview

Empire City has had a long history of heroes and villains taking part in a war that was fought for many years. However in recent times the city has slept a bit easier at night. The city hasn't had a need for a hero, and the villains have either been locked up, or faded away with time. This calm does not last long though...A new threat has risen in the city. The mob have been slowly working their way through the cracks left in the old city and have made their foothold. Pimps, dealers, and crooked cops give the people of Empire city a reason to fear the streets when the sun goes down. With no heroes left to stop them, they have flourished, but one man will take matters in to his own hands and will give the city hope again.

Ari, a young and cocky bouncer will put on a mask and take the title of "The Sentry" to try and take his city back from the evils that have found their way back home. It's time for this Sleeping Lion to wake up.


Want to take a look at a preview of the comic?

Be sure to check our website to take a look at a preview of the comic! Tweet at us and follow us, and don't forget to use the hashtags #SleepingLions & #ThisLionRoars! Let us know what your think about what we've done so far! We cannot thank you all enough!


The Story of the Wolf and the Lion

In 2015 Pedro Andres Escalante and Deco Wilson had an idea for a comic. Andres at the time was slowly spiraling in to a deep depression and fought hard to keep his own mind at bay by writing a story about a hero. He told Deco about his idea, and they both decided to make this idea for a comic in to a reality. The pair worked hard, writing scripts, working on rough draft after rough draft with what little resources they had...Then, Andres fell hard to his depression...

July of 2015, writing had stopped and the dream began fading away. Deco kept drawing and tried to get Andres to keep writing, and slowly but surely the words found their way to paper. Andres made the choice for himself to get back up. Time went by, and with the love and support of friends and family, he was able to find the light again and the Lion within him roared.

Deco had been working on the comic and drawing rough drafts and mock-ups to have for Andres when he was ready to start the project again. Now numbers have been crunched, and they are ready to give this dream a shot. 

Sleeping Lions has been a dream of the boys for the past year and now, they have the passion and desire needed to make this a reality. Now all they need is your support!!!


What we're hoping to get out of this campaign

We want to tell a story that people can fall in love with and characters that people can relate to. Andres has created rough drafts for sequels, prequels, and even stand alone books for individual characters in the Sleeping Lions universe. This campaign is for the equipment for Deco to be able to make even better illustrations and make the comic as beautiful as it can be, and with each order of the first comic we get to print more and more for all our supporters. The first book in this series will be fully funded by you, the backers and we hope in the future to create more campaigns for each book in the series. The next campaigns will have even lower goals, and will make this comic an even bigger reality! Without you, this comic will be significantly more difficult to make a reality. So we hope we can show you just how passionate we are about this project!


"How else can I help?"

If you can't back the project that's ok! We know, our goal is a lofty one, but we appreciate any help you can provide. Tweet about us! Tell your friends, your family! Talk about us on your podcast, or have Andres on it to talk about Sleeping Lions! Spread the word in whatever way you can! We want this to be a reality and we can only do it with your help, so please, back our comic or at least tell the world about it!

Thank you

story:
Update - March 29th, 2016

Hey guys! Thanks so, so very much for your first week of donations - just great!
I've gotten some feedback and I've added a $15 and up perk of some mini-comics featuring stuff that I think is fun and cool but can't quite get to work in the main story. Any donation that I've already received that's over $15 will get 'em, too!
There's still several weeks left to go, so let's get the word out and donate and share!

Short Summary

I was sexually assaulted by my closest friend when I was 19 years old. After a botched suicide attempt, I wound up in a mental hospital. Two weeks later, I was back out into the world, finding that all my previous assumptions about my family, my friends, and my faith, were in question.

Along the way, I learned to become who I am. Part of that involved being in the desert, while on acid, believing I was on Mars.

I WANT TO BE WELL is a humorous, cartoonish, and honest look into how I managed to scrape by even during the most dire circumstances, and find hope and friendship along the way.

What I Need & What You Get

Your support will help ensure that this project will be completed. The finished book will likely run about 200 pages, which is a *ton* of work, but the funding from all of you through Indiegogo will make sure that I have the necessary support, tools, and resources to see it through.

Additionally, if you pledge $40, I'll ship you a printed copy of the book! For $50, you'll get a SIGNED copy! And for $100 or more, you'll get the book, signed, WITH a cover illustration featuring your celebrity of choice kissing your Final Fantasy character of choice! Or whatever else you want, I guess.

That is, of course, on top of everyone who pledges $5 or more, who'll receive a PDF download of the book upon completion!

The Impact

My experience is not one that's often talked about all that much in polite society, really - men who've been victims of sexual assault are often stigmatized, even now. But I've met and spoken to enough men my age and older who've been through a similar experience, and the shocking thing is that it's actually not terribly uncommon.

Too many men and women are assaulted and left to fend for themselves, in a world that is cruel and indifferent to their struggles. I had those myself, and somehow, I found the will to live. And draw cartoons.

My hope is that this book will enlighten and entertain everyone, and bring even just the tiniest bit of understanding to this very intense and complicated issue.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk and challenge here is the content itself - how on Earth do I tell such a wrenching and personal story, without making it too dire and dour to be enjoyable?

That's why I went with a graphic novel; this story is always one that I've been eager to tell, but for the reasons I listed above, I've put it off. Once I hit on making it in cartoon form, though, I realized that it just might work.

I've always loved to draw, even though I'll be the first to admit I'm not the best at it. Still, I love drawing cartoons, and I love writing powerful, funny stories, and this one wraps up both.

Other Ways You Can Help

No cash? No problem! See, there's all these Social Media platforms out there, like Twitter and Facebook and Tumblr and the like, where you can share this project with others, who may indeed be interested and wish to contribute!

So get out there with your Internet Bullhorn and help me make I WANT TO BE WELL!

Who is Brian Hanson?

I've been writing about cartoons for close to a decade, including old-timey things like ANIME JUMP!, PROTOCULTURE ADDICTS, ANIME INSIDER, ANIME NEWS NETWORK, and I've done some game and nerd-culture writing too, writing for TOPLESS ROBOT and RETROWARE.TV.
I've been drawing cartoons since before I've been cognizant, and you can see some of my doodles at http://thingofthings.tumblr.com.
By supporting this campaign, Brian promises to love you forever.
