story:
What is Star Burned about?

   Star Burned is the story of a far off universe where 13 people have each been given a mark called a Star Burn. These marks grant extraordinary power and if one was to gain all 13 marks, one would become god. In this middle of all this you have Zandra, a hunter and a Star Burned who thinks she can outrun even God, is given the job to hunt down another Star Burned, Aidan. Due to a cruel twist of fate Zandra is forced to take care Aidan against all odds from the forces that seek his life, ranging from common criminals to other Star Burned.

     The biggest looming threat to them is a group called The Court of Nynes, a cult that controls all of the magic in the universe. The Court has waited along time for someone in their order to become Star Burned and now finally a son of one of their high leaders has been chosen, Ren, a egotistical psychopath has been granted a Star Burn. His mark is the Mark of Life granting him godlike immortality,but the Court desires him to have all 13 marks so they may have their own god to reshape the galaxy into a place of their own design, purged off all non humans.

Who is Off Shoot Comics?

Off Shoot Comics started in 2011 by David Clarke and Walter Bryant with the goal of creating amazing stories that reflect the world they live in by giving more representation to women and people of color. Our team reflects the diverse worlds we aim to create as well! We've put out over 10 books on our own in the last few years using small teams but this project is different. This project will require all hands on deck from Off Shoot Comics which will lead to one super product!

Some of our previous projects include:

Click on the links to see more about the series!

Heroes R Us Vol 1 -3

Heroes R Us: The Weekend Wonders - The Silver Shadow Part 1

Sanctioned Chapter 1 & 2

Heretic Issue 1 & 2

S.E.C.R.E.T Service Novel

Why is Star Burned Important?

This project is important for two reasons. 1. It's a dope sci-fi story about people trying to become gods and 2. We pitched the idea to a studio and had it turned down because it was  "too big" and we want to show the world that it can be done, even without a huge studio behind us.

What We Need & What You Get

So we all know that to take on a big project like this requires big resources as well. We're asking for $25,000 to help us produce this graphic novel. Your donations will be going to fund the work of our artists and our writer. But outside of them is also the production staff as well. We have a great editor on board and a amazing marketing team helping us get the word out! We also will be using the funding to print and mass distribute the graphic novel when the book comes out next year. But of course a portion of what we are raising here is for the cool Star Burned swag we'll be rewarding all of you with!

We have plenty of awesome things for you to get in this campaign such as metal art pieces, T-Shirts, copies of the book and even a chance to create a character in this universe! Now in the worst case scenario that we don't meet the goal the money is still going into the project. First people who donate will get their rewards no matter what, our first priority is making good on our promise to you the donor. Second, the money will go directly to the artists to start production on the graphic novel. Then after that we dust ourselves off, get back on the space horse and go to raise the remaining amount needed to fund the rest of the project.

The Impact

By helping us in this campaign you are helping a group of young creators achieve their dream on their terms and showing the world that you don't need a big studio to put out a big series. We have put out hundreds of pages of comic book content and we are ready to put out 300 more. Off Shoot Comics prides itself on making sure we constantly bring new and innovative stories to the world and till now we've always done small installments but we are ready for the big time, we have an idea that is too good to die and we believe in it enough to step out on faith and do it on our own. We are asking you to believe in Star Burned and in us as well!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to donate to the campaign but there are other ways to help!

  • You can help by simply spreading this link out to everyone you think would be interested in Star Burned.
  • You can share on Facebook, Twitter or any social media you like!
  • Any advice is always welcome as well!

We have put out hundreds of pages of comic book content and we are ready to put out 300 more. Off Shoot Comics prides itself on making sure we constantly bring new and innovative stories to the world and till now we've always done small installments but we are ready for the big time, we have an idea that is too good to die and we believe in it enough to step out on faith and do it on our own. We are asking you to believe in Star Burned and in us as well!

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone is able to donate to the campaign but there are other ways to help!

You can help by simply spreading this link out to everyone you think would be interested in Star Burned.
You can share on Facebook, Twitter or any social media you like!
Any advice is always welcome as well!

story:
What's the deal with MeSseD Comics?

 

“What’s as deep as a skyscraper is high? Everything under the city.  There’s tunnels a thousand feet under us.”
-Warren Ellis, writer

MeSseD, a comic book series written by Jay B. Kalagayan and illustrated by Dylan Speeg, descends into the city's sewers. We're following a sewer worker named Lilliput as she braves all manner of creatures and clogs in the depths of the tunnels. From a human sized cockroach to monstrous alligator-crocodile mash-ups, we get a glimpse into a world unknown to us, yet created by our waste.

 

“It’s because of my daughters, Meghan and Serafina. When you become a father, you get the opportunity – the honor – of introducing them to things, to stories, to movies, to books, to comics, of course. So with Lilliput, I wanted a strong character who happened to be a woman, who happened to be Asian and who happened to be Filipino.”
-Jay B. Kalagayan, creator

MeSseD Season 1: Follow the Flush was successfully launched November 2016 to fan and media acclaim.  Jay and Dylan were interviewed by the Cincinnati Enquirer, WVXU and Cincinnati Citybeat.  The comic can be found in comic book stores in Ohio, Kentucky and Virginia.  We made public appearances at SPACE (Small Press Alternative Comics Expo) in Columbus and the Cincinnati Pop Art Con and will attend the Cincinnati Comics Expo, Book by the Banks and MECCA (Midwest Ethnic Comic  Con) in Detroit.  

Jay always intended MeSseD to be an ongoing story, so he and Dylan began work on Season 2 in January 2017.

As of this post, Jay has the entire season drafted, Dylan has four of five chapters done and guest artist Clint Bassinger has one of two chapters finished. Season 2 art is 71% complete!

Seemless Printing is waiting for files. Our fans eagerly await new chapters. Comic book stores have a space reserved for display.

The last piece missing for the successful launch of Season 2 is you!

We need your help to bridge production expenses for Season 2. Your investment will support the publishing of this sci-fi adventure steeped in the waste of our civilization.

 

What's MeSseD: Season 2 going to feature?

MeSseD: Season 2 expands on the introductions of Season 1.

We learn how Lilliput is able to "see" in the dark, dank depths in Echoes.

We will have our first three-part story in which Lilliput learns more about the mutated, sentient Filaments in Mother, Hunt, and Flowers.

 

We'll also get back to the surface, for the first time since Season 1, Chapter 1: Choke, to check out Queenswell, MSD's main treatment plant. Guess which iconic building MSD's headquarters is based off of?

Finally, we're expanding the MeSseD universe. Akka, Lilliput's partner and pet rat, gets her own mission in The Messenger. We have guest artist Clint Bassinger showing us Akka’s adventure getting caught between poisonous centipedes and massive tubifex worms!

 

Meet the Team!

Jay B. Kalagayan - Writer

A diverse writer, Jay has written everything from plays to grants to cartoon strips. He is also founder of Know Theatre of Cincinnati. "One of my dreams came true with the creation of MeSseD. I've had this subterranean idea in my mind for over two years. Seeing it in print last year was an unbelievable thrill!"

 

Dylan Speeg - Artist

Dylan attended The Art Academy of Cincinnati in the early ‘90s and has worked as a portrait painter and illustrator ever since. He is also a musician in the band Heavy Hinges. His major influences are lurid pulp novel covers, Robert Williams, R. Crumb and other comic book artists. Dylan's favorite thing about working on MeSseD is "Creating a world out of scratch. Making imagination come to life. It's what thinking looks like for me."

 

Geoff Raker - Designer

Geoff has been a designer for almost 20 years. Got his start with Jay at Know Theatre of Cincinnati creating the brand and designing posters, sets and helping out with anything that need to be done.  He designed at Cincinnati Citybeat and F+W Media INC.

 

Clint Bassinger - Guest Artist, "The Messenger"

Dylan and Jay are joined by Clint Bassinger who is the artist of The Messenger story starring our favorite sewer rat, Akka.

Last season, Clint worked on the MeSseD short story, Fauna. "It was great fun to work with Jay on MeSseD. I think he tailored the story towards things that I love to draw," says Clint, "Including a gritty battle royale between a rat and a monstrous centipede-creature!"

MeSseD S2 will also feature art from well known and up-and-coming Queen City artists including Christina Wald, William R. Grapes, Holly Brashear, Caleb Schowalter, and Tanakan Bangnoi.

 

What we are doing next, and how you can help?

 

MeSseD is produced by Jay's production company, Creative Mussel. We are a very small, independent production company, so we need you to help bridge expenses for the production of Season 2.  Your investment will support the next phase of MeSseD comics.

Your pledge will support our growth by:

  • Helping us continue to pay all of our artists for their incredible work, building our reputation in the illustrating community
  • Ensuring we have a large enough print run to stock our friendly neighborhood comic book stores and expand our distribution
  • Allowing us to attend more comic cons and make more public appearances in the Tri-state area and beyond

Your investment will keep us flush! Bad pun, but with your help, the wild and weird stories of Lilliput will be able to continue. Your contribution will help us print Season 2, support our existing fans, build our fan base, and increase our reach, ensuring more MeSseD stories to come.

 

MeSseD Impact

 

"Lilliput... is tough and enterprising. She is fearless and unflappable. Lilliput is a hero for all of us.  It’s not about gender. Or ethnicity. She is the type of person we all might aspire to be."

-David Lyman, Cincinnati Enquirer

For Season 2, we want to take MeSseD to the next level: more story, more art, and to continue building an awesome fan base.

MeSseD and the character of Lilliput were inspired by Jay’s daughters. He recognizes our need for more diversity of race and gender in our entertainment. Lilliput is a strong character who happens to be Filipino, who happens to be female. How many characters like Lilliput have you seen in comics? In any media?

Lilliput is a strong, smart woman doing a pretty unglamorous job, constantly up against this entire wild universe that is always there but we don’t even think about.

 

What happens when we flush?

The environmental/ecological themes in MeSseD have been popular with the women and men working for our unappreciated public utilities.

As Dylan says, "The keystones of civilization are plumbing and the written word." While researching the story, Jay had an opportunity to connect with several public utilities such as MSD of Greater Cincinnati, SD1 of Northern Kentucky and Hampton Roads Sanitation District. The workers there know it’s undervalued but they are proud of their work for this essential service. They appreciate our fun and uncanny stories based on what they do. They're glad to have a story about them that isn't attached to storm flooding, tax increases, or fatbergs.

 

So what's the money for?

MeSseD Season 2 cost breakdown:

  • Artist Fees $7,475
  • Printing Costs $3,731
  • Rewards expenses $1,000
  • IndieGoGo and other Fees $1,121

Total Estimate $13,326

These are the bare minimum expenses we need covered for the successful production of Season 2.

Our goal for this IndieGoGo campaign is $11,000.

If we hit our goal, our stretch goal expenses include the following:

  • Marketing
  • Convention fees
  • Travel expenses
  • Writer stipend
  • Editor stipend
  • Wider distribution

Please get involved! We would love to share the passion we have for MeSseD and the upcoming Season 2. If you participate in our S2 campaign, we have some really equis perks at all levels.

All benefits were created to give you a piece of the MeSseD world. We could not keep creating without your help!

 

Strapped for cash? You can still help!

The best thing you can do for us (besides making a pledge) is to share this campaign with your friends and family. Every dollar and every share helps! 

You can also support us by:

  • Liking our page on Facebook, and sharing it with some friends who might be interested
  • Following us on Twitter, and retweeting the posts you like
  • Visiting and sharing our website, where you can learn more about the comic so far

 

Independent publishing relies on the support of fans like you. Give to MeSseD!

story:
Alfonso and Melchizedek Todd, brothers ( creative writers, artists, developers, entrepreneurs), have been developing imaginative  ideas, projects, and concepts since their youth, when they used to create their own comic series. As adults, "Mel" has founded WEAPON PRESS INTERNATIONAL / weaponpress.com, a comic book company established over 10 years ago and "Al" has pursued endeavors that have included event coordination, promotions, marketing, and brand development. 

They reunited in order to develop  a new project in 2016 and their goal is to create a character that would appeal to the public and assist in cultivating a movement that would inspire others to initiate and launch similar enterprises internationally.  

 Alfonso developed a "steampunk anti-hero" named General T. Osnofla after investigating  the many lifestyles /genres involved in steampunk, anime, fantasy, etc. Melchezidek agreed to partner and infuse his artistic qualities into the "mix".  Their strategy is to create a quarterly graphic novel series, artistic prints, (as well as other merchandise), and obtain bookings to promote "The General" and cultivate a following in the United States and beyond. 

Entrepreneurship is the mindset they are attempting to encourage and they want to show others that it is possible to monetize their talents and be apart of an industry  they already enjoy. 


After careful analysis and research, they deduced $5000.00 is the amount needed to launch a successful stratagem which would begin with the initiative of a quarterly publication / graphic novel that would cultivate readership, followers, and gain additional credibility. An online downloadable version will be available to the public, as well; and, although, Mel and Al are consumate professionals they realized, unfortunately, there are costs that cannot be avoided. Thus, the origination of The GENERAL LIVES! Campaign. The amount requested will cover the fees for production, publication, and distribution. 


Contrary to popular belief, they are not expecting "something for nothing". PERKS were developed for individuals who choose to SPONSOR this endeavor and they include items ranging from General T. Osnofla Wristbands to actually appearing in the graphic novel or even enjoying a meal and conversation with these two unorthodox siblings. These incentives were created due to the fact they believe any person willing to become involved with this endeavor deserves their full attention and gratitude.  

The brothers are no strangers to the implementation / execution of projects that have ranged from being commissioned by metropolitan areas to create public art to requests from municipalities to develop / execute city-wide events. They have decades of experience and are confident this undertaking can be successful and obtain its' ultimate goal which is to inspire individuals to use their abilities to improve their lot in life. Alfonso has conversed with multiple men and women who are involved in the steampunk, anime, fantasy, etc lifestyle / genres and discovered a great amount have the aptitude  for success but lack the blueprint to believe and achieve; these are writers, make-up artists, costume designers, hairstylists, etc. Alfonso  believes that   Mel and he can show others that they CAN use their abilities and strive for successful business ownership


In the end, Alfonso and Mel are aware of the risk and possibility of not raising the full amount of the funds requested. If this occurs, they will take any resources obtained, put it toward the project, and continue to move forward. The ultimate goal is to develop a self sustaining enterprise through this initial crowd funding venture. The graphic novel is only the first piece to a larger puzzle. General T. Osnofla has already obtained appearance bookings at conventions thoughout the East Coast beginning in February 2016. He, also, is "the face" of a heavily anticipated "con" or convention in Pennsylvania which will be produced on July 2016 / www.lvitzacon.com.  If The General has the ability to cultivate opportunities  with his current limited resources, imagine what could be done if he obtained additional tools to further his stance.  The graphic novel would be an instrument used to add to his credibility and relevancy.


 Mel and Al are aware  everyone does not have the ability to give $1000.00 but that does not make them any less valuable than the person who can. They realize there is power in the "word of mouth" platform and would appreciate if everyone used it to push General T. Osnofla; especially if they have the willingness to donate but are unable. Utilize this  opportunity  to STILL give by "spreading the word" among friends, family, co-workers, etc.


Remember, let everyone know to go to Indiegogo.com to donate to The GENERAL LIVES Campaign!



 .

story:
What is CARtoons Magazine?

 CARtoons Magazine came out in the late 50's and was published/distributed by-monthly up until the early 90's. The magazine was based on comic strip stories and illustrations from various top name artists reflecting humour within the automotive industry. Basically your comic book for automotive enthusiasts worldwide.


Why Bring CARtoons Magazine back to print?

 When the magazine stopped printing in the early 90's, many subscribers were confused and upset because there was nothing else like it on the magazine stands. Many had full subscriptions patiently waiting to get there hands on the next issue. No answers were ever giving as to why the magazine stopped printing. Over 24 years later, a large number of fans of the magazine today, still talk about the magazine and the stories that were told within. All over social media you will read how CARtoons magazine helped inspired many to get into illustration and comic strips which resulted in careers. They talk about all the stories they enjoyed reading and about the artists that brought these stories and illustrations to life. Also that every fan of the magazine would love to see CARtoons come back to print so they can enjoy what they once loved to read and share with the younger generation. Today there is still nothing like this magazine available.



Who Owns and Wants to Bring CARtoons Magazine Back to Print?

My name is Marc Methot, a 38 year old male living in Canada who also was inspired by the magazine as an artist and was also a subscriber. I remember as a child, I would patiently wait by-monthly for that new issue to hit the magazine stand. I am your typical blue collar worker who was successful on filing for the CARtoons Magazine trademark and because the funds are not easily available, I seek your help. Be apart of bringing this classic magazine back to print for everyone of all ages to enjoy once again. 


What is the Funding For?

 Because I am an indivdual blue collar citizen that is starting this Magazine from scratch, Funding is needed as follows:

-High End Computer and Adobe Programs needed to edit and publish the magazine layout. 

-100,000 copies bagged of the first issue that will be printed by Ovid Bell Press. 

-100,000 custom Iron-ons that will be inserted into each issue. 

-Costs to create the issue in digital format. 

-Payments to all artists including 5 original artists from CARtoons for there artwork per page. 

-Distribution costs so CARtoons will be available to purchase at most major retail stores such as Walmart, Chapters etc across the USA and Canada and eventually worldwide. 

-Website designed for the readers to easily subscribe and check out updates along with sneek peeks. 

After crunching all numbers with all costs shown above, finances work out to $150,000 USD for start up costs all the way to the Newstands, ready to be purchased. 

 My goal is to bring CARtoons Magazine back to magazine stands across the USA & Canada, along with creating Digital Issue downloads every second month. I need help with funding for publishers that will print a good quality Magazine Comic and to print a higher quantity so everyone across the world can enjoy this magazine once again. I need help with funding for a distributor that has the right distribution so readers can easily pick up an issue monthly anywhere. Expensive Adobe software programs are needed to create the magazine professionally so all subscribers will get a top quality magazine. To have a great product, I need to fund for top artists and cartoonists from the original CARtoons magazine and new highly talented artists of today, so my readers will enjoy and look forward to each issue. Last is the advertising to let all the Magazine fans know that their favourite Mag is coming back. 


 The support has already shown extremely positive responses on the return of CARtoons. 90% are ready to subscribe and are excited to enjoy the magazine as they once did in the past, but the financing isn't there. Any help would be highly appreciated. Be a part of bringing this family friendly car related comic book CARtoons Magazine back to life. Thank you.


Social Media's Response:

From CARtoons Magazine Facebook Fan Page:
"SHUT UP AND TAKE MY MONEY!!!"
"Bring it back please."
"It'd be great to see it return.Myself and at least four friends would subscribe."
"Yes. Please and thank you!"
"YES!! One of the best Things of going to the store as a kid is picking one up!"
"I would sell my own mother down the river for a chance to be able to buy CARtoons again, and I loves may momma."
"God yes!!! Me and some buddies had all of them in the day. I'd love to get my 7 year old, gear head son started on them."
"Where do I send my Subscription? Sign me up as a life member!"
"I'll take a lifetime Subscription!!!"
'Sign me up now! I grew up with the magazine and somewhere in my horde of stuff I still have a few!"
"Bring it, we want it..."
and hundreds of other replies have shown the demand on bringing this magazine back to print. To view more responses on the Facebook fan page click on link below:
https://m.facebook.com/profile.php?id=166599510...

A Bonus for my contributors:

As an appreciation to those that help contribute and help bring this magazine to the mag stand, the first 100 contributors that raise the most money will get a limited signed copy from all the artists involved in the first issue. The rest will get recognition in a future issue. Check out this campaign perks for more rewards. Thanks for any support.

Why Bring CARtoons Magazine back to print? When the magazine stopped printing in the early 90's, many subscribers were confused and upset because there was nothing else like it on the magazine stands. Many had full subscriptions patiently waiting to get there hands on the next issue. No answers were ever giving as to why the magazine stopped printing. Over 24 years later, a large number of fans of the magazine today, still talk about the magazine and the stories that were told within. All over social media you will read how CARtoons magazine helped inspired many to get into illustration and comic strips which resulted in careers. They talk about all the stories they enjoyed reading and about the artists that brought these stories and illustrations to life. Also that every fan of the magazine would love to see CARtoons come back to print so they can enjoy what they once loved to read and share with the younger generation. Today there is still nothing like this magazine available.Who Owns and Wants to Bring CARtoons Magazine Back to Print?My name is Marc Methot, a 38 year old male living in Canada who also was inspired by the magazine as an artist and was also a subscriber. I remember as a child, I would patiently wait by-monthly for that new issue to hit the magazine stand. I am your typical blue collar worker who was successful on filing for the CARtoons Magazine trademark and because the funds are not easily available, I seek your help. Be apart of bringing this classic magazine back to print for everyone of all ages to enjoy once again. What is the Funding For? Because I am an indivdual blue collar citizen that is starting this Magazine from scratch, Funding is needed as follows:-High End Computer and Adobe Programs needed to edit and publish the magazine layout. -100,000 copies bagged of the first issue that will be printed by Ovid Bell Press. -100,000 custom Iron-ons that will be inserted into each issue. -Costs to create the issue in digital format. -Payments to all artists including 5 original artists from CARtoons for there artwork per page. -Distribution costs so CARtoons will be available to purchase at most major retail stores such as Walmart, Chapters etc across the USA and Canada and eventually worldwide. -Website designed for the readers to easily subscribe and check out updates along with sneek peeks. After crunching all numbers with all costs shown above, finances work out to $150,000 USD for start up costs all the way to the Newstands, ready to be purchased.  My goal is to bring CARtoons Magazine back to magazine stands across the USA & Canada, along with creating Digital Issue downloads every second month. I need help with funding for publishers that will print a good quality Magazine Comic and to print a higher quantity so everyone across the world can enjoy this magazine once again. I need help with funding for a distributor that has the right distribution so readers can easily pick up an issue monthly anywhere. Expensive Adobe software programs are needed to create the magazine professionally so all subscribers will get a top quality magazine. To have a great product, I need to fund for top artists and cartoonists from the original CARtoons magazine and new highly talented artists of today, so my readers will enjoy and look forward to each issue. Last is the advertising to let all the Magazine fans know that their favourite Mag is coming back.  The support has already shown extremely positive responses on the return of CARtoons. 90% are ready to subscribe and are excited to enjoy the magazine as they once did in the past, but the financing isn't there. Any help would be highly appreciated. Be a part of bringing this family friendly car related comic book CARtoons Magazine back to life. Thank you.Social Media's Response:From CARtoons Magazine Facebook Fan Page:"SHUT UP AND TAKE MY MONEY!!!""Bring it back please.""It'd be great to see it return.Myself and at least four friends would subscribe.""Yes. Please and thank you!""YES!! One of the best Things of going to the store as a kid is picking one up!""I would sell my own mother down the river for a chance to be able to buy CARtoons again, and I loves may momma.""God yes!!! Me and some buddies had all of them in the day. I'd love to get my 7 year old, gear head son started on them.""Where do I send my Subscription? Sign me up as a life member!""I'll take a lifetime Subscription!!!"'Sign me up now! I grew up with the magazine and somewhere in my horde of stuff I still have a few!""Bring it, we want it..."and hundreds of other replies have shown the demand on bringing this magazine back to print. To view more responses on the Facebook fan page click on link below:
https://m.facebook.com/profile.php?id=166599510...
A Bonus for my contributors:As an appreciation to those that help contribute and help bring this magazine to the mag stand, the first 100 contributors that raise the most money will get a limited signed copy from all the artists involved in the first issue. The rest will get recognition in a future issue. Check out this campaign perks for more rewards. Thanks for any support.

story:
J.T. Lewis

My name is J.T. Lewis and I am a recent film graduate. I am also a Writer, Director,Dreamer and Doer. I've often been told that something cant be done or shouldn't be done and I've proven that notion to be wrong but this time I can't do it alone. I need your help.
H.Y.D.E
H.Y.D.E is a story of a young genius, Micheal Ryan who infiltrates the corporation his inventor father worked for to retrieve his father's life work before it is used  Military advancement. This sends into motion a chain of events that will change Micheal's outlook on life and the world as we know it , forever.

Contributors will help bring this story to life in form of a comic book. This will be a series of Action comics that illustrating the story of the super villain the world will come to know as HYDE. Everyone passes a dark fork in life , it's where we decide to go when we get there that makes us who we are.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $2500 to make the first 3 series in the comic book. The comics are written we just need to pay the artists and put it together. 
PERKS   include FREE ISSUES, YOURSELF as a character in the comic and much more.
If the fund doesn't reach the entire goal it will pay for however many issues it will be able to produce even if it's only one. Remember , we NEED DO THIS TOGETHER. With your help we can surely meet the goal and give the world the super villain it needs.
The Impact

One day HYDE will be an action packed blockbuster. This will be the comic that started it all. Gone are the days when everything was black and white and it was simple good vs evil. This comic will challenge that concept. It will make people think and evoke empathy. If you can simply change someone's outlook on life_you can change the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Make some NOISE!!! Make a movement. Share the video, like it, give some foot traffic so we can make this thing happen. If you have recommendations I'm always open to it, hit me up @ jtlewisfilm@gmail.com


Let's Show The World

story:
I was born in Kingston Jamaica. I came to Canada in 1978. I’ve been drawing comic books since I was
about six years old. I started with Batman, then Star Wars, then Spiderman, then Superman, then
eventually other books like the X-men and so on. Friends really liked my drawings so in high school I
decided I would attempt making my own comic book. I researched the comic book industry before
eventually releasing my first publication in to local stores called Crossfire. Years later, I would perfect
the material and release my newest material called Dresun. On my journey, I also studied film making
and found I had a passion for film making as well. I made my first film entitled Dresun in 2010 and
played it to an audience of all ages at the local Imax theatre in Ottawa, Canada. This went very well
and so this has lead me even closer to my goal in building a successful production company in comic
books, film making, animation and other related products that youths and families of all ages can
enjoy the benefits of our God given talents and positive ideas.

The idea for Dresun actually started when I was in high school. I used to draw comic books when a friend told me I should create a black super hero. Black super heroes were hardly heard of so I wasn’t sure if a book with the hero being black would sell, but as I thought about it, I thought that it would be very good for young black youths both male and female and the world community to see a black super hero as a positive, moral, role model that is not perfect, but develops as any other person matures into his potential. So I began working on various ideas that lead me to the modern idea of my first book which is entitled after the name of the main character- Dresun! Dresun is different than other comic books in the sense that the story is centered around the idea that he received his powers as a gift from God. This is important because it sparks an inner struggle that many of us can relate to in man struggling to reach his potential and in the process becoming a better person. As hard a person is, he cannot escape the trials and tribulations of love. Another aspect that the idea is rooted in and also brings balance to the story. Today, we have various black super heroes that are have successfully gone main stream such as Black Panther, Luke Cage, Black Lightning, Cyborg and Spawn. I’d like Dresun to fit right in there and become successful like the above super heroes so that youths of all ages and ethnicities can enjoy the adventures of Dresun and be positively educated whether they see Dresun in the book, on television, in a film or on DVD. These are my goals and aspiration which I’ve already begun and with your generous donation I would like to finish. The funding is to complete a short animated film that mixes animation with real live action as you can see in the teaser and show it at local movie theatres. I also need to print books, make DVDs, Print T-Shirts, attend comic related events, modernize my website as well as purchase marketing and advertising related products and giveaways that would help to popularize Dresun 2 and give it the spark it needs to be successful. So as you can see I am already on my way and your generous contribution would assist in making Dresun a reality!

The challenge we have is in convincing the greater audience to try this new but dynamic adventure comic book. Once the new audience discovers the genius in Dresun, then it becomes easy for them to become return customers which will add to the success of the product. In order to do this the new audience must be able to relate to the new idea. So we must introduce Dresun properly to the new audience so that it not only becomes relatable, but they also become a part of the Dresun universe and follow the stories, events, films, cartoons etc. To establish this relationship it is important for us to talk about Dresun at events as well as have a portion of our product reserved for samples and give aways so that Dresun can become relatable, similar to Superman, Spiderman, the Black Panther and Luke Cage, therefore establishing a connection that allows Dresun to stand the test of time as other comic heroes have stood the test of time.
 Another challenge we will take on is distribution to the wider audience. We already have a website put in place where customers can easily download Dresun products, but we would also like to expand to having books and product at larger retail outlets  such as comic shops and department stores as well as entering the film, television and streaming industry with films, series and animation in the near future.

story:
>>> already FULLY funded via Kickstarter <<<<

JUNGLE QUEEN SHEVA is a 24 page one-shot comic (no gore, no nudity, btw) that follows the  adventures of Sheva, a brave young girl in the African Kivuli Valley  (Valley of Shadows), a mythical place "where legends go to die".

 JUNGLE QUEEN SHEVA will be the first part of a trilogy of Sheva Oneshots as well as the first step into publishing the ZEU LIBRARY, where creator Eliseu "ZEU" Gouveia (Stargate, Cloudburst) will have the chance to finally channel his (finished and upcoming) personal projects onto paper. SHEVA was conceived in 2009 and drawn in 2010 and published online in 2015, so it is long over due to see this lady in print! 

In this first SHEVA adventure, she will face a legion of legendary amazons who enter the valley searching for the Heart of Apollo, a terrifying weapon believed to have been lost during the fall of Atlantis. As the army  advances, conflict ensues threatening the delicate balance of forces in  the region and it's up to Sheva to defuse the situation.

  Jungle Girl Sheva is an adventure comic in the vein of classics such as Tarzan or Flash Gordon, where action and fantasy take an unapologetic center stage. 

 
 

 

The Stretch Goals will revolve around introducing the ZEU LIBRARY, with all future titles like "Lady of the Horde", "Silversparrow", "Medusa", "Harlekin Waltz", "Infiniteens" and many more. The Stretch Goals will be Oversized Trading Cards to start with and depending how Sheva will be doing, the goals will expand into even more options.

ALL Unlocked Stretch Goals (including Kickstarter goal) will be added for FREE to backers who choose a physical pledge!

2.000 Goal: Oversized Trading Card of LADY OF THE HORDE & HARLEKIN WALTZ

2.500 Goal: Oversized Trading Card of IMORTAL TRISTARA & WARRIOR WOMAN

3.000 Goal: Oversized Trading Card of INFINITEENS & SILVERSPARROW

3.500 Goal: Oversized Trading Card of MEDUSA 31 & MIRROR MAIDEN

 

Eliseu (ZEU) Gouveia: Artist/Creator Mad Genius

"In West Philadelphia, born and..."

Nah, I'm just a Portuguese guy born in Mozambique who has been drawing for far longer than he'd care to admit.

I entered a few Comicon-contests while studying Electrotechnical Engineering before finally taking the plunge into the Art World as a School Books and Children's Books illustrator.

Somewhere along the line, someone created the Internet and I used it as a platform to make my artwork seen across the world, which eventually scored me enough gigs to dare call myself a comic artist.

Over the years I've worked on many-many comic projects and series, from Cloudburst by Jimmy Palmiotti and Justin Gray for Image Comics to Vengeance of the Mummy and The Phantom for Moonstone Books. 

I've worked on Lorelei and Pandora Zwieback for Starwarp Concepts, I've drawn The Instinct for Cooperation: A Graphic Novel Conversation with Noam Chomsky as well as acting as a sketch card artist for Marvel Rittenhouse Archives.

Presently I provide artwork for several webcomic titles such as Granted and Bastard Kingdom, as well as doing the art for comic book franchise Stargate Atlantis and Stargate Universe for American Mythology comics.

RICHARD BOOM: Project Leader

Richard is hounding and haunting Zeu for years now, to get his stunning projects in print. And with his recent Kickstarter-success (Sisterhood) he felt it was the perfect time to man-up and just make sure everyone can see these glorious projects: by starting the ZEU LIBRARY!

Richard Boom  started out in the comic industry as your regular fanboy, just reading  comics and enjoying it even more due to the internet and making contact  with creators. As his contact list grew, so did his interest in the complete field of comic. Starting up a Bad Grrl Comics Fan club in 2001  was the first step to go further then his own living room. Soon  thereafter he began setting up fansites for Arthur Suydam, Eric  Basaldua, Broadsword Comics and focusing on titles like Vampirella,  Cavewoman, Hack/Slash and more... During a visit to a Belgium convention  (F.A.C.T.S.) he even started working with the organization and since  2006 he has been officially affiliated with this convention, helping  them when and where he can; from seeking sponsorships, contacting  artists to be their guests to actually helping to manage the Artist Alley. At this convention he met the founder Broken Frontier and shortly thereafter began doing headlines for this news site. Later he founded the website COMICSFORSINNERS which more resembles his prior BadGrrl fanclub. Nowadays Richard  dabbles in editing comics, doing comic book PR, translating comics,  stopped working at FACTS in 2016 and has collected a lot of Hot Mummy sketches which he eventually turned into a comic book series in 2019 with the help of some amazing talented friends.

Soon  thereafter he began setting up fansites for Arthur Suydam, Eric  Basaldua, Broadsword Comics and focusing on titles like Vampirella,  Cavewoman, Hack/Slash and more... During a visit to a Belgium convention  (F.A.C.T.S.) he even started working with the organization and since  2006 he has been officially affiliated with this convention, helping  them when and where he can; from seeking sponsorships, contacting  artists to be their guests to actually helping to manage the Artist Alley. At this convention he met the founder Broken Frontier and shortly thereafter began doing headlines for this news site. Later he founded the website COMICSFORSINNERS which more resembles his prior BadGrrl fanclub. Nowadays Richard  dabbles in editing comics, doing comic book PR, translating comics,  stopped working at FACTS in 2016 and has collected a lot of Hot Mummy sketches which he eventually turned into a comic book series in 2019 with the help of some amazing talented friends.

story:
Two Stories About Magic & Finding Hope

This campaign is offering up a story of magic, wonder and rising from the depths of depression. Miseria Loves Company, is a short 8-page comic. It’s a story about Killian McCabe, a suicidal, hard-boiled detective and Miseria, the Goddess of Despair who saves him. The world is like ours on the surface, but underneath the familiar exterior a vastly different world exists, with magic and danger around every corner.

Miseria, the Goddess of Despair, Anxiety and Depression.

Killian McCabe, former Police Detective on the edge of ruin.

It has wonderful art by David Brame and if we overshoot our goal, this will expand into a longer comic where we tell a story about redemption and dealing with the demons we all have inside.  If we can get to the stretch goal of $3500, then a full 24-page issue will be created and sent out as PDF to all the backers. If we go over that, then more bits of the story will be revealed. If we manage to get to $28,000, then the full first volume (eight chapters!) will be distributed to the backers!

 

As a bonus, a copy of my full length novel, The Left Hand of God will be included in all reward tiers. It’s a story about Tim, a man struggling through life and he gets caught up in a world of magic, intrigue and an ancient artifact that both wizards and angels will do anything to obtain. Along the way, Tim finds his soul-mate, a purpose in life and somehow makes peace with his family.

 

I wrote both of these when I was feeling really depressed with no real relief in sight. Both of these stories helped me get out of that pain and back into a better state of mind. For a long time, I kept these stories put away, it was enough that just writing them helped me to get out of that mental state. Recently, I let a friend or two read them and it was well received enough that it gave me the push I needed to try and do this to get these stories out into the world.

 

About The Creators

Josh Gorfain has written a number of graphic novels and comics since 2009: Sterling for Arcana, an issue of Grimm Tales of Terror ("Bloody Mary") for Zenescope and his own self-published books, Meatspace (with art by Andrew MacLean and Matthew Furber) and Gamespace (with art by Yuki Saeki). His latest published work was a short story in the Ringo-nominated anthology “All We Ever Wanted” published by A Wave Blue World. Josh has also created and wrote the web series “True Believers,” able to be viewed on YouTube.

 

The Amazing David Brame is blackity Black, an Afrofuturist and refuses to comb his hair. He’d rather spend that time making comics. He’s worked on titles such as IS’NANA THE WERESPIDER, MEDISIN, Baaad MUTHAZ , BOX OF BONES, and NECROMANCER BILL. You can find him having slacker Wordpress skills on GraphicPoetics.biz or dropping weirdness on IG @amazingdavidbrame.

 

The Impact

The funds raised will be paying the creators directly, which is good because we can really use the money. If we achieve the stretch goals, we will be able to produce more pages. At this writing, we have the full eight pages of the initial goal completed and over fifty pages of story written with the whole two books plotted out. Your help can make this story a reality!

 

Risks & Challenges

The risks are very small, as everything is done and they both need minimal work to get them ready to completion, setting up copyrights, final production, etc. All the heavy lifting is already done. Since both stories will only be delivered digitally, there's no worrying about printing and the problems that can arise with that. The challenge comes in if we manage to hit our stretch goal to produce the pages as fast as I want which is instantaneously.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like what you see and you want to help, but you're too broke to - I get it, I'm broke as hell and that's one of the big reasons why we're doing this campaign - just share it everywhere you can!

It’s a story about Tim, a man struggling through life and he gets caught up in a world of magic, intrigue and an ancient artifact that both wizards and angels will do anything to obtain. Along the way, Tim finds his soul-mate, a purpose in life and somehow makes peace with his family.
 
I wrote both of these when I was feeling really depressed with no real relief in sight. Both of these stories helped me get out of that pain and back into a better state of mind. For a long time, I kept these stories put away, it was enough that just writing them helped me to get out of that mental state. Recently, I let a friend or two read them and it was well received enough that it gave me the push I needed to try and do this to get these stories out into the world.
 

About The Creators
Josh Gorfain has written a number of graphic novels and comics since 2009: Sterling for Arcana, an issue of Grimm Tales of Terror ("Bloody Mary") for Zenescope and his own self-published books, Meatspace (with art by Andrew MacLean and Matthew Furber) and Gamespace (with art by Yuki Saeki). His latest published work was a short story in the Ringo-nominated anthology “All We Ever Wanted” published by A Wave Blue World. Josh has also created and wrote the web series “True Believers,” able to be viewed on YouTube.
 
The Amazing David Brame is blackity Black, an Afrofuturist and refuses to comb his hair. He’d rather spend that time making comics. He’s worked on titles such as IS’NANA THE WERESPIDER, MEDISIN, Baaad MUTHAZ , BOX OF BONES, and NECROMANCER BILL. You can find him having slacker Wordpress skills on GraphicPoetics.biz or dropping weirdness on IG @amazingdavidbrame.
 

The Impact
The funds raised will be paying the creators directly, which is good because we can really use the money. If we achieve the stretch goals, we will be able to produce more pages. At this writing, we have the full eight pages of the initial goal completed and over fifty pages of story written with the whole two books plotted out. Your help can make this story a reality!
 

Risks & Challenges
The risks are very small, as everything is done and they both need minimal work to get them ready to completion, setting up copyrights, final production, etc. All the heavy lifting is already done. Since both stories will only be delivered digitally, there's no worrying about printing and the problems that can arise with that. The challenge comes in if we manage to hit our stretch goal to produce the pages as fast as I want which is instantaneously.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you like what you see and you want to help, but you're too broke to - I get it, I'm broke as hell and that's one of the big reasons why we're doing this campaign - just share it everywhere you can!

story:
The Scarlet Knight:Defender of the Block

The Scarlet Knight:Defender of the Block is about two cousins who return back to their hometown where they were raised by their grandparents after Medical school to be ER doctors, but find a magic gem that makes them knights in the modern day times.

This gem also creates medieval chaos in their community and among themselves. True characters are revealed when real power is yielded. This will be the 2nd issue for the company.

In this Issue, our main character is trying to make everything right again in order to save his beloved cousin and city, but the gem has created a few more creatures along with a crooked politician, whose intentions aren't in the best interest of all.  In order to make everything whole, Phoenix must follow Merlin's exact instructions, or be forced to watch everything crumble.

"Bring all the creatures back to my gem"

 

Who are You?

Juaquan Herron aka Jay Allen was a kid that grew up in inner city Kansas City. My mother had me at a early age, so I would have television when she would work those long hours. I also had great grandparents that loved cinema. I loved movies so much I became an actor, and soon transitioned to writing, because I believed my hood folks stories weren't being told in fantasy, horror, and sci-fi content. It was like only the burbs and country folks would experience these things. I would think "If a zombie apocalypse broke out in the world, how would the block handle it". I took that as a opportunity to start writing  our stories after doing my bid in Los Angeles acting and writing. I started the comic book company as a dedication to my grandparents who passed away 3 years ago. I even placed their likeness in the series.

 

I came back and created 2923 Comics dedicated to the memory of my grandparents. Our first issue was The Scarlet Knight:Defender of the Block. It has done so well, and to be able to motivate, create, and establish a name for my self as a comic book creator. Its a feeling like no other.

I am starting it again for Issue 2 of The Scarlet Knight. My main goal was to create new stories from all areas of the world. So when a mythical gem lands in the middle of the hood, giving you super powers. What would you do?

I owe a lot to my supporters in the community. I self funded my first project until it almost broke me, but I believed in my dream. The people who have supported me, have made me a better creator which each dollar, kind words, and every once of support. I've done 2 shows and sold out at the biggest Planet Comic Con!

Everything Helps

 I am in need of 4000 dollars to complete this project, and provide you with a great merch and books. All funds will go straight to my team for their contribution to the project. I am a big believer in paying what you owe and they have worked just as hard as myself on the first issue.

This time around. We will have T-shirts and comic books once again for your contribution. You may also be able to see yourself in this issue or issue 3! All funds will go to the completion of the project

The Impact

To be honest. I didn't know how Big of a impact SKDB would have on people. I've spoken at schools, conventions and community facilities. It was honor that I am looked at as a trail blazer in my community. If I can inspire one person to write their story. I've done my job. I want people to see they can change lemons into lemonade, and prove the world wrong.

Risks & Challenges

I don't foresee any issues coming in the future, but I constantly communicate. So if anything happens. You all will know.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, Like and follow! Anything helps. I will have contests through out this campaign. I want the help any way you can.

story:
18/07/2019

In Japan , Kyoto, Kyoto Animation (one of the most popular Animation film company) was a case of arson.

30 of the wonderful creators who work in Kyoto Animation have been killed or injured by this arson.

In addition, the equipment and buildings necessary for animation production were lost due to the arson of a company called Kyoto Animation.

That's why you can donate as much as a dollar for the quick recovery of the wonderful animation production company Kyoto Animation.

All donations will be made personally to Kyoto Animation.

Thank you for reading the text. Sorry for the ugly English. Thank you for your support.

[Twitter]
https://twitter.com/Sakamin0417?s=09

[YouTube]
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCF4e5Bus4w4wZL...

[Facebook]
https://www.facebook.com/ryohei.salami

story:
WE ARE STILL HERE. We are children of the stars. One day, we all return to our origins. Today, we fight to save our origins.

DISCLAIMER: All perks in Canadian CDN currency. All perks shipped priority and with tracking (a premium service in order to guarantee delivery). Perks logo and images may be different than they appear. Estimated delivery of all perks is December 2020 not considering unforeseen production or logistic delays, not limited to COVID19. All TRAIL BLAZER (contributors) will be contacted prior to shipping to acquire accurate shipping details, apparel style and sizes. ALL PERKS MUST MEET A MINIMUM ORDER QUANTITY TO BE PRODUCED. TRAIL BLAZER (contributors) will receive the entire digital SDOTU 2020 series even IF WE DO NOT MEET PERK ITEM MINIMUMS. In the event our SDOTU crowdfund goals are not met, all of the funds will be used to promote a second crowdfunding session in 2021 and/or used to conceptualize more SDOTU characters and complete as many SDOTU Chapters (series) of digital comic books as possible. All rights reserved 2020.

Tired of Hollywood and corporations stealing indigenous identity, culture, art, ceremony and traditions?? We're fighting to protect indigenous stories and people through digital copyright. WE ARE AN INDIGENOUS PRODUCTION COMPANY. All of the productions we produce are in partnership with real indigenous peoples. The views reflected in our productions hold traditional and cultural accuracy. We produce indigenous media to serve as intellectual property copyright protection for the individuals and nations who contribute to our projects. We want to see movie titles with Indigenous representation on the Hollywood big screens funded by majority owned indigenous companies. We want to encourage and identify with our indigenous youth and the next generations of future leaders to show that WE CONTROL OUR NARRATIVE. In order for us to influence Hollywood, big studios and corporations, we need to create and produce AMAZING indigenous content with your support! Our stories will reflect the injustice of colonization against indigenous peoples using real historical events. We want to set the record straight. WE NEED YOUR HELP!

ARE YOU A "TRAIL BLAZER" PROJECT CONTRIBUTOR?

The difference your Contribution will make:

  • OUR GOAL: Indigenous Superhero's are "going Hollywood". Jack Bear Legacy Pictures Presents: Sacred Defenders of the Universe (SDOTU) An UNOFFICIAL Marvel/DC alternate superhero universe based on the TRUE stories and REAL lives of indigenous peoples, writers, story tellers and cultural leaders from Nations around the world. Our Ultimate Goal of $5,000,000 is to help create a kick-ass indigenous Superhero feature film for the big screen!

  • OUR MISSION:
    Your Contribution will help us inspire the NEXT generation of indigenous youth and future leaders to recognize their strengths and abilities that can change our world for the better. Our project "Contributors" are called TRAIL BLAZERS and Trail Blazers will be included in every single step of our production process from start to finish, from comic book to full length feature film. You will get EXCLUSIVE first access to all of our final productions! Let's bring all of our Nations together as one.

  • If you can't Contribute, you can always SHARE our project on your social media. We have 60 days to reach our crowdfunding goal. Let our ancestors live through us. Loud and proud.

If we reach our ULTIMATE GOAL of $5,000,000 for a series pilot episode/ short film, "Trail Blazers" Contributors will get a first-look private screening of our full length FEATURE indigenous Superhero film before we go to any film festivals or licensed to any networks. And get your name in the credits!

OUR GOALS:

  • 1. We need to raise $5,000 for a full colour comic book of "Issue #1" (Comixology.com [Amazon])

  • 2. We need to raise $5,000 for a full colour superhero trading cards (Comixology.com [Amazon])

  • 3. We need to raise $60,000 for entire SDOTU: Aqueous Origin comic book series (ISSUE#1-ISSUE#12) (Comixology.com [Amazon])

  • 4. We need to raise $500,000 for a digital animated short film (Jack Bear Legacy Pictures x BrightlightPictures.com)

  • 5. We need to raise $1,000,000 for a short animated series (Jack Bear Legacy Pictures x BrightlightPictures.com)

  • 6. We need to raise $5,000,000 for a series pilot episode/ short film (Jack Bear Legacy Pictures x BrightlightPictures.com)

  • $1 Contributors will all receive a LIMITED first digital copy of the "Issue #1" story (no comic)

  • Every TRAIL BLAZER (Contributors) get their name on the credits for each goal we produce.

  • All Funds will go to PROMOTING and DEVELOPING our production goals in the order listed, even if we don't reach our minimum Goals.

TRAIL BLAZERS BONUS When we reach these first 3 Goals everyone will get the very first copies of comic book, trading cards and stickers before they hit retail stores and Comixology.com (Amazon).

 

SDOTU: Aqueous Origin Comic Book Series

Aqueous Origins Chapter #1 Respect Goal $5,000

Aqueous Origins Chapter #2 (Wayne Snellgrove) The Healer Goal $5,000

Aqueous Origins Chapter #3 Running Goal $5,000

Aqueous Origins Chapter #4 (Billy O’Brien) The Bounty Hunter Goal $5,000

Aqueous Origins Chapter #5 Sprinklers Goal $5,000

Aqueous Origins Chapter #6 (Tiger Lane?) Fire Goal $5,000

Aqueous Origins Chapter #7 Rainfoot Goal $5,000

Aqueous Origins Chapter #8 (Alycia Two Bears?) Medicine Woman Goal $5,000

Aqueous Origins Chapter #9 The Blank Book Goal $5,000

Aqueous Origins Chapter #10 (Nikita Kahpeaysewat) Terra Goal $5,000

Aqueous Origins Chapter #11 Blue Horse Goal $5,000

Aqueous Origins Chapter #12 (Earl Benallie) Aqueous (hears *Chinook) Goal $5,000

Aqueous Origins Series SYNOPSIS: The 4 Earth life elements named Water, Fire, Air, and Earth discover each other... and they somehow exist now in human form. They were sent from their home planet of "Planet X" to bring back their missing 12,000 year old Grand Ancient Chief? All while they defend Earth's indigenous peoples, culture and traditions against colonization, against corporate destruction throughout Earth's time and history. This is only the beginning. The Sacred Elements are also up against an inter Galactic species with their own agenda. How would you save the universe?

SHORT SUMMARY

Sacred Defenders of the Universe. A digital series of indigenous comic books, digital animation, short film/series pilot:

  • Anii/Hello, from Justin Jack Bear, your Executive Producer of Jack Bear Legacy Pictures LTD., @Earl_Benallie (IG) of Ktunaxa First Nation, and @TheWayneSmoke (IG) of Fishing Lake First Nation, in partnership with our friends at BrightlightPictures.com
  • It's important for real indigenous people to be represented in Hollywood to inspire, encourage and build confidence in our indigenous youth, and our future leaders of tomorrow
  • Contributors aka Trail Blazers like you help ELEVATE real indigenous stories into Hollywood style productions like this project that helps protect indigenous intellectual property through digital copyrighting. Indigenous people, artists and artisans are exhausted from big corporations stealing intellectual property, ideas and identities. We are here to hold those corporations accountable. This is a platform for YOU!

We need to come together as ONE NATION and CREATE the CHANGE we want to see for our future, the next generation of leaders, and the world.

Subscribe to this project today for ONLY $1 and get ACCESS to the original digital story via PDF format in your email within 48hrs!
 

Risks & Challenges

We risk not fighting for equality and change through entertainment. WE EXIST! WE ARE STILL HERE.

  • We have the network and connectivity of the internet to achieve any goals together!
  • We only have 60 days to raise the funds, so SHARE SHARE SHARE this project every single day! Use the Indiegogo Social Media Share tools.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help us reach our goal:

  • If you can't contribute money SHARE SHARE SHARE on your social media as much as you can for THE NEXT 60 DAYS! Only a $1 Subscription gets you a LIMITED digital story copy (non-comic) of "Issue #1" via your email right away!
  • Use the Indiegogo social media share tools! It's EASY.

And that's all there is to it. Stick with us for the next 60 days and let's make history and our future of storytelling!

Meegwech/ Thank you.

If you're an indigenous cultural leader, celebrity, pro athlete public figure or influencer and you want to be a part of our Indigenous alternate Universe storyline and Crowdfunding promo, please contact EP JustinJackBear@icloud.com @justinjackbear. WE ARE ALL INCLUSIVE!


 

INTRODUCING THE SDOTU Writers and Artists

IG @JustinJackBear (Producer)

IG @Earl_Benallie (Writer)

Jeni Cardinal (Writer)

TW @ande_milou (Artist)


We plan to independently publish our books on Comixology for digital copy and print on (Amazon) https://www.comixology.com/.

FEATURING CHARACTERS/ ALLIES

IG @Earl_Benallie (aka Aqueous)
IG @theWayneSmoke (aka The Healer)
IG @Thrilla96 Billy O'Brien (aka Bounty Hunter)
Tiger Phillip Lane (aka Fire)
IG @Alycia_Two_Bears (aka Medicine Woman)
IG @NikitaElyse (aka Terra)
IG @autumn_eaglespeaker (aka Chinook?)
IG @dopudmike (aka General)
IG @amosandmitch (aka President)
IG @gitzyboi (aka Red Warrior)
IG @shinanova (aka Tundra?)



 

OUR ULTIMATE GOAL is to produce a television series or full length feature film with our Partners at BrightlightPictures.com with the intention of seeking additional funding, if not licensing, with Netflix, Apple TV, Amazon Prime, Disney+, YouTube, APTN or a culturally appropriate studio. WE WILL LET YOU VOTE ON WHICH PLATFORM WE CHOOSE!


CHARACTER CONCEPTS (First Drafts) Created by ONE OF OUR ARTISTS @INDE_MILOU (Twitter) HELP US BRING MORE CHARACTERS AND STORIES TO LIFE!

 

"Trail BLAZER" Limited PERKS (logo/image design may not appear exactly as shown.)

 

IN PARTNERSHIP WITH
.com and .com and

 

DISCLAIMER: All perks in Canadian CDN currency. All perks shipped priority and with tracking (a premium service in order to guarantee delivery). Perks logo and images may be different than they appear. Estimated delivery of all perks is December 2020 not considering unforeseen production or logistic delays, not limited to COVID19. All TRAIL BLAZER (contributors) will be contacted prior to shipping to acquire accurate shipping details, apparel style and sizes. ALL PERKS MUST MEET A MINIMUM ORDER QUANTITY TO BE PRODUCED. TRAIL BLAZER (contributors) will receive the entire digital SDOTU 2020 series even IF WE DO NOT MEET PERK ITEM MINIMUMS. In the event our SDOTU crowdfund goals are not met, all of the funds will be used to promote a second crowdfunding session in 2021 and/or used to conceptualize more SDOTU characters and complete as many SDOTU Chapters (series) of digital comic books as possible. All rights reserved 2020.

Jeni Cardinal (Writer)TW @ande_milou (Artist)We plan to independently publish our books on Comixology for digital copy and print on (Amazon) https://www.comixology.com/.FEATURING CHARACTERS/ ALLIESIG @Earl_Benallie (aka Aqueous)IG @theWayneSmoke (aka The Healer)IG @Thrilla96 Billy O'Brien (aka Bounty Hunter)Tiger Phillip Lane (aka Fire)IG @Alycia_Two_Bears (aka Medicine Woman)IG @NikitaElyse (aka Terra)IG @autumn_eaglespeaker (aka Chinook?)IG @dopudmike (aka General)IG @amosandmitch (aka President)IG @gitzyboi (aka Red Warrior)IG @shinanova (aka Tundra?) OUR ULTIMATE GOAL is to produce a television series or full length feature film with our Partners at BrightlightPictures.com with the intention of seeking additional funding, if not licensing, with Netflix, Apple TV, Amazon Prime, Disney+, YouTube, APTN or a culturally appropriate studio. WE WILL LET YOU VOTE ON WHICH PLATFORM WE CHOOSE!
CHARACTER CONCEPTS (First Drafts) Created by ONE OF OUR ARTISTS @INDE_MILOU (Twitter) HELP US BRING MORE CHARACTERS AND STORIES TO LIFE!
 "Trail BLAZER" Limited PERKS (logo/image design may not appear exactly as shown.) IN PARTNERSHIP WITH.com and .com and DISCLAIMER: All perks in Canadian CDN currency. All perks shipped priority and with tracking (a premium service in order to guarantee delivery). Perks logo and images may be different than they appear. Estimated delivery of all perks is December 2020 not considering unforeseen production or logistic delays, not limited to COVID19. All TRAIL BLAZER (contributors) will be contacted prior to shipping to acquire accurate shipping details, apparel style and sizes. ALL PERKS MUST MEET A MINIMUM ORDER QUANTITY TO BE PRODUCED. TRAIL BLAZER (contributors) will receive the entire digital SDOTU 2020 series even IF WE DO NOT MEET PERK ITEM MINIMUMS. In the event our SDOTU crowdfund goals are not met, all of the funds will be used to promote a second crowdfunding session in 2021 and/or used to conceptualize more SDOTU characters and complete as many SDOTU Chapters (series) of digital comic books as possible. All rights reserved 2020.

story:
DINNER AT ROSWELL'S:
A THRILLING NEW GRAPHIC NOVEL

Private Eye Frank LaRue's having a bad day. He's on the run from the mob. He's befriended a creature from outer space. Together they must confront an evil force determined to destroy the Earth! The fate of the world depends on if they can make it in time for "Dinner at Roswell's!"

  • Soft cover
  • 204 Pages
  • Full color
  • 7"x 10.5"
  • Each copy comes signed by the artist.

 

"It's like THE ROCKETEER meets THE X-FILES!"

 

WATCH THE BOOK BEING MADE RIGHT BEFORE YOUR EYES!

You will be able to watch the book being drawn and will have the chance to ask me questions, interact with me..etc. almost daily over at MY OFFICIAL YOUTUBE CHANNEL!

 

I NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN!

Everything's just about in place. I have the art, design and story covered. Christina Veldman has conjured up the words and Deborah Behrends is in charge of the editing. But, we need your help to bring this book into reality! 

 

"This book is PURE FUN from beginning to end!"

 

VISIT THE OFFICIAL DINNER AT ROSWELL'S STORE!

story:
A dark, dramatic, and adrenaline-fueled criminal comic series!  Thats what im going for here.

The Brief description

             The Rogue is a crime-riddled drama series that shows what it takes to push a good-hearted family man to a life of crime. Issue 1 starts off on what is essentially our protagonist’s worst day.  Dealing with the struggles of work stress, and stresses from home, he seemingly can catch a break! With today in specific, the world seemingly keeps beating him down. So today’s the day Reese hits his breaking point!

         Our story takes inspiration from crime dramas such as Sons of Anarchy, The Shield, and the Mayans MC. Of course none of this will matter if we don’t have truly interesting characters. So, throughout the series you’ll see the real life struggles these characters go through on a day to day basis. As many of us know, society has created many monsters. Most of our characters are hard workers, but they keep getting the shit end of the stick in life! So you'll bare-witness to these characters finally saying that enough is enough! With Reese at the helm, they form The Rogue!

With this Kickstarter you’ll be supporting the production of issue 1 and help jumpstart the series! On a special note, those who donate $50 or more will get their name in the back of the issue!

The Creation

The Idea

I came up with the idea of the series a long time ago. I was listening to "Blue on black" by "Five Finger Death Punch", while cruising around on "GTA 5". I was Dealing with some home life issues, as well as worrying about making enough money to just live. It was at this time I created the character of "Reese". I was driving the "GTA" equivalent of a "1970 Plymouth Cuda".  It was here where I asked the question, "What would it take to push me to a life of crime?". Thus the idea was there, and I thought, well what would that entail? So I slowly started writing ideas down until I came across the idea of using muscle cars as a theme. Around that time period, I had finished the "Sons of Anarchy" TV series. I decided early on to use a similar structure of how outlaw motorcycle clubs work, just altered a bit to make sense for classic cars. After a few months, I eventually had the basic story done! 

The Future

Assuming things go well... I have a roadmap, that is intended to span over 100 issues. Over the years I've been noting down possible story arc's, written descriptions for over 27 issues, and even scripted to first 3 issues! I even have ideas for a couple "One shot" issues.


 I hope that you will help support the future of this series and be apart of our world!

Cheers!  -Darin L. Munsey

 

Risks and challenges

Due to Covid-19, we warn all of our awesome supporters that things may get delayed. In fact, if you're out of the country, then it's very possible you may not receive your items for quite some time. Also with these complications, we also reserve the right to delay the comic as a whole. We hope to have the issue ready for release by March of 2021, but due to where the artist is located we may experience some problems... thanks COVID... On another side note, if we don't get fully funded, do expect a big delay in your items, as I'm living paycheck to paycheck. It would take a good bit to get your items ready.

story:
Update: Ronald Rump #2 is Now Available!

 

Ronald Rump #1

Ronald Rump #1 is 32 pages of newsprint goodness, drawn in the classic Harvey Comics style. We still have plenty of copies in stock, and your comic will ship within seven days of receiving your order.


Actual photo of RONALD RUMP #1, part of this important breakfast.
 

Ronald Rump #2

Ronald Rump #2 is 24 pages of crazy fun for all ages! It's printed on 60# bright white paper with 80# gloss cover, and will hold up to lots of reading. Ronald, Rudy & Julian,  and Darnwell the Little Demon are back! Plus, meet Professor Drainbrain and the prehistoric family, The Bonespurs in this crazy story about "The T-Rump Plague!" Orders for #2 will be shipped within seven days of receiving your order.

 

Update on Original Art Availability

Interior comic art pages of Ronald Rump #2 are available. The following pages for Ronald Rump #1 have been purchased; the rest are still available:

  1. Front Cover
  2. Charity Begins at Home pp 1
  3. Charity Begins at Home pp 6
  4. The Hugest Birthday Party in History pp 5
  5. The Hugest Birthday Party in History pp 6
  6. Vlad the Imposter pp 1
  7. Vlad the Imposter pp 6
  8. Vlad the Imposter pp 7
  9. Vlad the Imposter pp 10
  10. Rudy & Julian (one pager)

 

A Short Summary

RONALD RUMP #1 and #2 are perhaps the Greatest Comic Books Ever.

 

Ronald Rump #1: 32 Pages Full of Color and Full of Fun!

The actual comic book will be folded and stapled together by the best folders and staplers in the business, not lots of loose pages like this.

 

SO Funny

These comic books are SO funny. And they're appropriate for all ages; even adults. It is especially appealing to the Comics Elite and people who like Fart Jokes. Here's what some very intelligent and astute people are saying about RONALD RUMP #1. (These are real quotes. We didn't make them up.)

 

PERKS!

 

Official RONALD RUMP Fan Club Card and Official RONALD RUMP Bookmark

 

Original RONALD RUMP Drawerings by Peter Wolf

Whew!

 

Original RONALD RUMP #1 Page Art

 

About Peter Wolf

  • Peter Wolf is a veteran cartoonist.
  • This comic book is Peter Wolf's first crowdfunding project.
  • Peter Wolf likes to write and draw comics.
  • Peter says shipping comics is not as fun, but that's okay.

 

InDemand

When RONALD RUMP #1 met its goal, it slipped into OverDrive, or as Indiegogo calls it, InDemand. This means you can continue to buy RONALD RUMP #1 and #2, including the perks, as long as the supply lasts.

Thank you for your support!

 

Free Preview of Ronald Rump #1

 

Okay, That's All.

story:
Flipside Comics bring you a dark in your face Gothic horror tale with elements of today's superhero titles. N-Force is the story of a force that's been on Earth since the beginning of time slowly destroying humanity, and the sole remaining power that stands between hope and humanity's destruction.


Synopsis: (N-Force is a comic book about a semi-popular high school student named Nick Myers, who suddenly finds himself possessing extraordinary powers and reflexes . Nick never put much thought into the supernatural, until he came across a demon hunter who was dying. Needing someone to take over his plight, the demon hunter bestowed his powers upon the unsuspecting teenager. With his girlfriend witnessing the horrifying act, Nick must find a way to mend his relationship and live a normal life, while all along battling demons and dealing with the voices of the past.
In his comic book debut, Nick must battle a demon, who is hellbent on destroying downtown Denver, Colorado. With the city looking like a war-zone, Nick must do all he can to defeat the demon, while saving innocent bystanders, and keeping the damage at a minimum.)


We here at Flipside Comics take comic books very seriously. We strive to put out the best quality for our products. We have awesome talent working with us here at Flipside Comics, like Jim Callahan and his son Dominick Callahan. We also have other talent who occasionally lend a hand, like Issac Cordova, Larry Stroman, and JD Smith. We are raising funds to produce a full color version of our first comic, which is named N-Force. All funds will be put directly towards the production of N-Force #1. If we fund more than our goal we will put that towards N-Force #2. N-Force should be hitting the stands in late July 2015, with the 2nd issue following in late September or early October. This is just the beginning, there are many other titles cooking in the Flipside oven.

We would like to ask everyone to help us get the word around and make some noise about our campaign. Also, don't forget to use Indiegogo share tools.

Indiegogo provides the best opportunity to get the first N-Force comic book into the hands of those who want a copy. The money raised will also cover all printing costs for N-Force #1, shipping costs, mailing/packaging supplies and other incidentals. Please add $15 to your pledge for overseas shipping.

The reason why this comic book was created was because I always wanted to write comics.  For the vast majority of my life I have been buying and selling comic books. Now a dream has come true, I make them. Now let's meet the crew.

                             Stephen Krebs

That's me! I'm the creator of Flipside Comics and N-Force, and also the lead writer. I am also the acclaimed author of "The Vampire Chronicles of Jack Holladay" trilogy. I have been writing vampire books since 2011 and have published 3 novels. I'm excited to share this comic book with the world and hope everyone loves it as much as us here at Flipside Comics.

                             Jim Callahan 

Industry veteran Jim Callahan is well known for his work in helping launch Malibu's Ultraverse, SyFy's Tekno Comix and his work on various titles over the years. His work has appeared in Spawn, X Men, Hardcase, Warrior, Dethgrip, Damnation Crusade for Boom!, Tag!, and many others including several gaming companies including Blizzard's World of Warcraft, Wizards of the Coast, AEG, Rackham and many others. Now Jim is working on our N-Force comic.

                           Dominick Callahan 

We here at Flipside Comics are proud to announce that the inks for N-Force #1 are being done by Jim's son, Dominick Callahan. This is his first comic debut after years of apprenticing under his dad. I'm sure you will agree with us when we say he is very talented and has a big future in front of him.

                                   JD Smith

JD will be doing the colors on the cover.  He is an industry coloring veteran of Top Cow fame. Known for his work on Tomb Raider, Witchblade, Fathom, Spirit of the Tao and several titles for Marvel including Iron Man and Ultimate Spiderman.
