story:
Short Summary

Thanks to everyone who contributed during the normal campaign!  For anyone just checking this out now, you can still contribute, and there are lots of great perks left.  The printer I'm using is letting me pay on a payment plan, and I'm putting some of it on a credit card...so I will still be able to make the print run of 1,500, but as you can tell from that information, additional contributions will be extremely helpful!


Also, note that obviously it will be impossible to have contributors' names printed in the comic after it goes to press, but everything else applicable to each of those perks is still available, and your comic can be addressed to you when it's signed if you like!

This is a hilarious comic that takes rock stars from various eras and puts them in bizarre high school situations where their teachers and principals are former TV stars from shows like 90210 and Full House.  It's in black and white and some of the jokes are obvious, while others need a little more thought or even knowledge about rock history.  Music lovers will get a few "inside jokes" that might elude everybody else.

I have a BFA in Art from the University of North Texas as well as a certificate in Commercial Art, but took a career path in another area for a while.  Now that I'm back to what I love and ready to rock, you get my first big work as well as some other short comic stories that will be a part of a "flip book" format - so Rock Star High is on one side and will be 14 pages, then the other side will have a couple of superhero stories I created years ago, including Triton Legacy, which I dreamt up in 1997 and is similar to The Darkness, which we all know came out a bit later - oh well, we can't all be Marc Silvestri!

What We Need & What You Get

  • To get the best deal on printing and shipping, I'll need to print at least 1,500 copies.  Including the cut that indiegogo takes out, that will be about $3,300.
  • The other $200 is to cover the cost of shipping some of this cool stuff to all of you - if enough of you donate that it exceeds that, don't worry, I can cover the extra myself!
  • If I don't reach my goal, we'll still print the comic, we just won't get the best deal available.  If we raise about $2,500, that will be enough for 700 copies as well as shipping your stuff to you.  Look at my perks section to see what you get - less money gets you more cool stuff than most campaigns I've seen!
  • If you donate at one of the higher levels, I may be able to get you your swag prior to the printing of the comic, depending upon how many custom pieces I end up having to complete!

The Impact

  • Let's face it, superheroes are cool, but EVERYBODY is doing them.  Wouldn't it be awesome to have a darkly hilarious comic?  Yes, I'll answer for you -  yes, it would.  I know there are a few cool horror comics and other genres floating around, but not nearly enough.
  • Sneak peeks of the pages are available on my facebook page as they're completed (sans lettering, of course), so you know I'm actually producing this baby - only a few pages left as I'm starting this campaign!
  • www.facebook.com/kidever.art

Risks & Challenges

  • The only major challenge is money!  I'm not a completely broke artist, but I waited until I had a family to start making art again, so I don't have enough disposable income to afford this on my own.
  • There is no risk!  The main Rock Star High is already done, including the cover.  Plus, the stuff for the flip-side has been finished for years.  Even if I don't reach my goal to print the 1,500 copies, I'll still be able to print a lesser quantity.
  • Note that though there are no "adult themes," there is a little bit of adult language as part of a running joke.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're like me and would love to help out and just don't have the cash, or if you do help to sponsor my project and want to see me reach my goal, don't forget to share with friends!  Note that one of the "perks" for contributing is a commissioned painting, so if you and/or your friends aren't comic fans, you can get a cool painting of your favorite celebrity or superhero or fantasy character or whatever.

If you donate at one of the higher levels, I may be able to get you your swag prior to the printing of the comic, depending upon how many custom pieces I end up having to complete!    The Impact  Let's face it, superheroes are cool, but EVERYBODY is doing them.  Wouldn't it be awesome to have a darkly hilarious comic?  Yes, I'll answer for you -  yes, it would.  I know there are a few cool horror comics and other genres floating around, but not nearly enough. Sneak peeks of the pages are available on my facebook page as they're completed (sans lettering, of course), so you know I'm actually producing this baby - only a few pages left as I'm starting this campaign! www.facebook.com/kidever.art    Risks & Challenges  The only major challenge is money!  I'm not a completely broke artist, but I waited until I had a family to start making art again, so I don't have enough disposable income to afford this on my own. There is no risk!  The main Rock Star High is already done, including the cover.  Plus, the stuff for the flip-side has been finished for years.  Even if I don't reach my goal to print the 1,500 copies, I'll still be able to print a lesser quantity.
Note that though there are no "adult themes," there is a little bit of adult language as part of a running joke.    Other Ways You Can Help If you're like me and would love to help out and just don't have the cash, or if you do help to sponsor my project and want to see me reach my goal, don't forget to share with friends!  Note that one of the "perks" for contributing is a commissioned painting, so if you and/or your friends aren't comic fans, you can get a cool painting of your favorite celebrity or superhero or fantasy character or whatever.

story:
Cosa è Sex sells

Sex sells è una raccolta di vignette dell'artista Norbert Niessen. Un concentrato di cliché e sogni proibiti su sesso, religione e politica.
Il libro autoprodotto conterrà circa 100 vignette realizzate ad acquerello e sarà pubblicato in tre lingue, italiano, inglese e tedesco.
Un mix di qualità artistica e satira sagace che non mancherà di strappare un sorriso anche ai più conservatori.
Lasciamo parlare le immagini.

What is Sex sells?

Sex sells is a collection of comics by the artist Norbert Niessen. A concentration of clichés and forbidden dreams about sex, religion and politics.
The self-produced book will contain about 100 watercolor images and will be published in three languages, Italian, English and German.
A mix of artistic quality and clever satire that won't miss out on putting a smile on the face of the most conservative readers.
Let the images speak for themselves.

Was ist Sex sells

Sex sells ist eine Karikaturensammlung des Künstlers Norbert Niessen. Eine Konzentration von Klischees und verbotener Träume über Sex, Religion und Politik.
Das Buch enthält etwa 100 mit Aquarell eingefärbte Zeicnungen in drei Sprachen, Italienisch, Englisch und Deutsch und wird in Eigenproduktion erstellt und veröffentlicht.
Eine Mischung aus künstlerischer Qualität und kluger Satire, die jedem ein Lächeln abgewinnen wird.
Lasst die Bilder sprechen.

A cosa serve il vostro contributo?

Il libro è interamente autoprodotto, e stampare un libro di buona qualità è molto costoso per chiunque scelga di non appoggiarsi ad una casa editrice. Quindi, del traguardo prefissato, 3.000€ sono destinati a coprire i costi di stampa per la totalità di 1.000 volumi in formato A4 orizzontale, rilegati a brossura filo refe. Gli altri 500€, invece, copriranno le percentuali di Indiegogo, di Paypal ed altre ed eventuali.
Qualora la somma non venisse raggiunta, qualunque contributo parziale sarebbe comunque di grande aiuto al fine della realizzazione del progetto.

Why is your contribution needed?

The book is entirely self-produced, and printing a book of good quality is very expensive for anyone who chooses not to rely on a publisher. Therefore, € 3,000 of the set goal, are intended to cover printing costs for the total of 1000 volumes in A4 album format, bound in paperback cotton thread. The other € 500, however, will cover the costs of Indiegogo, Paypal and other any other service.
If the goal is not reached, any partial contribution would still be of great help to the completion of the project.

Wozu dient Ihr Beitrag?

Das Buch ist komplett selbst selbstproduziert, und ein Buch von guter Qualität zu drucken ist sehr teuer für alle, die keinen Verlag gewählt haben. Daher ist das Ziel 3.000 €. Diese sollen die Druckkosten decken für Insgesamt 1000 Bücher in A4-format, mit Kartonumschlag und klassischer Einbindung Die weiteren 500 € sollen die Provisionen von Indiegogo, Paypal, sowie die Versandkosten decken.
Sofern die Summe nicht erreicht wird, wird jeder Teilbeitrag immer noch eine große Hilfe für die Fertigstellung des Projekts sein.

story:
Hi and Welcome to the Marandas Realm!

My name is Lucce and Marandas is my ongoing Fantastic Series. It's a story about courage, friendship and a long journey of two inseparable companions into the realms of knowledge and magic. Willing to bring light and hope back to their kingdom, both friends find help and wisdom in the most incredible places of middle earth.

We have been writing and drawing for some years now and the first book is now finished. With over 250 pages and more than 50 amazing illustrations by Gabriel Molinari we are ready to share it with you.
We now have printed and e-book versions ready and we need your help to put it out and share this beautiful and inspiring story.

Find a Glimpse of the Final Illustrations Here
All images are copyright of LUCCE & PARTNERS LTD


Check the Pre Production Concept Images Gallery Here
All images are copyright of LUCCE & PARTNERS LTD


THE BOOK

Hardcover
260+ pages in full color
~17x24 cm
Bonus content in the back!!

Exclusive Printed Version

Also availiable in Kindle Version by Amazon.com


If you haven't pledged yet click on the pledge level you want, and on the first tab there's a field called "additional gift". Here you can simply write in the value of the extra item(s) that you wanted.

If you've already pledged and want to still add things: click on "contribute now" at the top (pink button), select "no perk" and enter in the value of the extra items you want. Make sure you use the same account/email for each contribution you make so that I'll be able to merge them afterwards.

The Perks

We have selected some amazing preproduction drawings, original artwork and the best printing services to make this a unique piece of art. You will get the e-book, but you can also choose some artwork, postcards and the best of all, a signed HardCopy of the first print of Marandas! Pick one Now!


This has been a Journey already for us, thanks for the support!!


Love & Peace, Lucce and Gabriel

story:
Hi, everyone.

Levi here. I'm the director and co-writer of Maybe Sunshine, a music oriented comedy for the web about a woman in her 40s getting her band, Radiana, going in New York City.

I'm an actor and a director working around New York City and sometimes LA. I met this amazing woman named Lisa Hammer. She's been working in the film/TV industry for years, as well. She is mostly easily recognized as the voice of Triana Orpheus in the popular Adult Swim cartoon, the Venture Bros. But people may not know that she had an extensive music career before that in bands that headlined all over the East Coast and especially popular in the New York goth scene.

She told me some amazing stories about her tours some of which I can barely believe are real.

I thought to myself, "Her life in the music industry would make a great show!"

We had just finished a movie in Utah and we were high on the proverbial hog and decided, let's make this show.

But, you see, this isn't a normal show. We actually have music! This show features her newest band, Radiana! Which meant we had to hire actors who could play instruments and intrumentalists who would act. I won't even mention the band manager, vampires, goth radio DJs, and the rival band!

We've already shot a lot of stuff over the last few months, five out of six episodes, and we've tested it and gotten a lot of good feedback including winning the Audience Choice Award at IndieWorks in New York.

We are on the last stretch and what we need is finishing funds to wrap up the show, shoot one final episode, some incidentals and pickup sequences, and all of the post production.

We also have opportunities to help us finish music production for our theme song which we will release as a full single.

We have a lot of fun stuff to offer as premiums including CDs of Radiana, stickers and buttons, Radiana t-shirts, and images of Triana Orpheus signed by Lisa Hammer and more.

Here's the thing: This show has been a labor of love. It's a beautiful and fun and fantastical story about being a woman in New York City as she navigates the much younger music scene. I, personally, love Radiana. Lisa has one of the most amazing voices out there, on many levels.

We have great producers in Sean Mannion and Carolyn Maher, both accomplished producers and filmmakers, and Myles Tyrer-Vasell, our passionate Director of Photography and Cinematographer. I can't even begin to mention everyone who have volunteered their efforts to make this show into a reality.

Our exciting guest stars include:  stand-up comedians, rock stars, film/TV stars and new discoveries:  comedian Adam Phillips (B.E.T. Comic View, Conan O'Brien, 30 Rock), rock musician Voltaire (Projekt Records), comedienne Darra Boyd (Flavor of Love, The Tyra Banks Show), rock band Late Cambrian (Jimmy Kimmel Show), Rocco Parente (A Bronx Tale), Jonathan Forte (Phil Spector, The Sitter), comedian Anu Valia (College Humor, MTV) Jacob Heimer (Unbreakable Kimmie Schmidt) and comedienne Hye Yun Park.

We have had a lot of fun making this show and I think you will have a lot of fun watching it. In fact, we hope people will like it enough that we can make more.

And if you think you know anyone who'd like to contribute, please feel free to let them know.

Here's a list of sponsors you can join who have helped us out in one way or another:



The Creators:

Levi Wilson noteworthy appearances include David Chase's Not Fade Away, Drew Tobias' See You Next Tuesday, and most recently in James Merendino's Punk's Dead alongside Devon Sawa and James Duval. Punk's Dead premiered at Cannes and is scheduled for a Winter 2016 release. Levi has teamed with his wife, Lisa Hammer (Venture Bros.) and James Merendino (SLC Punk!) by appearing in The Invisible Life of Thomas Lynch, co-directed by Hammer and Merendino, which screened at the CMJ Film Festival, where it won Best Narrative Feature. He has also collaborated with Hammer and writer Ben Edlund (The Tick, Angel) for the indy film POX: The Movie, available through TLA. Levi has published short plays, including a Strawberry One-Act Festival Best Play winner, in which he was also nominated Best Actor. Levi has two decades of mixed martial arts training. He is currently co-writing and co-producing an original series for the web with Hammer.

​Lisa Hammer is a comedic actress, writer and indie filmmaker. She is best recognized as the voice of Triana Orpheus on the Adult Swim cartoon the Venture Brothers, as well as for her extensive music career as a singer-songwriter. She has also directed independent dark comedy feature and short films such as Pox and Pus$bucket, and the CMJ Film Festival winner The Invisible Life of Thomas Lynch which she co-directed with James Merendino (SLC Punk!). She most recently worked on Punk’s Dead: SLC Punk 2, also directed by James Merendino, which premiered at the Cannes Film Festival in May 2015. Lisa has collaborated with  Ben Edlund (The Tick, Firefly, Angel, Supernatural) and Doc Hammer (Venture Brothers) on independent feature films such as Pus$bucket and Pox. She created The Pox Show starring H. Jon Benjamin (Archer,Jon Benjamin Has a Van), Jonathan Katz (Dr. Katz), and Arden Myrin (Orange Is the New Black, Inside Amy Schumer). Lisa directed and produced two award-winning weekly NY cable TV shows and has worked with such notables as, Clayne Crawford (Jericho, Swimfan), Lisa D’amato (America’s Next Top Model), Jimmy Duval (Donnie Darko, SLC Punk!), Courtney Love (Hole), and Russell Sams (The Rules of Attraction), to name a few. Lisa is in post-production for the musical comedy feature film The Sisters Plotz which she directed and stars in with Lisa Ferber (Each Time I Kill), Eve Plumb (The Brady Bunch), Allen Lewis Rickman (Boardwalk Empire, A Serious Man), Yelena Shmulenson (Boardwalk Empire, A Serious Man, Orange Is the New Black) and Aryn Cole (All My Children). Lisa's films have won awards from the CMJ Film Festival, Telly Awards, Hugo Awards, It Came From Kuchar Film Festival, the Chicago Underground Film Festival, Canada International Screenplay Festival, Ontario Film Festival, Movies on a Shoestring, Antimatter, and two from New York Press. She has had one-woman shows at the Olympia Film Festival, Perth International Film Festival, and the Duolun Art Museum in Shanghai, China.

story:
So What is 'THE BEAST'?

'THE BEAST' is a new graphic novel, created in collaboration with Dr. Patrick McCurdy (Communications, Ottawa U) and Calgary-based Blackfoot artist and performer, Terrance Houle.

  • Ad Astra Comix is an independent comics publishing collective. 'The Beast' will be our 5th title, and our very first original production.
     
  • The public discussion of energy in Canada is a mess. The oil industry churns out emotionally manipulative ads equating the tar sands to cupcakes. Environmental NGOs have apparently decided that if they can just make an ad depressing enough, it'll spur us to action and stop climate change once and for all. 
     
  • Set against that backdrop, this comic follows the story of two art school graduates in Edmonton - one gainfully employed in advertising, the other barely hanging on as a photographer for environmental NGOs. It's a funny and occasionally uncomfortable look at how doing your best and doing good don't always take you to the same places.
     

Where you come in:

  • Lucky for us, all we need is the money to take this book to print. Produced in partnership with Dr. Patrick McCurdy, a professor of communications at the University of Ottawa, the cost of writing and illustrating has already been covered.
     
  • This is a straightforward pre-order campaign: support the crowdfunder, receive the book as soon as it's back from the printer.
     
  • All the money from this campaign will go directly to the cost of printing and shipping the books and perks we produce for it.


New Perk!

For the final two weeks of The Beast's pre-order campaign, we're introducing a new perk! Terrance Houle, a Calgary-based Blackfoot artist (and author of The Beast's afterword), is contributing 8 limited edition block prints of his work 'Oily Buffalo', which features in the comic. 

'Oily Buffalo' prints art approximately 8" x 10" and will be mailed separately from your copy of 'THE BEAST'.

 

      What'll We Do if We Don't Hit Our Target?

      • It's alwayshard to know how much interest there will be in a comic until the crowdfunder goes live.
         
      • We'll adjust the size of our print run based on the number of orders we receive.

       

      Other Ways You Can Help

      This is a book about precarious work, among other things. We understand if you can't afford to order a copy! There's still plenty you can do to help us reach our goal.

      • Tell your friends, family, and clients who owe you outstanding invoices about the project.
         
      • Signal boost THE BEAST crowdfunder on your social media! You would be surprised what a difference this can make toward our goal.
         
      • Look for "#TheBeast hashtag on social media, and help us share and boost
         
      • Order a copy of the book for your local library (ISBN: # 978-0-9940507-8-6)

story:
I Rise

I Rise is the third episode and the second arc in the Team Genesis series, the flagship series of FarCorners Studios.

At the end of the first arc, Pleasant Introductions (Team Genesis #01-02), Dr. Benjamin Grant has gathered together Gerald Petworth (Ice Storm), Kari James (Vibrant), Alexander Kyong (Streaks), Eloni "Aaron" Williams (Stampede), and Grayson Brooks (Flare) to find other individuals with special abilities, known as GEHMs, in order to protect them from exploitation or incarceration.

In the next arc, I Rise, members of the fledgling team are asked to recruit more GEHMs and instead find themselves caught in the last remnants of an old and secret war between Japan and China. Also in the arc, the Delta Squadron, the special paramilitary force of the Department of Homeland Security faces disbandment; tension rises among Team Genesis members; and an adversary from Grant's true past finally steps out of the shadows, and is prepared to challenge them all.

Exclusive Offer

I Rise is in full production and will only be available for digital download. FarCorners Studios, however, is offering its fans, a.k.a. GEHMs, and those who support the work of independent artists, an exclusive offer to purchase the printed single edition of Team Genesis #03: I Rise. This single edition will NOT be available for purchase after this crowdfunder ends. YOU CAN ONLY GET TEAM GENESIS #03 PRINTED AND SIGNED HERE!!!

If you have printed copies of Team Genesis #01-02, then you already know that you have to get your hands on Team Genesis #03.

If you prefer physical books, but haven't picked up previous print issues, choose a contribution that gets you all three issues, printed and signed. This is a LIMITED TIME OFFER FOR TEAM GENESIS #03!! After this, you will not be able to get #03 printed, EVER!! So don't wait!!

Your Contribution
Your contribution will go toward the continued work of the artists and FarCorners Studios staff that work tirelessly on making great art and great stories that take you into the uncharted realms of science fiction and fantasy.


With your contribution we can continue to provide more work for our artists, continue to pay our support staff, and continue to push out more episodes for your enjoyment. Your contributions will help us all to lift off into the farcorners of the imagination.
story_txt:
I Rise
 I Rise is the third episode and the second arc in the Team Genesis series, the flagship series of FarCorners Studios.


At the end of the first arc, Pleasant Introductions (Team Genesis #01-02), Dr. Benjamin Grant has gathered together Gerald Petworth (Ice Storm), Kari James (Vibrant), Alexander Kyong (Streaks), Eloni "Aaron" Williams (Stampede), and Grayson Brooks (Flare) to find other individuals with special abilities, known as GEHMs, in order to protect them from exploitation or incarceration.

In the next arc, I Rise, members of the fledgling team are asked to recruit more GEHMs and instead find themselves caught in the last remnants of an old and secret war between Japan and China. Also in the arc, the Delta Squadron, the special paramilitary force of the Department of Homeland Security faces disbandment; tension rises among Team Genesis members; and an adversary from Grant's true past finally steps out of the shadows, and is prepared to challenge them all.Exclusive OfferI Rise is in full production and will only be available for digital download. FarCorners Studios, however, is offering its fans, a.k.a. GEHMs, and those who support the work of independent artists, an exclusive offer to purchase the printed single edition of Team Genesis #03: I Rise. story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello, my good people!
I am Maja and I am an illustrator/designer/cartoonist. I am passionate about my job, working in creative industries like ... forever, let's say I am pretty much a seasoned creative, working on a wide range of creative stuff for all sorts of clients. Without fake modesty, I am proud to say I am very good at my job. HOWEVER ...

Here you can leaf through my portfolio.

My dreams.
However, for a long time, I work on assignments for clients only.
There is freedom in this type of work, you get creative rewards,
but let's face it: freelancing as an artist today is not as financially
rewarding as one would wish.
Without finances, well, one cannot really develop, learn, live.
I have a dream though.
Making my own cartoon characters alive and get people engaged in my creations.
I have a bunch of them congregating in my head, buzzing around and knocking on
the insides of my skull. I have to have a plan for them. And goals.

The plan and goals.
My primary plan is to develop and establish an independent cartoon-illustration website, a home of a member-only weekly e-magazine, intended only for you, my future subscribers.

I will publish some free stuff on this website, so if you don't subscribe you are on free stuff diet, but If you subscribe, you receive your own copy of the weekly e-magazine, with a bunch of goodies thrown in.

The content of weekly e-magazine will have 4 sections:

1. A weekly cartoon / comic strip

2. An illustrated children book story, with leading female character
(1 chapter per magazine issue)

3. One illustrated coloring page

4. An illustrated puzzle

 

I have set a low $ goal with the clear intention it gets hit and exceeded, so this project can run on and raise funds indefinitely. First 28 days of crowdfunding this project is therefore very important, I sincerely count on you, my good people!

The goal of 1900 $ will cover:

  • the necessary expenses for the development of a proper cartoon-illustration website
  • design and printing of one t-shirt edition, with a release date October 2018
  • 3 issues of a weekly e-magazine, with a starting release date in January 2019
  • some advertising fees

If we break the initial goal of 1900 $ and it goes beyond 8000$, the project starts getting wings. Funds will cover:

  • heftier advertising budget
  • design and printing of second t-shirt edition
  • setting up and organizing an e-shop
  • at least another 6 issues of a weekly e-magazine
  • creation of a printed coloring book

If a goal goes well beyond 18.000$. Dream scenario! We will have:

  • big advertising budget
  • design and printing of another t-shirt edition
  • creation and printing of one children book
  • at least another 6 issues of a weekly e-magazine
  • design and printing of a children book
  • design and printing of a comic book

 

You will not leave empty-handed!
I will not allow my backers go empty-handed. All the perks will be fulfilled. My subscribers, even if it happens to be a small number of them will get what they paid for.

 

Thank you, thank you, thank you!
In the end, I wish to say this: There are no words to describe the gratitude, respect, and humility I feel for you, my backers and supporters! Your contribution will make a massive even vital difference for me.

 

Have a peek at my drawing board:

A character for a children story I wrote ... This sketch made some time ago actually made me start writing the story.

A sketch of a girl, a leading character in my children story.

 

 

Copyright © 2018 Maja B. Jančič, All rights reserved.

story:
Gore Shriek fans Rejoice!! This special issue is being designed just for you. This is the first ever Gore Shriek with interior color!! And then its being squarebound to boot!! Stories and art by Richard Bonk & son, Stephen R. Bissette, Paul Winter and Andrew and Gabriel Mangum.

Here is the cover to our very first issue published 31 years ago this month!!! The cover illustration was done by (the now) famous Special Makeup Effects artist Bruce Spaulding Fuller. Bruce has worked on many dozens of your favorite genre films and is now branching out to the Marvel films as well.
PLUS!! Included in this issue will be, for the first time, a complete story and art index to EVERY issue of Gore Shriek ever published along with FULL COLOR COVERS!! Even some of the most hardcore fans have never seen the cover of every issue.

Gore Shriek was nominated in four separate categories for the 2016 Ghastly Awards, and won for Best Cover - Cover B drawn by Putrid Matt Carr. We are so proud to have Matt recognized for his amazing art!

Gore Shriek has launched the careers of some of the most popular artists working today. Take Greg Capullo for just one  more example. Did you know that today's most popular Batman artist started right here in Gore Shriek? It's true!! Here is one of Greg's covers for Gore Shriek.....

This issue contains this cool art by Andrew and Gabriel Mangum.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need roughly $5000 in funding to pay the printer and more importantly to pay our artists!!. Because we have added color and square binding to this issue it is much more expensive than usual. So most of the funds will go there.

  • We have created the most award levels in our history for this campaign. There is a level for every type of reader, collector, store owner, wholesaler and distributor. And if you love original art - we have you covered too.

  • From this issue, a tribute to Bernie Wrightson by Andrew Mangum.

  • And now a few words about some subjects that every Kickstarter backer is familiar with:

    1. We will get your copies to you in MINT condition!! We have designed and produced super stiff mailing flats which will eliminate bent corners and edges. Expect to get pristine copies for your pledges!!

    2. We are going to try and ship this project EARLY. Yes, you read that correctly. Our intention is to get this great new comic to you BEFORE the announced date!!

    And one last thing before we turn this campaign over to YOU. Our artist Paul Winter produced a SECOND cover which was so good that we decided to run it as the back cover!!! ENJOY and THANK YOU for your support!!

  • And what if we EXCEED our goal? We will add more art and stories to the issue. And what if we MISS our goal? This issue will still come out with private financing by FantaCo.

  • We know we can reach and even exceed our goal if each of you let's your horror friends know about this special issue. Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to share on social media with your horror groups and pages.

  •  AND SOME LAST MINUTE THINGS~

    Both the front cover AND back cover of this issue are available RIGHT NOW on ultra high quality color T-shirts, tanks, hoodies and more for both men and women. Just go to:     https://teespring.com/licensed-gore-shriek-horr...

  •  

    The back of the newest, full color Gore Shriek T-shirt!

    The front of the newest, full color Gore Shriek T-shirt!

     SHIRT UPDATE: We placed an order just like a regular customer and were very impressed by both the speed and quality. Order with confidence. This company is really good!

    And don't forget to join thousands of other Gore Shriek fans by "liking" the Official Gore Shriek fan page on Facebook!! Just go to:     https://www.facebook.com/GoreShriekComic/

    Until next time - make mine GORE SHRIEK!!

    ~ Gore and Shriek

Risks and challenges

The covers are completely finished, the interior art is being done right now, the job has been booked at the printer and all systems are go. We are actually planning on shipping early. 
The only possible risk is if several people on the FantaCo staff get seriously ill - or die. Deaths definitely cause problems........

Gore Shriek is produced and published by FantaCo Enterprises. Gore Shriek and its distinctive logos are TM & © 1986-2017 by Tom Skulan. All rights reserved.  

            

The above art samples are from Richard Bonk and son's story. We can't show you too much because the story will shock and amaze you!! We don't want to give anything away!!

story:
Who is Suttyo?

I made the Suttyo comics in the middle school. These were traditional drawn comics. There was 10 booklets with a lot of stories in them, including parodies of movies as Terminator 2, Alien 2 and Robocop.

The first Suttyo Comic's cover from 1993.

 

How old is Suttyo?

I made the first Suttyo in the middle school in 1993. After the middle school I wrote a lot of scripts, including this sci-fi parody. I think these stories are very funny and I decided to make comic books from these scripts and I share all of these stories with all the world.

 

How long it takes?

When Suttyo will be done? I never made comic book like this. I finished some pages and some characters, I can calculate a deadline from these pages. I think three 3D artists can finish it in 3 months from the start.

A Large Hadron Collider's shaded view.

 

How many pages is this comic?

This story is in two comic books. The first is 24 pages the second is 36 pages. The full story is 60 pages.

Two characters from the story.

 

Who I need?

I need at least two 3d supervisor who could support my work. I need your help to I could finance two 3d supervisor and I could print my comic books in a real printing house. I have two familiar supervisor, they are reliable and very talented. We will  make this comic book in the Maya software.

A city's wireframe view.

City's rendered view.

A tank's wireframe's view.

 

What language is Suttyo?

 I will make it in two languages: English and Hungarian, of course you will get the English version. Some supporters get Hungarian language, too, see it in the perks list.

Two completed pages from the Suttyo comic.

 

    Suttyo perks:

    Every Indiegogo campaign has perks. Every contributors get back some ecxiting things for their support. I made eight perks, these perks contains the following things:

    • Suttyo 1-2 PDF version (this is in all perks)
    • Suttyo 1-2 printed version (this is in 4 perks)
    • Suttyo 1-2 printed and dedicated version (this is in 3 perks)
    • Suttyo 1-2 printed Hungarian version (this is in 2 perks)
    • Many 4k wallpapers. You can choose few (7-40 pieces) 4k wallpaper from a gallery. Its number depending on your perk. (this is in 7 perks)
    • Your name is in the comic. There a scene in this comic where appears a big screen full with the leaders of world. Your name could be there. (this is in 5 perks)
    • Realtime inspection of the production's XLS. However I will inform the contributors about my comic's status weekly. There is a detailed XLS with every props and every characters. I will sharing this XLS on the web with contributors.(this is in 2 perks)
    • You could be a concrete leader in the leaders list. For example The president of USA, government of Texas, a famous rockstar or what you want to be. The oppurtiny of choose is on arrival time, so the first supporter can choose first a rank, then the second supporter etc. (this is in 1 perk)

    Choose a perk wisely!

     

    The Leaders of the World screen. This is a 2 pages image in the comic book. This is a draft, the finally picture depending on the number of the names.

     

    Our heroes are reading the script before the shooting.

     

    What is the age rating?

    There is no any blood, violence, swearword and there is no explicit sexual activity in this comic book. There is a little nudity in some Suttyo story. This story contains some nudity. So this Comic's age rating is 17+.

     

    What's next?

    After I make this comic book, I will continue the making Suttyo comics. I have few dozen story of Suttyo. These stories similar like the Big Bang Theory, Friends and other sitcoms. So, I will choose from these stories.

    I have some other style stories, too:

    • an X-Files parody
    • parody based on Star Wars universe
    • a cosplay story
    • Christmas story (of course)
    • and a long long Pirates story in a fantasy world

     

    A happy moment in our friends' flat.

story:
Who are the Dementorbusters and where did they come from?

After Voldemort was defeated, the wizarding world thought they were safe.  However, dementor attacks are on the rise and no one really seems to notice except a select few.  Cassie, an auror from the Ministry of Magic, is tasked with getting the dementors back under control.  It's a rough job, but somebody has to do it!  And it isn't easy...the attacks are becoming more frequent and widely spread out...but are they as random as they seem?  Cassie knows she needs help.  'Expecto Patronum' just isn't cutting it!  It does nothing to help capture or control the dementors and time is running out!  Mr. Weasley, being obsessed with Muggles, hears of a team from New York City who calls themselves the Ghostbusters.  He learns of their cutting edge technology that allows them to trap ghostly and spectral beings.  Needless to say, he was more than intrigued.  Mr. Weasley contacts Egon Spengler and explains the situation and his dire need for his help.  Thus, 'Weasley Spengler Enterprises' is born!  Putting their heads together, they are able to combine magic and nuclear energy to create a whole new pack that will allow 'Expecto Patronum' to transform.  Now the spell can be used to capture a dementor instead of simply expelling it!  Now, Cassie can start to really make a difference.  But...there's a catch...Cassie is a wizard and completely unfamiliar and untrained when it comes to nuclear energy.  She is forced to take on a partner.  Someone from another world.  Someone inexperienced in the ways of magic.  Someone...who is a Muggle.  Kreg, a resident NYC Ghostbuster, is tasked with the job of teaching nuclear tech to Cassie; however he will learn a lot in the process as well and a partnership blossoms.  This unlikely duo must band together and become the first ever DEMENTORBUSTERS!

 

Why should you contribute?

Through this collaborative effort, the Dementorbusters have been delighting con goers for the past 2 years!  We found that as much as people loved the look of our cosplay, what really drew them in was the back story.  They loved the concept, well thought out history and believable canon story line.  The story was truly the driving force behind this project!  We just wanted to be able to bring more subject matter and more substance to our fans!  With a motion web comic, we will be able to do just that!  The sky is the limit when it comes to plot, action and adventure!  You will be helping expand an ever growing universe!  By helping us, you are helping shape a whole new world where two fandoms collide!  You get to be a part of fan made history!  

 

What We Need & What You Get

To start off with, we are looking to raise $10,000 to get the project off the floor and running.  Your contribution will help us pay our artist, editor, and production crew as well as help create and distribute marketing and merchandise.  But we haven't forgotten about you!  By helping us, you can receive some really awesome swag!  From stickers, pins, shirts, and hats to a personal video message from the Dementorbusters!  Heck, you can even be IN the comic...yes, that's right...IN the comic.  How cool is that?!  There's a lot we have to offer, so make sure you check out all of our levels and see what you like best.

 

History

The Dementorbusters have won "Best Original Cosplay" at Hudson Valley Comic Con and "Best Couple" at the Nyack Halloween Parade and more!  We just want to share our amazing story with the world!

 

What's the big deal?

It isn't easy taking on a project like this.  There is a lot of collaborative effort that makes something like this come together.  This is why we have found an absolutely amazing team that shares our drive, our passion and our excitement for this project.  When you are truly passionate about something, you can make it happen.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

As much as we would love everyone to donate, we understand that for some, this might not be possible.  But that doesn't mean you can't help!  Become our cheerleaders and digital street team by sharing our page and getting the word out to your friends, family, coworkers and anyone who will listen!

story:
The Dude Vol #1

By Gianluca T Burdon

The Dude is a series about a mercenary martial artist hailed as one of the worlds most beloved "heroes" who unbeknownst to everyone else is actually just a 16 year old boy trying to earn money for his mom's medical treatments. But as evil forces grow and unite, he finds himself having to step up beyond his initial goals and truly become the hero everyone believes him to be across this exciting Trilogy Series. All while an incredibly busty reporter seeks to uncover the truth about him

The Dude Vol #1 is the 1st of a 3 Volume Action-Adventure Series, each containing 5 Chapters, with roughly 30 Pages of Story per Chapter

Page 2 (Colored) - Art by Jes Villa

Page 3 (Inked) - Art by Jes Villa

Page 4 (Inked) - Art by Jes Villa

Characters

The Dude/Joseph Crouse

Concept Art by Jes Villa

Joseph is just a kid with a simple desire, to save his Mom. Though unfortunately, her medical treatments cost an arm & a leg, and that's not even getting into the funds required to secure her transplant. There's no way an average kid could even put a dent in the expenses, but then again your average kid can't run over 100 miles per hour, survive 100,000 ft drops & throw giant boulders over the horizon (roughly 3 miles)

Thus he took up Mercenary work at just 14 years old, travelling all over the world while telling his parents that he had an internship with a Travel Agency. And after stopping a Terrorist Attack on the UN, his alter ego became World famous and became known as The Dude

 

Sally Faye

Concept Art by Jes Villa

Did you take one look at Sally and instantly thought "BOOBS!!!"? Well then, you're in trouble. Why? Cause while you were staring at her Tits, she was grilling you for information, which you then unknowingly gave her. But don't feel too bad, Sally in an incredibly attractive woman: Girls share your desire to stare at her Boobs, Gay Guys have gone Straight for her & she even gives the Impotent erections

But due to her Beauty, most fail to realize her Intelligence until it's too late, and she has fully exploited that in her career as a Reporter, but even then she knows she can't afford to be a one-trick pony, even if it's an extremely effective trick. Thus even if you've gotten used to her ample bosom, you best keep your guard up, or she'll dig up anything you're trying to hide as though it was low-hanging fruit

If Sally has any blind spots, it would be her fangirl crush on The Dude, whom she's actually met a few times. Not that he's aware of it

 

Agent Alex Rivers

Concept Art by Jes Villa

Smart, Sexy, Calm, Serious... and rather Friendly. Alex is a top FBI Agent and the closet friend The Dude has on the force. A dedicated agent who gets all the info The Dude needs to take down the Target and seek to complete her missions with maximum efficiency.

Though she does have another side to her, a loving wife and devote mother who'd do anything to put a smile on her Son's face

 

Asnee

Concept Art by Jes Villa

Joseph's Kru (Thai for Master/Teacher/Instructor) who taught The Dude everything he knows about fighting. He is old, wise & powerful, though if you spent two minutes with you'd realize that he's a pretty chill guy

He helped Joseph get into the Mercenary gig and has years of wisdom & experience to offer. Though unlike most Masters, he's direct in his teaching, instruction & advice.

 

Gerulf Klingemann

Concept Art by Jes Villa

You see this frail old man? Well, if he's not paying you to be around him, then FOR THE LOVE OF GOD, RUN!!!! He's going to kill you for trespassing, and if he thinks that experimenting on you will benefit him, he'll cut you up. This man was Karl Gebhardt's top student and he still proud to openly admit that to this very day!

So what? I hear you say. You're a reasonably fit guy, maybe you've got some combat training and a gun. Your best bet is still to run, Gerulf's guarded by armed mercenaries and giant robots 24/7, he doesn't go anywhere unless he's 100% certain that not only is he safe, but is capable of instantly killing anyone who dares threaten him

You won't even get a Villainous Monologue out of him unless he truly believes that you are cornered, on the verge of death & have no way to contact the outside world

In short: If you're within 100 miles of him, do yourself a favour and get outta there

 

The Combattants Trios/Richard Tynan, William Reinertsen & Gabriel Couture

Concept Art by Jes Villa

An Irishman, a Frenchman & a Scandinavian walk into a room

Sounds like the opening to a joke, right. Well, what if I were to tell you that each one of them was the Master of a different Martial Art and they could kill you with ease if they so wanted. Still waiting for the Punchline?

But don't worry, they're not going to do that. Well, maybe Gab would if you pissed him off. These guys work together as the Elite Interpol Team: The Combattants Trios (The Fighters Three)

First there's Richard, the oldest & the leader, a rather friend fellow well known for been calm and patient in any situation, with his trusty Ironwood Cane by his side, he's a Master of Bataireacht (Irish Stick Fighting)

Next we have William, easily the nicest guy you'll ever meet, but watch out, he knows Glima, a wrestling form invented by the Vikings, and isn't afraid to fight dirty

Finally we come to Gabriel, resident Hothead and Master of Savate

 

Vihaan Acharya

Concept Art by Jes Villa

Wealth, Fame & Power. As one of the World's Top Yoga Guru's, Vihaan has all of this... Or at least he did until he created a new Martial Art: Yogan, which combines the principles of Yoga with Gymnastics & Kung Fu.

Disgraced & Shunned after been accused of promoting Violence, Vihaan has turned to a life of Crime in order to not only regain the luxuries he once had, but also to gain newfound glory and prove his new Art to the World.

Vihaan has no doubt he can succeed in his goals, and wherever he goes he rubs his superiority in the face of whoever will listen. With his movements unpredictable and his strikes deadly, his fighting only goes to back up this attitude

Campaign Rewards

Follow The Dude - 34 USD

Get A Physical Copy of The Dude Vol. #1

Get Something Extra... - 51 USD

Get a Physical Copy of The Dude Vol. #1 & a Sexy Poster of Sally Faye

Join The Dude - 67 USD

Get Previous Perks and appear in Chapter 5. Boys get to be Interpol Agents, Ladies will be Spa Girls 

So you admire The Dude... - 84 USD

Get the Previous Perks and you get to become a recurring Background Character in future Volumes of The Dude

Swear Loyalty to The Dude - 101 USD

 Get a Physical Copy of The Dude Vol #1, a Sexy Poster of Sally Faye & get Automatically listed to have the entire Trilogy shipped to you as each part is completed

Hire The Dude - 118 USD

Get a Physical Copy of The Dude Vol #1, a Sexy Poster of Sally Faye & get a Variant Cover of your own design (Anything outright NSFW will be rejected)

Image of the Pin-Up Poster. Art by OzumaRyu

About Me

Honestly, I'm just your Average Guy. I get by day-to-day and have a part time job. If there's anything truly interesting about me, it's my love for stories and my overexcited imagination constantly buzzing ablaze creating new ones. And I have turned that into a Dream, to share my stories and bring joy to people, just like so many others work have entertained people like they have me.

And to do that, I have been inspired to create my own Brand, to craft an new universe filled with Wonder & Adventure, where almost anything is possible. Thus I have founded Noble Comics, with this story been but the first to come in the many I have imagined for the NobleVerse.

I genuinely hope it puts a smile on your face, and fills your heart with joy, all while inspiring a new Generation of Writers & Artists. Thank You!

story:
Story:

Crush: First Love, New Talent is a comics anthology devoted to stories of first love told from a variety of LGBTQAIU perspectives. This book features 24 stories about first dates, sneaky feelings, awkward moments, flights of fancy, and the kind of self-discovery that only queer romance can deliver.  Crush will be co-edited by Tara Madison Avery (We're Still Here, ALPHABET, The Transgender Heroes Coloring Book) and Viktor Kerney (Strangelore, Prism Comics), and the book will feature over 200 pages of all-new comics content. Crush will be published by Stacked Deck Press, a publishing house focused on comics and coloring books of queer interest.

In order to get out the word about Crush to aficionados of queer comics, Stacked Deck Press will be working with Prism Comics, the City of West Hollywood, and Crush contributor and pop culture journalist Mike Ciriaco (Stonewall Prep, WeHo News) to promote this very special book. With the help of Prism, we've conducted a talent search for new crop of queer cartoonists, artists, and writers just starting their careers. In particular, we've made a special effort to reach out to creators of emerging identities: asexual, genderqueer, aromantic, polyamorous, and more. The City of West Hollywood will be providing us with a book launch party in the City Council Room at the West Hollywood Public Library as part of their 2020 Pride celebration, where contributors to the book will read their stories from the book.

Crush will feature stories from these creators:

  • Jaime Aguilar
  • AmyEYE
  • atelierMuse
  • Tate Brombal and V. Gagnon
  • Caroline Cao and Marie Wu
  • Mylo Choy
  • Mike Ciriaco and Terry Blas
  • Caterina Gerbasi and Bea Gomez Casal
  • Rachel Gorman
  • Katya Granger
  • Hayden Harwood
  • Mei Lian Hoe
  • Skylar Kardon
  • E.J. Oakley
  • Can Richards
  • Max Spragovsky
  • Daniel Stalter and Eleanora Kortsarz
  • Ravi Teixeira
  • Twolle and Lyn Straine
  • Stefani Vlusha
  • Letty Wilson
  • Cin Woodworth and Hendrick Kneeland
  • Priscilla Wu and Teloka Berry
  • Potassium Wisteria

The stories include tales about a Virtual Rock Star who has a robotic body built to pursue the woman of their dreams, a hesitant "Third Wheel" being accepted into a polyamorous relationship, an 18th Century "Lady" whose lover rightly accepts him as a lord, and a Master Craftswoman whose Queen desires more from her than just a new means of transportation!

First love is tricky enough when you're straight, but downright confounding when you're on the LGBTQAIU spectrum. Whether you're an ace discovering that loving a person doesn't have to include sex, a young man having that first relationship with an older gentleman that changes the direction of your life, or an aromantic demon finding a surprising exception to his fun-only rule, Crush tells stories that ring true to queer experience.

Budget and stretch goals:


Our budget includes funds for printing, manufacturing the backer rewards, shipping, crowdfunding fees, and most importantly creator compensation. This is the first time most of our contributing creators will have their work in print, and we want to make sure that they get used to receiving a paycheck as they launch their careers in comics.

Budget

  • Printing: $7,000.00
  • Creator compensation: $5,500.00
  • Crowdfunding and credit card fees: $1,700.00
  • Shipping and postage: $1,000.00
  • Rewards cost: $1,000.00
  • Miscellaneous: $500.00

        Total: $16,700.00

Our main and only stretch goal will be increasing creator compensation once we have met our initial goal! 
 

Backer Rewards:

  •  Digital edition of Crush: First Love, New Talent 
  •  Print edition of Crush: First Love, New Talent 
  •  Tote bag featuring an all-new design by a Crush contributor
  •  Sticker set featuring samples of artwork from the book
  •  Coloring books from the Stacked Deck Press series of historical LBGTQ coloring books
  •  Original sketches from Crush contributors

 Print edition of Crush: First Love, New Talent 
 Tote bag featuring an all-new design by a Crush contributor
 Sticker set featuring samples of artwork from the book
 Coloring books from the Stacked Deck Press series of historical LBGTQ coloring books
 Original sketches from Crush contributors

story:
Short Summary

my name is Michael D. Hall. I also go by SPECSWIZARD. I've written and drawn comics for almost 40 years. I also write and produce Hip Hop music.

I am campaigning to raise funds to print a graphic novel called ACHIEVER Takes Down The MAN. ACHIEVER is a character I created while working at Zanadu Comics 20 years ago. from a young age my dream was to someday publish my own comic titles. I'm ready to share my ideas with the world.

I am hoping to consistently release comics and build a following. I hope to learn from the experience and eventually solidify a place amongst the greater self publishing community.

What We Need & What You Get

the $5,000.00 I'm trying to raise will go to printing a 4 issue series and a graphic novel.

contributors of up to $30 will receive the four issue series. $60 and up contributors will receive the 4 issue series, the collected edition TPB and exclusive signed limited edition prints and tee shirts. 

if I do not reach my goal, the funds will still go to printing the book.

The Impact

this project is important to me. it is refreshing take on an old theme. I feel like the comic industry lacks diversity. I would love to help change that by self publishing and telling stories.

I have self published 2 other titles: Mux Adapter 2007 and The Gibson Comic Anthology 2019. I've also contributed to an anthology called Healthy Bunch issues #1-3

my goal is to ramp up production and publish as many books as I can in the coming years. YOU can help get me started. the character ACHIEVER is a metaphor for my life and dreams. dreams that have existed since I was 7 years of age.

Risks & Challenges

I have put many years into this dream. I feel like I am finally ready to share my vision with the world. I have been discouraged  for decades. afraid to fail. but I've never stopped writing and drawing. all that practice has given me some confidence.

I feel like if I remain consistent and productive, I can finally begin to see some results.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

for those that can't contribute, you can help by spreading the word.

you can use the Indiegogo share tools. thank you all for supporting my dream!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Do you enjoy over the top, rocket fueled fun and excitement in your sci-fi adventure stories?

 

SAVAGE SASQUANAUT features the legendary Bigfoot lost in space as he carjacks star ships, arm wrestles aliens, hoodwinks an empire, and bends the cosmos to his will, searching for home.

 

SAVAGE SASQUANAUT is a fish out of water story about the legendary Bigfoot who was part of a NASA experiment when a freak accident lost him in space! 

The series features over-the-top, action-packed, sci-fi adventures with stunning visuals, humor, intrigue, love and betrayal brought to life by award winning colorist and creator WES HARTMAN and illustrator GAB SANTOS and letterer MCLAIN MCGUIRE. 

 

 

 

HERE'S A BRIEF RUNDOWN OF WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW IF YOU'RE JUST GETTING STARTED WITH THE SERIES.

 

 

WHAT'S HAPPENING IN ISSUE FOUR?

Traveling through the depths of space, Sasquanaut awakens to find himself back on Earth!  

As the days and years go by, he slowly realizes this is not his world, and this is not his forest throne.  Yeah, he has a forest throne!?!?!

And so he asks himself, "How did I get here!?" and before he can consider this too deeply, a mysterious woman appears and offers him anything and everything he can dream of!  

Will Sasquanaut fall under her spell and surrender his will to her whims, or will he realize his deepest desires and set himself free? 

Are you a fan of STAR TREK, FIREFLY, FARSCAPE, and BUCK ROGERS?  Can you imagine if Jack Burton from BIG TROUBLE IN LITTLE CHINA  replaced Luke Skywalker in STAR WARS?  

If you can, then you may have an idea of what you're going to get from the SAVAGE SASQUANAUT!  

  • People who love Star Wars, Star Trek, Firefly, and Farscape.
  • Fans of Conan the Barbarian (especially if you ever wished he went into space).
  • Fans of Big Trouble in Little China (Bigfoot is Jack Burton!)
  • Bigfoot enthusiasts.
  • Fans of action, humor, and stunning artwork!
  • Collectors of high quality independent comic books from a long time industry veteran and a phenomenal brand new talent.
  • People who love to read awesome stories about larger than life characters

 

 

WHAT EXACTLY DO YOU GET WHEN FLYING THE COSMOS WITH SASQUANAUT AND COMPANY?

SS#4 contains 24 story pages

SS#4 has 3 limited Variant Covers available, featuring art from Gab Santos, Craig Babiar (writer/artist of Warrior Nun - now a Netflix original series), and Jordan Gunderson (Aspen Comics Fathom, Soulfire, Dissension, and more). Choose one or collect them all!

  • Cover A (by Gab Santos) is the fourth part of a 6 part collectible cover mega poster image
  • My experience with IndieGoGo is limited, and working the interface to build the campaign has been a bit of a struggle.  I have attempted to make the choice of variant cover as part of the "OPTIONS" in the perks.  I hope this works as I believe it should, otherwise there could be some confusion and difficulty.

  • All printed copies are in standard American comic size and printed in the United States.
  • All backers will also receive the Savage Sasquanaut #4 Digital PDF copy
  • There is also the Savage Sasquanaut #4 ARTIST EDITION Digital PDF copy
  • For the first time since issue 1 campaign, print copies of the ARTIST EDITIONS are being offered for issues 1-4, and the sold out issue 1 is being reprinted with an all new cover.
  • All new merchandise is being offered including a brand new limited edition exclusive 3.5" patch (limited to 100)!
  • Set of LIMITED EDITION STICKERS
  • Also available are full color illustrated sketch card by Sasquanaut series creator Wes Hartman, featuring characters from Savage Sasquanaut and some pop culture fan favorites
  • Choose your design on the limited edition custom printed SAVAGE SASQUANAUT skateboard deck
  • ONE OF A KIND piece of ORIGINAL ARTWORK penciled and inked by CRAIG BABIAR, Sasquanaut cover artist and former writer/artist of Warrion Nun (now a Netflix Series).  Features the Sasquanaut character, the creepy bounty hunter CRIMSON HOMBRE!

 

 

WES HARTMAN - creator of Savage Sasquanaut, is an award winning comic book colorist (BD Price Audience Award 2010 for best color), and a small press comic book creator and editor and creator of the Sasquanaut comic. He has spent the last 15+ years working with the biggest and best talent at Marvel, DC, Dark Horse, Aspen, Dynamite, etc. and has had his work featured in TV, film, and video games.  Some of his previous creations and credits include Moon Streak, Sky Sharks, Gears & Bones, Pirates vs. Ninjas, and more.

 

GAB SANTOS -  “Gabouwness” is an Illustrator and Character Concept Artist who was born and raised in Manila, Philippines.  Gab usually does character designs, cover illustrations, but sometimes he also does fan art, comics, and even card games.  He really loves to read comics, play classic video games.  He is fond of making robot designs and mechanical/sci-fi/fantasy/apocalyptic themed illustrations because he finds it cool to draw what the world would look like in the future. He says that art is what he loves to do and that is why he works hard to improve, not only for himself, for the people that love and support him every day.

 

MCLAIN MCGUIRE -  lives in the Austin, Texas area where he can be found in his studio creating, lettering, and designing comics and working on other graphics. McLain is happily married with two amazing kids and two crazy dogs. He is an established musician and has been in the music industry for over twenty seven years as well as working in the comic industry for over thirteen years. McLain takes every opportunity he can to work on Indy and Professional Comics to show his continuous support in the industry as well as give his own creativity. He’s worked on many titles such as Cavewoman, Razors Run, and Metal Edge by Basement Studios/ Amry Dark Entertainment. CCP Comics Super Crazy Animal Hand, The Other, Dead Robot, SYSTiM, Electron Boy, Father Faust, Lady Khimera, Clean up, and more. McLain can also be credited for his lettering and designs in the two hit titles from Short Fuse Studios, The Defectives (On-going series currently on issue 4.) and Morbid Musings. He is also working as an artist, letterer, designer, project manager, and partner with 4 Leaf Comics on titles The Forgotten Isle mini-series, Churchill Manor, Don’t Pay The Ferryman mini-series, and The Mortician. McLain gives his absolute best in everything he works on. When McLain is not in the studio working on comics he’s a stay at home dad seven days a week. McLain is credited in the comic industry as a letterer and designer for Indy and major Publishers for over forty titles streaming.

 

 

Wes says:

"I've written for, and created several titles, as well as edited for most of my nearly 20 year comic career, but for the most part I'm viewed as "just a colorist." 

While I'm extremely proud of my role, and the work as a colorist and the many opportunities I've been granted because of it, there is so much more that I am striving for. 

So with Sasquanaut and my comic imprint Cosmic Roots Studio, I am investing in myself as a creator (with your help) to cut my own path through the jungle and prove to myself and the rest of the world that I am more than "just a colorist."

And with THIS story I feel UNLIMITED. 

Sasquanaut needed to be much more flexible in a way that my previous stories were not. Sasquanaut allows me to seamlessly crisscross genres at the turn of a page and never feels out of place, as long as the reader can accepts that Bigfoot is flying through space, which is no more absurd than Teenage Mutant Ninja Turles.

Sasquanaut's  zany adventures in space keeps me, and hopefully YOU dear reader, entertained and always guessing what comes next."

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Crowd funding has proven to be an amazing venue for getting new creative ideas that could potentially never be realized without you and the Indiegogo and Kickstarter platforms.  

Crowd funding is an amazing opportunity for YOU, the fans, to directly engage with a creator in a way that has never been available before.  

You have the power to make the products you want come to life.

YOU get to decide that. You decide what products we offer are worth your hard earned money, and that is a privilege that I do not take for granted.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The first three issues have already been successfully crowd funded on Kickstarter and have been printed. 

I realize that not everyone wants to use Kickstarter, and IndieGoGo is a market I hope to connect with in addition to the one that is growing on Kickstarter.  

In the immortal words of my friend Billy Tucci, "No fan left behind" and that's why I've come to be a part of the IGG community. All the funds of the campaign will go towards helping me print the issue and any additional money raised will go towards production of the remaining 2 issues of the series.

 

Do you have a comic or book and your line art needs some high quality professional colors to bring your vision to life?  

Maybe you have an amazing commission from your favorite artist and would like to have a one of a kind full color print made.  

With the YOUR ART COLORED reward tier,  Wes Hartman (me), an award winning colorist who has worked with many of the biggest and best artists for Marvel, DC, Dark Horse, Aspen, and more, will transform your black and white art into a fully realized color creation!

Don't delay, this tier is extremely limited!

Check out these videos for examples of DIGITAL COLORING and what I can potentially do for you!

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

The Impact

For almost 20 years I have worked in the comics industry as a freelance colorist, an editor, writer and creator.  Most of that time has been spent freelance coloring and helping make your favorite comics come out each and every month, and occasionally getting to do a project for myself.

Honesty, I'm tired of spending my best energy and time helping to create and make other people's dreams come true or helping whichever corporation to meet a bottom line.  When I do get to create comics on my own, I am met with critical praise if not big sale numbers.

Here's some of what people are saying about Savage Sasquanaut:W

 

 

 

 

WHY? 

I'll be completely candid.  Every comic I've written and/or created in the traditional comic industry has never paid me.  I've made this book with my own $$$, hiring the best I artist for the job, and having some incredible friends work with me to create some epic variant covers.

With IGG and KS, I can do the work and make the absolute best comics and interact with you, the fan, on a one on one basis to meet and exceed your expectations, and maybe make back some of the money I've spent and invest in new projects that will come after Sasquanaut.

So far I have run 3 successful campaigns on Kickstarter, and one less successful followup campaign on IGG.  

My campaigns were funded, produced, and delivered to customers EARLIER than promised.

I accomplish this by having the book 100% complete before I even launch the campaign, so you know that your money will go directly into printing and production, and not leave you wondering where your book is for months or years as SOME creators do.

There is NO RISK that the books won't come out because they are done.

But lets be real. 

COVID-19 has messed up everything. There are potential lingering effects of the global pandemic that might influence the production schedule.

Because of that, I have planned some extra time into my production and fulfillment schedule to account for any potential backlog or delays at the printer.  The printer has been closed or operating in a limited capacity like most other businesses in the country, so that's the only real potential delay.

There is a very good chance that everything will proceed as it regularly would prior to the COVID-19 crisis, and if that's the case, fulfillment should be done faster than scheduled. 

I pride myself on my communication and professionalism, and your trust in me is not taken lightly.  You can easily find my past two campaigns and see I have made regular updates detailing the status and progress on every step of the campaign.

And I'm taking it even further this time.  Every Tuesday night, join me on Twitch as I continue to produce and create Sasquanaut right before you eyes one page at a time.  Join the conversation about the creative process and ask any questions on how to make a comic and know without a doubt that your money is being put to work. 

 

 

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

As a crowd funding supporter myself, I know what it means to give your hard earned money to new and unknown projects.

I have made every effort to minimize the risk to you, the backer.  

This includes having the issue 100% completed before you even see this page.  

At my own expense I have paid and received ALL the art from Gab Santos for the entire 6 issues of volume 1.

This campaign is full of merchandise and original art that is already completed and of the absolute highest quality, as well as being ready to ship to make the fulfillment process as brief and efficient as possible.

When the campaign successfully ends, with your help, the files will be loaded to the printer when the funding comes in, digital rewards can be sent upon receiving completed surveys, and coloring and lettering can continue on all remaining issues.

Issues 1, 2, and 3 Kickstarter campaigns and fulfillment went as smoothly as I could possibly hope for, and so far I have received universal praise on the quality and timeliness of the projects. That's not to say I didn't learn a few things that I believe will better assist in completing and shipping all rewards to everyone.

I love this book and I want everyone who takes part of this campaign to love this book as much as I and have a completely satisfied experience on Kickstarter with me and Gab. 

My experience with IndieGoGo is limited, and working the interface to build the campaign has been a bit of a struggle.  I have attempted to make the choice of variant cover as part of the "OPTIONS" in the perks.  I hope this works as I believe it should, otherwise there could be some confusion and difficulty.

If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to message me and I will do my absolute best to make this project as rewarding as possible.

Thank you for your time and your support!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word and make some noise about this campaign
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

THANK YOU!  Thank you for checking out my project.  You being here and showing interest in something that I have spent several years putting together and out into the world  means the world to me.  You are making my dreams come true and I cannot express how much this means.

We are in an amazing new golden age for independent and self published comics, and it is driven by  wonderful people like you who support passion projects, like this one.  Again thank you.

Volume 1 of Savage Sasquanaut is 6 issues long. Issues 1 - 3 have been met with universal praise, and I've worked relentlessly seek to create comics of impeccable quality for your enjoyment. 

This series is the beginning of what I hope will be so much more, and I cannot wait to share them all with you.  This is happening because of you, thank you.

Also thanks to the Envato Marketplace for allowing me to purchase the right to use such a dope song and the killer stock footage. Also thanks to Fiverr.com for hooking up the Cosmic Roots Studio logo animation.

PLEASE review the different REWARD PACKAGES and SELECT the one you like, and complete your pre-order for the best new sci-fi hero you've never heard of.
