story:
Addon Perk

add the CODED T shirt when you checkout!

 

Technological advancements are the cornerstone of our society. They shape who we are and give us the opportunity to enhance our natural bodies. Sometimes, though, it seems our natural bodies may be better off left alone. When left in the hands of well meaning scientists, the decisions concerning when to stop pushing the limits of biotechnology can waver, with fatal side effects. 

 

Lucid Technologies, a leading firm meant to design some of the latest and greatest technological pieces for human use, had a plan to revolutionize mankind. They were to launch an inter-brainstem implant, known as the SEED Implant, that would connect smart devices directly to their human users and make it easier than ever to monitor health, collect information, and retain data and memories. As something that could forever alter the course of humanity, the general population of the world waited with baited breath to see the outcome and get their hands on this incredible, revolutionary piece of tech. 

 

Sometimes, though, things are not what they seem. Following a well-planned bioterrorist measure, the SEED Implant turned on its users, resulting in a sudden, painful event that destroyed the brains of millions of users worldwide in mere seconds. The tainted Implant then reactivated the brain, resulting in flesh hungry, insatiable undead monsters rising from what was once normal humans. These creatures attacked those without the implant, tearing them apart. The few survivors were then left behind to pick up the pieces and fight to remain alive despite the mass of semi-undead waiting around every corner. 

 

Will anyone be able to survive this man made apocalypse or is humanity doomed to die at the hands of their own creation?







 


As an emerging entity, Nukem Comics is a collaborative effort looking to create interesting comic serieses featuring fresh, new ideas. We started as a group of three friends just spinning ideas and dreaming of creating and now have gained footing and traction to work towards our ultimate goal of producing the kind of comics you can spend hours flipping through on your bedroom floor. 

Brothers George and Ron Dagan paired up with their longtime friend Randy Amoroso to begin this creative process. The trio aspire to produce something truly special, starting with their flagship piece: Intergalactic Deathmatch, a battle gauntlet story featuring gore, gross out humor, and throwback references tying together multiple genres in a new, niche style of comic creativity. 

Join Nukem Comics as they push forward with a new creative direction and experience the bloodlust and greed of the Overlord and his Intergalactic Deathmatch arenas as he pits his gladiators against one another in search of the galaxy’s greatest warrior!

 Aside from Intergalactic Deathmatch, Nukem Comics has many other projects in the works so keep your eyes peeled for other ventures that may soon appear on the production horizon! As avenue that welcomes creators with interesting ideas, Nukem Comics stands as a collaborative space. We want to help others bring their ideas to life and are entirely open to proposals andcreative input for new project ideas!

Now with our new graphic novel CODED we are pushing a brand new take on the zombie genre. Come see the horror unfolds in this zombie apocalypse story!

Artists

Pencil Artist

Rodel Noora

Inker/Colorist

 

Alzir Alves, lives in Brazil, founder of the school of visual arts Rascunho Studio, as well as a comic book artist and colorist, he also works as an art teacher. For over 15 years he has been working with comics and books. He went through several projects and publishers such as: Red Dragon Publisher, Grafset Publishers, Jester Press Comics, Monarch Comics, Big Dog Ink, Phl Interferon Sourse, Silver Fox Comics, Upper Deck Company in the production of Cards for Marvel Comics, Guará Entertainment, Jezebel, Carbon, Mirage Water Chaos, 2nd Coming Comix, TAFU, World of Superheroes, NeS publisher, Jambô publishers, Pooblicão and TimBerwolf Entertainment.

Alzir has a known career in Brazil and other countries. Currently, the artist is on the Nukem Comics project.

 

Co-Writer

Taylor Smith is a freelance content writer with close to a decade of experience. As part of the Nukem Comics team, she assists in stitching together the storyline and forming dialogue to bring the badass stories to life.

Lettering

 LetterSquids is a comic letterer and graphic designer based in Connecticut. They have projects with Scout Comics, Action Lab, Advent Comics, Insight Editions and tons of amazing indie creators.

LetterSquids is a comic letterer and graphic designer based in Connecticut. They have projects with Scout Comics, Action Lab, Advent Comics, Insight Editions and tons of amazing indie creators.​

Why Support Us?

With your support here on Indiegogo, we can achieve the Graphic Novel that CODED should be. We want this project to be incredible and every little bit helps. Plus, you will be kickass in doing so!

Thank You!

None of this would be possible without all of our supporters. We thank you from the bottom of our hearts.​
story_txt: Addon Perkadd the CODED T shirt when you checkout! Technological advancements are the cornerstone of our society. They shape who we are and give us the opportunity to enhance our natural bodies. Sometimes, though, it seems our natural bodies may be better off left alone. When left in the hands of well meaning scientists, the decisions concerning when to stop pushing the limits of biotechnology can waver, with fatal side effects.  Lucid Technologies, a leading firm meant to design some of the latest and greatest technological pieces for human use, had a plan to revolutionize mankind. They were to launch an inter-brainstem implant, known as the SEED Implant, that would connect smart devices directly to their human users and make it easier than ever to monitor health, collect information, and retain data and memories. As something that could forever alter the course of humanity, the general population of the world waited with baited breath to see the outcome and get their hands on this incredible, revolutionary piece of tech.  Sometimes, though, things are not what they seem. Following a well-planned bioterrorist measure, the SEED Implant turned on its users, resulting in a sudden, painful event that destroyed the brains of millions of users worldwide in mere seconds. The tainted Implant then reactivated the brain, resulting in flesh hungry, insatiable undead monsters rising from what was once normal humans. These creatures attacked those without the implant, tearing them apart. The few survivors were then left behind to pick up the pieces and fight to remain alive despite the mass of semi-undead waiting around every corner.  Will anyone be able to survive this man made apocalypse or is humanity doomed to die at the hands of their own creation? As an emerging entity, Nukem Comics is a collaborative effort looking to create interesting comic serieses featuring fresh, new ideas. We started as a group of three friends just spinning ideas and dreaming of creating and now have gained footing and traction to work towards our ultimate goal of producing the kind of comics you can spend hours flipping through on your bedroom floor. Brothers George and Ron Dagan paired up with their longtime friend Randy Amoroso to begin this creative process. The trio aspire to produce something truly special, starting with their flagship piece: Intergalactic Deathmatch, a battle gauntlet story featuring gore, gross out humor, and throwback references tying together multiple genres in a new, niche style of comic creativity. Join Nukem Comics as they push forward with a new creative direction and experience the bloodlust and greed of the Overlord and his Intergalactic Deathmatch arenas as he pits his gladiators against one another in search of the galaxy’s greatest warrior! Aside from Intergalactic Deathmatch, Nukem Comics has many other projects in the works so keep your eyes peeled for other ventures that may soon appear on the production horizon! As avenue that welcomes creators with interesting ideas, Nukem Comics stands as a collaborative space. We want to help others bring their ideas to life and are entirely open to proposals andcreative input for new project ideas!Now with our new graphic novel CODED we are pushing a brand new take on the zombie genre. Come see the horror unfolds in this zombie apocalypse story!ArtistsPencil ArtistRodel NooraInker/Colorist Alzir Alves, lives in Brazil, founder of the school of visual arts Rascunho Studio, as well as a comic book artist and colorist, he also works as an art teacher. For over 15 years he has been working with comics and books. He went through several projects and publishers such as: Red Dragon Publisher, Grafset Publishers, Jester Press Comics, Monarch Comics, Big Dog Ink, Phl Interferon Sourse, Silver Fox Comics, Upper Deck Company in the production of Cards for Marvel Comics, Guará Entertainment, Jezebel, Carbon, Mirage Water Chaos, 2nd Coming Comix, TAFU, World of Superheroes, NeS publisher, Jambô publishers, Pooblicão and TimBerwolf Entertainment.Alzir has a known career in Brazil and other countries. Currently, the artist is on the Nukem Comics project. Co-WriterTaylor Smith is a freelance content writer with close to a decade of experience. As part of the Nukem Comics team, she assists in stitching together the storyline and forming dialogue to bring the badass stories to life.Lettering LetterSquids is a comic letterer and graphic designer based in Connecticut. They have projects with Scout Comics, Action Lab, Advent Comics, Insight Editions and tons of amazing indie creators.LetterSquids is a comic letterer and graphic designer based in Connecticut. We want this project to be incredible and every little bit helps. Plus, you will be kickass in doing so!Thank You!None of this would be possible without all of our supporters. We thank you from the bottom of our hearts.​

story:
Short Summary

 THE VAMPIRE VERSES: BLOOD RITES SKETCHBOOK/ART BOOK is a 32 page saddle stitched comic that includes art and sketches from The Vampire Verses series by Frank Forte. The art ranges from 1995 to present day with character studies, cover studies, renders, creature design, environment design, pin-ups and more. The book hopes to reintroduce fans to the series and be a prelude to the continuation of The Vampire Verses #5-#12.

THE VAMPIRE VERSES HISTORY

The Vampire Verses is a vampire/horror comic that I created in 1994 and was published in 1995 by CFD productions (Formerly Cry For Dawn) and then Asylum Press in 1999 and beyond. The series was inspired by many anime series at the time including Wicked City, Demon City Shinjuku and Urotsukidōji: Legend of the Overfiend. I was also inspired by comic creators Berni Wrightson, Tim Vigil, Kelley Jones, Mike Mignola and others. I attempted to use all of these influences and create something of my own. What erupted from my hand and mind was The Vampire Verses.

THE VAMPIRE VERSES SYNOPSIS:

The debut issue introduces Angelika, an exotic dancer in the NYC club scene who is unwittingly turned into a creature of the night. As she tries to make sense of what she has become she learns of a bloody Vampire War that is being fought in the streets and subway tunnels of New York City. Slowly the truth unfolds as Angelika begins to realize she is a key part of an ancient scrolled prophecy known as The Vampire Verses.

It was difficult for me to make a living in comics in the 90s so I decided to move to film and animation and became a storyboard artist where the pay was higher and the income more stable. There I have worked on show such as: Lovecraft Country, Fantasy Island, Solar Opposites, Dreamwork’s 3Below, Bob’s Burgers, Insidious 4, Lego: Guardians of the Galaxy, Despicable Me 2, Lego Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Out, The Super Hero Squad Show, Marvel Heroes 4D, and Lego Hero Factory.

Now that time as passed I realize my true love is with making comics. I am seeking help from fans of comics, horror and vampires to help fund the final issues and sketchbooks of The Vampire Verses.

THE PERKS

ADD-ON PERKS

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need the funds to help us with the printing and shipping of our Sketchbook
  • Any extra funds will be used to promote and advertise the comic
  • We will use extra funds in the production of Vampire Verses #5

The Impact

The vampire Verses was a very popular Horror comic in the mid-Nineties in the middle of the Black and White horror and BadGirl boom.

  • Your help and funds will help us bring the series back to the world.
  • Asylum Press will assist in bring a collected TPB to the masses.
  • The Individual issues of THE VAMPIRE VERSES #5-12 will all be crowdfunded.

Risks & Challenges

Having successfully completed and fulfilled several Kickstarters to date through my personal KS, I'm not too concerned by any risks involved in this production except raising the proper funds to print. The Book is completely done, so once funding is complete I will send to my printer and from there only takes one week. Then one more week to sign books, pack, fulfill and ship. Aside from a meteor hitting the Earth, this should be extremely straight forward. The books themselves are complete, and additional production work brought about for this campaign can be completed in a timely fashion for a Late March 2021 release.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please help to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Share on Social, Instagram and Twitter--every little bit helps.

Thanks

Frank Forte

story:
Hi, I’m Jeremy Haun.

Over the past twenty years, I’ve worked for almost every comic book company in the industry. During that time I’ve had the chance to work on many of my favorite characters like Batman, Batwoman, Captain America, Iron Man, and so many more.

As much as I love telling stories about the superheroes we all know and love, my heart is really in creating my own worlds-- telling my own stories, like The Beauty, The Realm, and The Red Mother.

Over the past year and a half, the pandemic changed our world. It was a tough time for us all. The comics industry went “pencils down,” leaving writers and artists without work. Projects were put on hold. Schedules changed in big ways. Plans had to change.

Like so many of us, that was tough for me. Both in my personal life and on a global scale, uncertainty reigned.

I went from an overfull schedule to having to reevaluate everything. I realized that for me, the thing that truly keeps me tethered is telling stories-- making things.

And that’s how HAUNTHOLOGY was born.

 

I channeled all of the confusion, loneliness, isolation, anger, and fear I was feeling—that WE ALL were feeling—and told short horror stories that dealt with that. I made stories about nightmares, monsters, and post-apocalyptic landscapes-- over 20 in all.

Sitting alone in my studio, I wrote, drew, and lettered every single page of HAUNTHOLOGY. I put everything into these stories. And honestly? It’s the best thing I’ve ever made.

I’m proud to share this book with you. Over the past year it has been my therapy.

I believe that horror takes a look at the world around us and comments on it. It’s also about ghosts and madmen, but these are also personal stories filled with emotion and reflection.

I’m pulling out all the stops to make HAUNTHOLOGY as epic as possible.

The Kickstarter campaign was an incredible success, unlocking more pages, more stories and all kinds of cool variants and fun add-ons. 

 

 

HAUNTHOLOGY is a beautiful, oversized black-and-white hardcover short story comic book collection of 176 pages.

Every story in this collection was completely written, drawn, and lettered by me. Each step of creating these short stories was both a passion and learning experience. It was me making comics without compromise AND becoming a better storyteller along the way.

 

HERE’S WHAT YOU’LL GET

A 176 page oversized HARDCOVER (8.123” x 11.74") with wood-free paper interior pages.
 

23 1-15 page original short stories—nearly 100 pages in all.
 

Over 40 pages of behind the scenes bonus features, including layouts, scripts, designs, commentary, and more!

Includes a sewn in ribbon bookmark and spot gloss.

 

 

We've also got 2 Variant Covers to choose from as well as some special editions like the Slipcase Edition and Leather Edition (Limited to 200).

The ANCIENT TOME Variant Cover

 

The NOIR Variant Cover

 

Slipcase Edition

 

Limited Leather Edition

 

IT’S FINISHED!

HAUNTHOLOGY is finished! That’s right. Finished. There’s no waiting for this to be written, drawn, and lettered. All the work is done.

With the exception of minor design elements, completion of bonus material, and the addition of any extra short stories or unlocked pages added during this campaign, HAUNTHOLOGY is ready to go.

Here’s a preview of the finished pages:

 

 

*Please note: due to time constraints, Bonus Story2 and Bonus Story3 may appear in Haunthology Volume 2. 

 

So you found your tier, but still want that sweet t-shirt or enamel pin? Add ons make that easy.

After you select your Tier, you can add any of the items from the list below and customize your rewards exactly the way you want.

 

Okay, look...shipping is OUTRAGEOUS right now. Truly. ESPECIALLY if you live outside of the States. There’s no getting around that.

I’ve done everything I can to seek out the most affordable shipping method for all countries. It’s better...but still not great.

If the cost of shipping means that you can’t support HAUNTHOLOGY, I completelyunderstand. I still appreciate you, your support, and while it's not a physical copy, I hope that you'll at least consider the digital version of the book. 

Here’s a quick, easy breakdown of shipping by zone/region--

 

I’ve been lucky enough to be able to tell stories in the comics industry for twenty years now. I’m INCREDIBLY grateful for that.

This past year was hard. It changed so much for all of us. When the comics industry went pencils down, I went from knowing what the next year of my life and finances looked like...to absolute uncertainty.

During that time I was on my own. During that time I saw my community-- YOU, my friends and fans step up, say that you love my work, and show me support. Because of that, I chose to make HAUNTHOLOGY as special as possible. 

While I created all of the stories for HAUNTHOLOGY, I didn’t build this project on my own. I’m absolutely grateful to the team of kind, giving, creative people that helped me bring this project to life. They worked tirelessly to help edit, film, design, organize, and prepare this project for you. They kept me going and...mostly sane throughout this process.

 

Jeremy Haun is a comic book writer and artist and the creator of THE BEAUTY and THE REALM, from Image comics, as well as THE RED MOTHER for BOOM! Studios, and 40 SECONDS for Comixology. Over his twenty years in comics he has worked for nearly every publisher in the industry.  Jeremy resides in a crumbling mansion in Joplin, Missouri with his wife, two sons, and an orange cat.  Jeremy has created two successful Kickstarter campaigns-- BAD KARMA (as part of the BAD KARMA collective) and DINO DAY.Jeremy Haun is a comic book writer and artist and the creator of THE BEAUTY and THE REALM, from Image comics, as well as THE RED MOTHER for BOOM! Studios, and 40 SECONDS for Comixology. Over his twenty years in comics he has worked for nearly every publisher in the industry.  Jeremy resides in a crumbling mansion in Joplin, Missouri with his wife, two sons, and an orange cat.  Jeremy has created two successful Kickstarter campaigns-- BAD KARMA (as part of the BAD KARMA collective) and DINO DAY.

 

The banner name for the award-winning comics work of designer Steven Finch, 'Fonografiks' has provided lettering and graphic design to a number of creator-owned titles, including NOWHERE MEN, INJECTION, MAESTROS, THE BEAUTY, BIG GIRLS, and the multi-award winning SAGA.

 

Joel Enos is a writer and editor of stories, comics, and manga. His comics writing includes BEN 10:OMNIVERSE and SONIC THE HEDGEHOG. His short fiction has been published by FLAPPERHOUSE, DISTURBED DIGEST, CAST OF WONDERS, and YEAR’S BEST ADULT SPECULATIVE FICTION. His editing work includes THE BEAUTY, THE REALM, UNEARTH, and REGRESSION and multiple English editions of many best-selling manga series including NARUTO, POKÈMON, and THE LEGEND OF ZELDA.

 

Amber Stone is a watercolor artist, designer and sometimes writer who loves all things cute and creepy. When she's not painting in her living room, she can be found helping out in Jeremy's Studio doing anything from ink fills to video editing. Amber has created two successful Kickstarter campaigns-- HALLOWTINES and I'M VACCINATED. She is currently working on a third.

 

Ashton is a videographer who loves to connect with artists, local businesses, and individuals to help tell their stories. He serves as the video director for the Joplin Toad Magazine and runs a personal youtube channel too. You will often find Ashton with people, as he loves a good conversation and genuinely cares. As a freelancer, he is hard-working, flexible, and resilient to changes. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Risks and challenges

As of the start of this project, I will have almost all story and design content finished and ready to go. Another thing that will help immensely on this project is that since we've done this before, we know what to expect on fulfillment and have a much better idea of the amount of work and time needed!

While we strive to make sure that everything is as close to our prototypes and mockups as possible, there may be some differences in the actual product. Please keep in mind that many of the items in this campaign are hand-made so slight variations between individual products is expected.

Due to differences in computer colors, actual items may vary in color from what you see on your screen. 

There is always the possibility of unforeseen events causing delays (I've learned to just roll with it over the past year... I think we all have.) but I will be updating Backers with any delays in the unlikely event that they should arise.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Finally, I want to take an extra moment to thank YOU for helping bring HAUNTHOLOGY to life. The truth is that without you and your support, projects like HAUNTHOLOGY can’t happen.

As much as this project helped me during a tough year, it needs to be seen, read, and shared. I’m excited to do that.

And if you know of someone who loves comics, horror, or short stories—someone who might dig this—please share it with them. Sharing these projects with friends, family, and on social media is how these projects grow and get made.

Let’s do this together.

Due to differences in computer colors, actual items may vary in color from what you see on your screen. 
There is always the possibility of unforeseen events causing delays (I've learned to just roll with it over the past year... I think we all have.) but I will be updating Backers with any delays in the unlikely event that they should arise.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Finally, I want to take an extra moment to thank YOU for helping bring HAUNTHOLOGY to life. The truth is that without you and your support, projects like HAUNTHOLOGY can’t happen.
As much as this project helped me during a tough year, it needs to be seen, read, and shared. I’m excited to do that.
And if you know of someone who loves comics, horror, or short stories—someone who might dig this—please share it with them. Sharing these projects with friends, family, and on social media is how these projects grow and get made.
Let’s do this together.

story:
Help Me Publish My Nemo 3,000 Comic Book!

I'm @theauthorbot on Instagram, and I've been drawing comics for years. My new project is a mashup: I want to combine the whimsical, ornate storytelling of Winsor McCay's Little Nemo in Slumberland with the grungy, dystopian world-building of 90s comics like Sleepwalker, Batman Beyond and Spider-Man 2099. If you back my IndieGoGo, you get "behind the scenes" access to my creative process, where you can watch me go through the steps of writing, drawing, marketing and finally publishing the first issue of Nemo 3,000!

Cartooning Is Not My Day Job

I love comics, and I've been drawing them as a hobby for as long as I can remember! Since my baby was born last year, I haven't had as much time to work on this stuff as I used to, so I have to make every project count. Many of my comics are free to read on Instagram, and I've built a small but devoted following there who enjoy my offbeat, surreal brand of storytelling. Many of these readers have asked when I would publish an actual, physical comic book that they could buy and hold in their hands. Well, today is the day! I'm going to use the funds from this IndieGoGo campaign to publish a comic book that I can then sell copies of.  

What You Get

Backers at the $2 and up level will get email or Instagram updates on how the book is coming along.

Backers at the $5 level and up will get access to an exclusive Instagram page, where I will post EXCLUSIVE photos, videos, and full pages as I complete them. This will really be an immersive "behind the scenes" experience, where you can see not just how I make the comic book, but my marketing strategies, the hurdles I face, how I deal with publishing, etc. I haven't done a campaign like this before, so if you're interested in how self-publishing a comic book works, you can join at this level and learn right along with me!

Backers at the $10 level will get the previous benefits, as well as a digital copy of Nemo 3,000 #1 when it is completed!

Backers at the $15 level will get a physical copy of the comic book shipped to them when it's completed, as well as a digital copy and all previous benefits.

Backers at the $60 level will get a piece of original art from the comic book shipped to them, in addition to all other benefits! (Limited to 12 backers)

What The Book Will Look Like

The book will be 24 pages, plus cover. I color my pages traditionally, rather than digitally: some pages may be in black and white or partial color, for stylistic purposes. Approximately four of these pages will be reimaginings of some of McCay's original strips, and the other pages will be a more modern type of comic book storytelling. Check out my work at www.instagram.com/theauthorbot to see more examples of my cartooning style!

story:
LUCIO'S FIERCE VAMPIRELLA VARIANT IS SHIPPING NOW!

We're happy to report that Lucio's beautiful Vampirella Variant has begun shipping!  We've also sent the designated stock out for signing and grading so those autographed and CGC graded respective copies are in the works.  As soon as we get the various pieces in-house we will continue to ship them out to all the awesome supporters of this project.  Thank you for supporting this rare Lucio Parrillo painted cover and watch out for more shipping updates!

 

 

STRETCH GOAL ACHIEVED! 

EVERYONE ORDERING AT THE PRINT LEVEL WILL RECEIVE THIS EXCLUSIVE PROMOTIONAL TRADING CARD FEATURING LUCIO'S BEAUTIFUL VAMPIRELLA PAINTING!

 

TALENTED PAINTER, LUCIO PARRILLO, IS WORKING ON A BRAND-NEW COVER TO DYNAMITE'S FAVORITE VAMPIRE!

Also available straight from the printer, CGC "slabbed" copies graded at 9.6 or higher! Order them on their own or look for them as an add-on to your order during checkout.

Vampirella is one of Lucio Parrillo's favorite characters and he's been working on a new painting that will become the next limited edition cover. Lucio doesn't do just "ordinary" covers, every one of his covers comes from a completely unique painting he's painstakingly crafted for comic fans.

Lucio Parrillo is an Italian painter who's been doing comics for Dynamite for nearly a decade and has a long list of additional comic book credits, including Marvel and DC. He's also known for illustrating for some of the gaming community's biggest names like Dungeons & Dragons, and Magic: The Gathering.

During this difficult time of quarantine, Lucio calls attention to the troubles facing the comic industry and its artists, by offering his most recent painting as a premium, collectible cover for the recent issue, Vampirella #10. The series is written by Christopher Priest, with interior art by Ergun Gunduz. 

CREATORS NEED YOUR HELP

The COVID-19 pandemic has affected the entire world in a variety of ways and the comics industry is a market that's suffering greatly right now. With comic shops forced to close their doors for safety, and their main source of distribution on hiatus, publishers and creators are feeling the strain. The passion of comic readers has always been a driving force for the comics business, but direct, online support from fans is now essential to the current state of the business, right now. If the comic industry is going to survive this pandemic, the fans will be the ones keeping creators and publishers in business!

Add a signed or unsigned lithograph to your order during checkout and have Lucio's work ready to frame on your wall. 

The lithograph is printed on #100 Euro Silk White paperstock at 18x24".

story:
Hello!

My name is Chris Campana. I'm a Ringo nominated artist/writer who has worked on TMNT, Vampirella, Lady Death,  Pathfinder, Tellos, as well  quite a few creator owned titles. 

So, now...why you're here! 

The Adventures of Parker Reef

This story is about Parker's dream to see his father (me) in this world. Parker and his mother (my girlfriend) passed away a little over 2 years ago.  Parker is compelled to  follow his dreams and that is exactly what he attempts to do in Part 1.

In the book, souls are the rarest of treasures. Parker, a child lost, is the purest and rarest of all. Known as a forever soul, he is most coveted by the evil that exists within his world. Parker,  who  is 14 in the book (the date they passed)  struggles to understand why he and his mother were taken away from all who loved them. In Adventures of Parker Reef part 1, he longs to ask me those questions, and to understand loss and the pain it brings. To even try and get those answers, Parker must set off on a secret adventure, through a treacherous land known as the Nothing. Within the Nothing,  all lost souls and those souls that remain of people who did evil on this world, exist. A coveted "gift", Parker will have to navigate his way through these evil lands, in hopes of making it to me.  Armed with only some items his mother has given him  (after passing) from my studio, he sets off on his quest! I cant tell you more, Ill ruin part 1 if you havent read it! 

Now, Part 2! 

"Adventures" part 2, picks up right where part 1 ends...sorta.

Without giving too much away, part 2 is more about how Parker deals with the repercussions of all the events in part 1. He must make his way home, to his mother...however, that journey back is way more treacherous than he could imagine. In a sense, the word is out and every evil being knows what he has learned and plans on using that knowledge aginst him and his traveling companion-James, the Boston Terrier!

With the funds raised for Adventures part 2,we will not only make the best book we can, but  we will also continue our work with Taninasreef.org, a non profit started last year that helps children and families in need. We have used funds so far for toy drives, baby shower gifts and much more. A portion of this campaign will go directly toward the non profit. 

Adventures part 1 started as a book to somehow wrap my head around the loss of my girlfriend Tana and our newborn son, Parker Reef, on March 14, 2018. What it turned into, however, was a book that meant so much to so many. I never really knew what this book would mean to people. I was (and in a lot of ways, still am) so lost after they passed away, I just wanted somehow to keep them alive. 

Since I am a working comic artist, this medium seemed the best way to do it

Thank you so much for checking out this campaign

story:
Hello, and thank you for visiting our Indiegogo campaign.

We are Ignition Comics and we are launching our debut comic "Rapture" in September, but we need your help to make that happen. Much like most of you, we are simply people with a dream. We want to tell stories and entertain people, unfortunately it is an expensive task to do so. This is not merely a "fly by night" project or a one shot comic. This will be a long term project involving many stories in a vast world where the line between hero and villain is blurred and, sometimes, non-existent.


Money donated to our Indiegogo campaign will go towards print costs for our extra special issue #0 (standard and variant covers) and our spectacular 32 page issue #1 as well as 2 promotional posters and other advertising materials necessary for our launch at Granite State Comic Con in September.

Here is the breakdown of where the money you donate will be used:

Print costs: $1,455 per 1000 issues (standard and variant covers) = $2,910.00

Posters: $199.00 per 500 (2 poster styles) = $398.00

Convention materials (business cards, handouts, banners, table): $1,500.00

The final 1,192.00 will go toward the production costs for issue #1.

We are not looking for a hand out, simply your assistance in bringing this project to life.


When a comet changes the structure of the world, those who survive will find the powers they yield will propel them into a war of survival vs. supremacy. It's a story about heroes, villains and what it means to be either...or both.

The story takes place 10 years after the impact of a comet that left humanity on the verge of extinction. Fallout from the event left survivors with a strange energy coursing through their bodies. An energy that, when exposed to the proper conditions, gives that person extraordinary abilities...

...but what happens when the power runs out?

This is Rapture; a new original story by author Corey Sawyer who has teamed up with veteran comic book artist Hannibal King (Grendel, Green Arrow, Excalibur, Hellena), colorist Iwan Joko Triyono (Those Shadow People) and emmy award winning story editor Kurt Bergeron, with whom the story's characters were developed. 

Rapture represents 2 years of development by some of the hardest working people in the industry. Thousands of man hours have gone into this project to bring you a rich, compelling story that will make you laugh and cry, horrify and delight, all in equal measure, for years to come.

I can promise you, this is like nothing you've ever read before.

Here are the promotional posters for Rapture. The poster on the right is the variant cover and will be a Granite State Comic Con exclusive. The only way to get your hands on that cover, is as a poster via this campaign!



Most importantly, from the depths of our hearts, we want to thank you.

If you've donated money, thank you from the depths of our souls. You have contributed in the execution of a childhood dream. Words can not express the gratitude that we feel toward you. If we ever meet at a convention, you will get a great big hug (hugs are free).

If you can not donate money, we thank you for spending some time with us. If you would be so kind as to share our campaign on your social media pages, you will also be rewarded with one big hug (also free).


And please, come like us on facebook.


This is our passion, we invite you to be a part of it.


Welcome to Rapture.

story:
Who We Are, What We Do

Meet Allison, Zi, Jo, Mikayla, and Alice. Together we are the "Eaves drop" team!

We are five high school students who have a strong passion for arts and crafts. In fact, we love it so much that we are planning to share it with others in the form of selling our work at a fan convention called Anime North this year in May. Some things we are planning to sell are character posters, key chains, button pins, bookmarks, post cards, earrings, yarn dolls and lots more! 

We are offering rewards that are similar to what we are planning to sell, but they will be LIMITED EDITION in thanks to our supporters.

What We Need 

Selling at an artist alley is a complicated and costly process; things to consider include: convention badges, table rental, arts and crafts materials, display and set up and printing fees. We did our math and it averaged to around $450 dollars per person, with the rest of the money going to group investments such as purchasing a button machine and renting the table for the weekend.

What You Get: Rewards

$5 donations 

  • Small doodle of your favorite character  (chibis are o.k, no NSFW, example works for each member are in the gallery or their art blog on tumblr linked above in the introduction)
$10 donations 
  • 1 Limited Edition Art Postcard  of your choice mailed to you (Examples are at the bottom)
  • 1 Unique Thank-You Note on the back addressed to you!

$25 donations

  • 1 Limited Edition Small Art Print of your choice signed and mailed to you (see gallery for selection)
  • 1 Hand Made 'teru bozu' (Japanese rain warding charms, also our mascots!
$40 donations

  • 1 Limited Edition Premium Print or  3 Limited Edition Small Prints of your choice signed and mailed to you (see our gallery for selection)
  • 1 Custom Made "teru bozu' (Japanese rain warding charms, also our mascots!)
VIP donations (50$+) 

  • 5-Pack of Limited Edition Small prints or 1 Limited Edition Premium Print+ 2 Limited Edition Small Prints
  • 1+ Custom Made* "teru bozu"  (Japanese rain warding charms, also our mascots!) 
  • VIP EXCLUSIVE (limited at 30 people) : Full color  character commission of anything of your choice (certain limitations do apply on matters such as 18+ material) 
*For every additional 10$ added, you may request another "teru bozu"


Donations 25$ and over will get an honorable mention in our credits listing when the event is over. We will also share with all of you the photos of that day!

Limited Edition Post Card Choices (more designs incoming):
Example no. 1 By Allison



Example no. 2 By Jo


Example no. 3 By Mikayla


Limited Edition Small Prints (more designs incoming):

Example no.1 By Alice



Limited Edition Premium Prints (More incoming):

Example no. 1 By Zi

Example no. 2 By Allison


 

~Thank you~

First of all, thank you for reading through our story!

Helping us out isn't limited to pledging to us; promoting our project to your friends and family also helps a lot. In fact, if you refer someone who decides to pledge $25 or more, we will also send you a post card for FREE :)


Have a nice day and see you at Anime North 2015!!!

story:
Short Summary

Naomi Deinhart is an interstellar smuggler for the pirate organization known as Swalina. She's also discovering she has a slowly budding burden of a power that causes any male in her vicinity to become annoyingly enamored, enthralled, entranced, and infatuated with her, often times getting in the way of successfully completing a mission.

Drawing inspiration from Star Wars, Jackie Brown, Five Ghosts, and Captain Marvel (DeConnick's run with Marvel), Muse is a pulpy and adventurous feminist space epic by Brentt Harshman (writer, Weaselmeizters), Rowel Roque (artist), Ronson Edulan (colorist), and Jake Caputo (letterer) and it needs YOUR help.

What We Need & What You Get

To cut to the chase, comics are an expensive thing to make. From funding artists, colorists, and letterers to various costs that may arise, it takes a lot. This isn't hard when the project is backed by Marvel or DC or a company willing to pay for the creation, as well as pay the writer, but most indie companies and independent releases are funded by the creators themselves.

Such is the case here.

I, Brentt Harshman, am funding this project. It's tough but it's something I truly believe in and it's a story I absolutely love. Something with heart and a message but something that is also just a fun journey. An escape. Unfortunately, each issue is costing me upwards of $2,000 and, as somebody who works a barely-full-time cafe job and lives in one of the most expensive cities in the world, it's stressing me out. I'm paying for what I can, living barebones, but a little help would be nice.

One of my other projects, Weaselmeizters, recently met a smaller IndieGoGo campaign goal of $2,000 which helped us fund barcodes and a physical release of issue 1. While nice, in retrospect I regret us only asking for that small an amount and only using those funds to pay for physical prints of one issue.

Taking what I learned from Weaselmeizters, I'm looking to use the funds earned through this campaign to fund the FIRST FIVE ISSUES of Muse. That's the entire first arc. That's also a lot of money.

$12,000

I know. A lot.

But, it's worth it and it's a story I absolutely, 100% believe in.

Where is that money going? Mainly, the pockets of my team members. Everyone is excited to work on this but, in the long run, this IS work and they require payment. Any good artist or designer charges for their time and the team behind me on Muse is worth every penny.

Any remaining money, if we meet the 12,000 dollar goal, will go towards various costs that may pop up. Any remaining money after that will go towards future issues of Muse. Every single penny goes towards development.

But, you get something out of this as well! From personalized sketches to characters named after you to personalized short stories or being drawn in the background of a future scene, we're going to try to make it worth your every penny. I'll even throw in personalized gifts from my own apartment at a certain amount.

If we DON'T meet the goal, we're happy and thankful for any penny earned. Whatever is raised goes towards paying my team and getting as many pages and/or issues completed and ready for print. I will pay out of pocket for any remaining costs.

The Impact

If I was funding this out of my pocket alone, I'd be lucky to meet a bi-monthly (every other month) deadline. With your help, my team and I can crank out the first five issues and do a monthly release of them, as well as start working on issues 6-10.

But WHY should YOU help? Well, because you're all attractive and nice and smart and cool. But also becuase it's a story you will enjoy reading with art you will enjoy consuming. It's a story that is pure fun but also has a deeper message and meaning. It's the best thing I've written and the most fun I've had as a writer and I guarrantee you will enjoy each issue.

With Weaselmeizters we have released a new issue every other month, issue 3 should be heading to the printers within a week or two, and it all started with a successful IndieGoGo campaign. Was it flawed? Yes. Could we have asked for more and used the money differently? Yes. Those are lessons I've learned. Those are lessons I've applied to this.

Risks & Challenges

I know it's tough to look at your paycheck and justify spending $x.xx of your hard earned money on funding an ENTIRE arc of a comic book series. It's hard enough for direct family members to justify that, harder on friends, harder on aquaintances, and even harder on strangers who stumble upon this or click on a shared link on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, Instagram, whatever.

Money is hard to come by and what you spend it on is even harder to decide. And, spending it on a crowdfunding campaign is a tough decision to make, especially when it seems like a new one is popping up every single day for a new project from your favorite filmmaker or game designer or comics creator. And, to trust that money with somebody who is still relatively new to the scene and still working on making this less of a hobby and more of a career...well, I know it's a difficult decision is what I'm saying.

But, I appreciate it. Even if you can't commit to a FIVE DOLLAR DONATION, I appreciate your reading and sharing this. Seriously.

I know I'm asking for a lot here and I know it's hard to see what good your five dollars will do with a goal of $12,000, but trust me when I say every penny counts and I'll make sure to reward EVERY. PENNY. EARNED.

As soon as the first issue is finished, I will be shipping off pitches to various independent distributors. If nobody bites, each issue will be independently produced and distributed (much like with Weaselmeizters). However, if a company DOES bite, we will work hard to make sure Muse reaches the stands and your hands every month, in a timely fashion. We will also make sure to keep you in the loop on everything Muse and everything Naomi Deinhart.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, I get it. Money is hard to come by and, what little money you DO happen to come across, it should go towards bills and you. I get that. I get that not everybody has FIVE DOLLARS to spare.

It's perfectly fine.

If you can't help with funding but you still want to be of assistance, simply sharing this campaign on your FACEBOOK, TWITTER, TUMBLR, INSTAGRAM, VINE, WHATEVER is appreciated. Any way to get word out about this project.

Simply press the buttons below (or whereever they are) to share them where you want to share them.

Or, paste the link to an email and send it to your buddies or your families or that billionaire playboy philanthropist you met on a jungle expedition two years ago. Any way you can spread the word is appreciated.

Thank you so much, lets get Muse made.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Naomi Deinhart is an interstellar smuggler for the pirate organization known as Swalina. She's also discovering she has a slowly budding burden of a power that causes any male in her vicinity to become annoyingly enamored, enthralled, entranced, and infatuated with her, often times getting in the way of successfully completing a mission.
Drawing inspiration from Star Wars, Jackie Brown, Five Ghosts, and Captain Marvel (DeConnick's run with Marvel), Muse is a pulpy and adventurous feminist space epic by Brentt Harshman (writer, Weaselmeizters), Rowel Roque (artist), Ronson Edulan (colorist), and Jake Caputo (letterer) and it needs YOUR help.
What We Need & What You Get
To cut to the chase, comics are an expensive thing to make. From funding artists, colorists, and letterers to various costs that may arise, it takes a lot. This isn't hard when the project is backed by Marvel or DC or a company willing to pay for the creation, as well as pay the writer, but most indie companies and independent releases are funded by the creators themselves.

story:
Intro

Hello everybody, NoOneComics here!

First, let us welcome and thank you for checking out this page, with this campaign hopefully we'll give life to a new  On-Going series called Blood Brothers ;  an action, gore and comedy book wrapped out in all sorts of pop culture references, all for the mere sake of having fun.

So, go ahead and read...

Blood Brothers is an On-Going series , each issue containing the standard 22 pages of comics with occasional 6 pages back up bonus features, the book is in black and white with gray tones, and  each issue is set to have an auto conclusive adventure while leaving a cliffhanger in the end to segue into the next issue, also there is a two page fan letter/editorial column that gets inside the details of the creation of every issue and picks up little winks or hidden messages you might have missed *.

*yeah there are hidden messages or funny details in some pages

This project has been in the works for many years so I'll let you know that the first three issues of the comic are done, with numbers four to six already written, hopefully and if you like this we are ready to release a lot of stuff in the future, with plans of TPB with issues 1 to 6 plus extras!

I did and interview some time ago that details that history , if you are super curious you will find that note here

Quite simply one of the most hilarious comics you will find out there, we took the usual clichés from comic book, movies, video games, music (namely heavy metal and classic rock, of course) and put them through our filter just to make the resulting characters do bizarre stuff.

You can think of it as South Park meets Happy Tree Friends with a bit of manga plus mainstream super hero comics... is all there, you will recognize it as a true comic fan I’m sure you are,  but in an entirely different shape, that , rest assured, was created to entertain (shock) you.

This is not that PG13 Expendables movie...oh hell no!

Check out some samples below, but in case you want to know a bit more, there is a 12 page preview ready for you waiting in this tapastic location or if you prefer on this issuu location.

I don't want to spoil the book, but the cast of characters will be rotating on each issue, of course adding members of the family, losing and recovering others, etc. it's very much a pokemon-esque kind of stuff...I'm already spoiling! Carry on!


 

The bad guys...so far.

These are the main villains up to issue 3, I'm not spoiling anything else, promise.

Nuclear Dad, the irresponsible father of the (many) creatures, weapon dealer and uber rich entrepreneur, he is also very greedy and doesn’t like to share..much less give alimonies

Annihilation Squadron N 6, a group of trained girls that act as overdue payment collectors, think of the IRS in spandex.

Luke, the leader of the weaponry dealership, somebody owes him money. A lot!.

52% of the funds raised will go towards having 500 copies of issue 1 and 2 printed, also

all the funding for printing stickers and the T-shirts and Hats comes from here.

28% will cover the costs of shipping these books to the backers.

10% to cover remaining production cost (lettering, colors)

10% will go towards Indie Gogo's fees.

Risks and challenges

The book is already done, that is written, drawn , gray toned, to be precise, sixty four pages of art needed for the first two issues regarding this campaign.

there is only lettering left that I'm letting in hands of the expert so everything looks perfect for you to read and enjoy.

theres also the cover colors left to do, other than that all colors are done.

So you better believe that those PDF files be hitting your email as soon as the funding is done.

On the print side, taking consideration of all possible delays, postage, shipping , data and whatnot; the dates we are aiming for the perks (Feb - Mar 2016) are worst case scenarios dates.

And of course the other risk is that you like it so much we put issue 3 already ha!

story:
About Ranger

Listen up, recruit! Come on a journey with us as we follow a squadron of US Army Rangers making their way through the harsh Middle-Eastern terrain filled with even harsher enemies!

 

 

Ranger is a blend of classical western and historically significant events through the lens of the modern day Middle Eastern conflict. It explores betrayal, survival, mortality and redemption based on the international drug trade. Step into the shoes of our cast of characters as they show you that even in the midst of desolation, humanity can still give us hope!

 

 

This story is inspired by classic American Western paradigms that hopes to blend accurate historical events with fiction to create a captivating and historically important experience. Our vision is for the first volume is to give readers an introduction to this series and allow them to experience the first story arc from start to finish.

 

 

 

Ranger is a comic series developed by Thomas Chillemi and A. Goldberg (Historical Consultant), with the art team of Jann Galino, Chuck Michael Obach, Santiago Ramos, Jeffery Huet and Bruce Dwayne. This team has poured their heart and soul into this comic and cannot wait to share it with the world!



What We Need & What You Get

Our funding goal is $5,000 to release this story arc for the world to see! This Ranger Trade will contain issues 1-6 (~148 pages)

Funding Perks: 

  • Tier 1: $10 - Downloadable Ranger wallpaper
  • Tier 2: $20 - Ranger PDF Download (+ Tier 1 perks)
  • Tier 3: $30 - Receive your very own copy of the Ranger Trade Collection (+ Tier 2 perks)
  • Tier 4: $50 - Ranger T-Shirt (+ Tier 3 perks)
  • Tier 5: $100 - Pop Mahn exclusive signed limited edition print (+Tier 4 perks)
  • Tier 6: $200 - Your name included in the foreword (+Tier 5 perks)

If we do not reach our funding goal, all funds will still go towards this project. Every bit helps!

 

The Impact

This story is too compelling to remain divided as a single comic series. It draws strong parallels to today's politically motivated events and should be digested in a single reading to truly unveil the underlying themes and why they're so important in today's world. We want to show people that those in combat are real people with real problems and we want to be able to deliver that in an engaging way. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially but still wish to support our vision, you can share this campaign with your friends and family! Getting the word out is equally as important!



➡️ Check us out on Facebook for updates on this and other projects!
